title: Strike Closes British Mint
description: LONDON, April 6 (UPI)Workers shut Britain's Royal Mint today in a strike to protest plans to move operations of the 159yearold coin factory to Wales.

title: Pollution Agency Urged
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 (AP) Senator Edmund S. Muskie, Democrat of Maine, proposed to day creation of an independent Environmental Quality Admin istration to develop and enforce all Federal antipollution stand ards. The Senator said that pollution controls and abate ment procedures were scattered through many departments and agencies. Some of these view it as their primary responsibility to promote the industry or product that causes much of the pollution, he said..

title: Controllers Lose Round
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 The Government won a major round today in its efforts to end the 13dayold walkout by Federal air traffic controllers after a day of bitter courtroom jousting between F. Lee. Bailey, the criminal lawyer from Bos ton, and Carl Eardley, a soft spoken Deputy Assistant At torney General.

title: KNEEL DOUBTFUL ON PAPER TALKS
description: Theodore W. Kheel, mediator in the city newspaper dispute, warned yesterday of a possible newspaper shutdown unless the impasse was resolved by the weekend.

title: Series Against Bucks Opens Here Saturday
description: The Knicks will begin their playoff series with the Mil waukee Bucks at 2 P.M. Saturday at Madison Square Garden, with the basketball court laid over the ice to be used for hockey that night and Sunday.

title: U.S. Judge Orders Kirk to Court Hearing Today on Possible Contempt
description: BRADENTON, Fla., April 6 The 17,000 public school stu dents in Manatee County on Florida's west coast went to their old schools today as Gov. Claude R. Kirk Jr. declared himself to be the county's chief school official and refused to obey a Federal court's racial integration order.

title: SEVENS THREATEN COLLEGE EIGHTS
description: Almost 100 colleges, Vassar and Wellesley included, have crew program and the number climbs each year. The oldest of the intercollegiate sports ap parently has never been more Popular.

title: Amex Prices Slip in Lightest Trading in 2 Weeks
description: Prices moved steadily down ward on the American Stock Exchange yesterday in the light est trading day in two weeks.

title: Vice Chairman Elected by G.M.
description: The election of Richard C. Gerstenberg as vice chairman of the board and chairman of the finance committee was announced yesterday by the General Motors Corporation.

title: 11 Committees Meet to Find Ways To Better Courts in 2 Boroughs
description: Eleven committees composed of 89 judges, lawyers and lay menmet here for the first time yesterday to begin devising methods to substantially im prove the overburdened and often malfunctioning courts of Manhattan and the Bronx.

title: Ministers Back Powell
description: Representative Adam Clayton Powell was endorsed by the Baptist Ministers Conference of New York yesterday in his bid for reelection. The 500mem ber conference gave vocal ap proval to the Harlem Democrat at the Convent Avenue Bapfist Church, 145th Street and Con vent Avenue.

title: BRAZIL TOPS CHILE IN CUP TENNIS, 32
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, April 6 (UPI).Tom Koch beat Jaime Fillol today in the final singles, 61, 63, 46, 46, 86, to give Brazil a 32 victory over Chile in the South American Davis CUD tennis semifinal.

title: Duck Dance Runs 6 Furlongs in 1:10, Wins by 6 Lengths
description: Duck Dance of the Hobeau Farm contributed the most im pessive performance on the program at Aqueduct yester day. Competing in a sprint that preceded the main event, Duck Dance sped to a sixlength triumph under the guidance of Johnny Ruane.

title: KRESGE SALES ROSE BY 31.3% IN MARCH
description: The S. S. Kresge Company, one of the country's latgest re tail chains, and three other chains reported substantial gains in sales for March over the same month a year ago.

title: S.E.C. View on Delisting Suporises Texas Concern
description: DALLAS, April 6 (UPI)  The Management of Intercon tinental Industries, Inc., said today it was surprised and dis appointed at news that the Securities and Exchange Com mission had approved delisting of the company's shares by the American Stock Exchange.

title: RANGERS SELL OUT IN LESS THAN HOUR
description: There were more ticketbuy ers than tickets at the Felt Forum yesterday as 2,000 seats for the Rangers' playoff games were sold in 40 minutes. In their wake, the mostly young crowd left broken police barri cades, dirty blankets, transis torradio batteries and brown paper bags stuffed with partly eaten sandwiches.

title: Captain Is Suspect in Family's Slaying
description: FORT BRAGG, N.C., April 6 (AP)The Army said today had advised Capt. Jeffrey R MacDonald that he would be questioned as a suspect in the slaying of his wife and two young daughters.

title: 300th Meeting at Panmunjom
description: PANMUNJOM, South Korea, April 6 (Reuters)The United Nations command and North Korea today exchanged charges of violations of the Korean armistice. It was their 300th meeting in the last 17 years.

title: Two Computer Concerns Continue Merger Talks
description: The Boothe Computer Cor poration and LevinTownsend Computer Corporation an nounced yesterday that they have signed a letter calling for continuation of negotiations for a possible merger or con solidation of the two computer leasing companies.

title: CARSWELL FOES LOSE SENATE TEST BY 8VOTE MARGIN
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 Senate opponents of Judge G. Harrold Carswell's Supreme Court nomination failed today, by a 44to52 vote, to recom mit the nomination to the Sen ate Judiciary Committee.

title: MOSCOW CONFIRMS 4 LEADERS ARE ILL
description: MOSCOW, April 6The So viet Government today con firmed reports that Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin had been hospitalized with influenza and that President Nigolai V. Pod gorny and two other members of the party's ruling Politburo were incapacitated because of illness.

title: Public Television Agencies Convene Here Tomorrow
description: Public television station and program managers from around the country will meet here from tomorrow through Friday for the 1970 Public Television Con ference.

title: Yale Gets Gift of $500,000 To Bolster Faculty Standard
description: NEW HAVEN, April 6A gift of $500,000 to Yale University by Mr. and Mrs. Edgar M. Cull man of New York and Stam ford, Conn., was announced to day by Kingman Brewster Jr., president of the university.

title: Quelling of College Protest Spurs 2d Demonstration
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., April 6 (AP)Helmeted policemen re moved about 20 white students from a Springfield College Ad ministrative building after a threehour demonstration to day. A short time later 200 students staged a second sit in.

title: Howard Johnson in Deal
description: The Howard Johnson Com pany said yesterday it had granted a 20year license to Restauranteles, S.A., a Mexican concern, to construct and oper ate in Mexico a chain of restau rants, hotels and motor lodges bearing the Howard Johnson's name. The Mexican company plans a chain of from 30 to 40 units in both resort and indus trial areas throughout the coun try, the Howard Johnson Com pany said.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Shocked and infuriated by the murder of its ambassador to Guatemala, West Germany moved to cut its diplomatic relations with Guatemala to a bare minimum yesterday. The chief of the West German mission and most of his aides were recalled and the Guatemalan envoy in Bonn was politely told that it was desirable that he leave the country. [Page 1, Column 2.]

title: Reversion to Banditry
description: The rash of political kidnappings that over the weekend brought death to the West German Ambas sador in Guatemala and injury to an American diplo mat in Brazil reflects, like the recent epidemic of aerial hijacking, a reversion to the conditions of ban ditry that infected and inhibited international life and travel in centuries past.

title: Hong Kong Hotel of Splendor Where the Dining Is Fine Art
description: HONG KONG  Unless you've wired or phoned or written or telegraphed in advance, one of the hardest things to come by at certain times of the year in Hong Kongoutside of an invitation to visit mainland China is a room at that monument across the harbor in Kowloon, the worldesteemed Peninsula Hotel.

title: Downstate Doctors Accused Of Improper Medicare Charges
description: Physicians at the Downstate Medical Center in Brooklyn were accused yesterday of hav ing improperly collected more than $750,000 for Medicare patients treated in one year at Kings County Hospital.

title: PATRICK J. DOURIS
description: Patrick J. Douris, chief prop erty man at Radio City Music Hall since 1941, died Friday in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived at 310 West 55th Street.

title: MUSEUM GETS WORK OF MARIANNE MOORE
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 6  The written works and personal papers of Marianne Moore have been acquired by the Rosenbach Foundation.

title: The Theater: Shaw's Candida, With Celeste Holm
description: THERE are so many people who will tell you that Bernard Shaw's Candida is a masterpiece, whereas I re gard it merely as a moderate ly successful but sadly dated play, that clearly I begin at a disadvantage in consider ing the merits of its revival, which opened last night at the Longacre Theater. It starred Celeste Holm, inci dentally, but not very brightly.

title: U.S. PAY INCREASE IS SPED IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, April 6  A Senate committee took the first steps today toward speedy en actment of a retroactive pay in crease for all Government employes.

title: Dr. Samuel Sheppard, 46, Dies; Imprisoned for Wife's Murder
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, April 6 Dr. Samuel H. Sheppard, who was convicted in a controversial trial of the slaying of his first wife and then acquitted after nearly 10 years in prison, died here early this morning. He was 46years old.

title: HANOI ENVOY IN LAOS WON'T MEET PEROT
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, April 6 H. Ross Perot, the Dallas bil lionaire who is trying to get better treatment for. American prisoners held by Hanoi, staged a sevenandahalfhour sitin near the North Vietnamese Em bassy here today.

title: Youth Conference Sessions
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 (AP) The White House Conference on Children and Youth will hold a series of six regional meetings next November, pre paratory to its national meet ing here in December. The meetings will be at Denver Nov. 46; Indianapolis Nov. 810; Omaha Nov. 1012; Port land, Ore., Nov. 1214; Pitts burgh Nov. 1517 and Tampa, Fla., Nov. 1820.

title: VICTORY IS TONIC TO DEBUSSCHERE
description: Dave DeBusschere's neighbor in Garden City, L. I., saw the rugged New York Knickerbock er forward take his yearold daughter, Michelle, out for a walk yesterday afternoon.

title: Good Chase's Injury Is Termed Minor
description: YONKERS, April 6George Wampetich was whistling a happy tune as he worked at Yonkers Raceway this morn ing. The Hungarianborn train er of standardbreds had good reason to be in such good humor, because the word from Roosevelt Raceway at West bury, L. I., was that Good Chase, the New Zealand pacer who was injured and did not finish the race last Friday night, was going to be all right.

title: Lesotho Extends Curfew
description: MASERU, Lesotho, April 6 (Reuters)The curfew in this southern African country was extended today after two police men and several tribesmen were reported killed in clashes during the weekend. The 8 P.M.to6 A.M. cuurfew was extended to 6 P.M. to 6 A.M. More than 20 persons have died violently since Prime Minister LLeaba Jona than seized power in January.

title: Two Bank Robbers Given 10 and 15Year Sentences
description: Two members of a gang of five men who allegedly robbed five banks of more than $120, 000 in Harlem and the South Bronx last year were sentenced to 10year and 15year prison terms in Federal Court yester day.

title: Wells Fargo Bank Expands
description: The Wells Fargo Bank has received final approval for its acquisition of the Los Padres National Bank, Santa Maria, Calif., it was announced yester day. Wells Fargo, which until recently operated exclusively in the northern part of the state, now will have 22 branches in Southern California.

title: Article 3  No Title
LongStudied Drug Is Licensed For Treatment of Mental Illness
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 The Food and Drug Adminis tration has licensed the much discussed drug lithium carbo nate for treatment of a com mon form of mental illness, the manic phase of manicde pressive psychosis.

title: In Memoriam
description: JEFFERIESErnest. My beloved entered into Eternal Life April 7, 1969. B.

title: LAIRD MAY CAUSE A SENATE CLASH
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 Defense Secretary Melvin R. Laird is provoking a possible confrontation between the ex ecutive and legislative branches by declining to testify before a Senate Foreign Relations subcommittee on expansion of the Safeguard missne defense system.

title: Unseld, Unhappy Over His Play, Is Lauded by Bullet Teammates
description: The season ended last night for Wes Unseld with 24 sec onds of play remaining in the gaine. The Baltimore Center, who had averaged 11.8 points in the previous six playoff games and at times intimidated Willis Reed, the Knick center, fouled out of the game.

title: Article 1  No Title
LUCY TALCOTT, AIDED GREEK EXPLORATION
description: PRINCETON, N.J., April 6 Lucy Talcott, one of the first archeologists associated with the excavations of the Athenian Agora, died of cancer today in Princeton Hospital. She was 71 years old and lived at 27 Haslet Avenue here.

title: LSD Put in Each Snack At Party That Made 27
description: LOS ANGELES, April 6 (UPI) Potato chips and corn chips that sent 27 persons on hallu cinogenic trips during a week end singles party were indivi dually laced with LSD, the sheriff's office said today.

title: Tarr Assumes Draft Post
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 (UPI) Dr. Curtis W. Tarr, former university president, promised today, that he would be fair but firm as director of the Selective Service System. The 45year old educator was sworn in by Associate Supreme Court Jus tice Potter Stewart at brief ceremonies at Selective Service headquarters. Mr. Tarr's fam ily and Gen. Lewis B. Hershey, his predecessor, shared the podium.

title: HIGH COURT EXTENDS JEOPARDY DEFENSE
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 (AP) The Supreme Court ruled 7 to 1 today that a man acquitted once may not be tried a second time on what is essentially the same evidence.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: Reds Top Expos, 51, On Merritt 3Hitter And Three Homers
description: CINCINNATI, April 6 (AP) The Cincinnati Reds got what they've been looking for from Jim Merritt today as the 26 yearold lefthander pitched 61/3 innings of nohit ball be fore winding up with a three hit, 51 victory over Montreal in the National League opener.

title: It's the Pucci Look For American Men
description: WHEN Emilio Pucci decided to introduce a collec tion of clothes for men, he had fewer problems than most designers. He merely put into mass production the styles he had been creating for himself for years.

title: Initial Imports Received Of Liquefied Natural Gas
description: The firsst imports of liquefied natural gas (LNG) into the met ropolitan New York area were completed last week at Texas Eastern Transmission Corpora tion's storage terminal on Staten Island.

title: Disabled Veterans in Vietnam Battle Policemen at Palace Over Benefits
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 6 (AP)Scores of dis abled war veterans battled policemen with stones, bot tles, clubs and hammers to day near South Vietnam's Presidential Palace.

title: Yarbrough, Johnson End Ties
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., April 6 (UPI)Lee Roy Yarbrough, one of the stars of NASCAR grand national racing, confirmed yes terday that his partnership with Junior Johnson has ended. Yar brough, who drove Johnsonpre pared Fords to seven major vic tories last year, said the part nership was a victim of Ford's curtailment of its racing pro gram.

title: Miss Noel Gignoux to Be Married
description: LITCHFIELD, Conn., April 6Miss Noel Gignoux will be married here May 23 to David N. Spevacek of Washington, D. C.

title: Inquiry by North Koreans Due on Uninvited Hijackers
description: TOKYO, April 6 (UPI)Of ficial broadcasts from North Korea today described the nine Japanese youths who hijacked an airliner to Pyongyang last week as strangers who Came uninvited and said our offi cials concerned will take ap propriate steps after necessary investigation.

title: STATE G.O.P. MEETS TO PICK A SLATE; ONE SPOT IN DOUBT
description: ROCHESTER, April 6With portraits of Governor Rockefel ler smiling from almost every wall, the Republican State Committee met today to begin the quiet process of nominat ing him for reelection and des ignating a statewide ticket he has chosen.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: April 7, 1970

title: 13 Say Western Union Changed ProAbortion Wires to Anti
description: Thirteen members of the Rockaway Park chapter of the American Jewish Congress have charged deliberate decesp tion by Western Union in the handling of telegrams they sent to their Assemblyman in Al bany on the abortion reform bill.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Peter C. R. Huang, vice presi dent and director of corporate development at the City Invest ing Company, has been elected to the board of the Home In surance Company.

title: Florida's Defiant Governor
description: WHEN a group of United States Senators investi gating hunger in America flew unannounced to Immo kalee, Fla., last year for a firsthand inspection of mi grant squalor, they were greeted by a furious Gov. Claude R. Kirk Jr.

title: Rates of Treasury Bills Advance At Weekly Government Auction
description: WASHINGTON April 6  Treasury bill rates advanced at today's auction from last week's levels, the Government revorted late this afternoon.

title: Lindsay Undecided on Keeping Morgenthau's Office During Race
description: Mayor Lindsay said yesterday he was undecided whether to continue Robert M. Morgenthau's office of Deputy Mayor during the absence of Mr. Morgenthau, who took a leave of absence to campaign for the Democratic nomination for Governor.

title: Maki Brothers Bowl a 1,310 For 2d Place in A.B.C. Play
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., April 6 (AP)The Maki brothers, Bob and Don, of Ishpeming, Mich., rolled their way into second place of the regular doubles standings of the American Bowling Congress tournament today by registering 1,310 pins.

title: Cazzie Russell and Dick Barnett Contribute to Happy Pandemonium to End Tense Series
EXYOUTH CORPS AIDE ADMITS CHECK THEFT
description: Sidney Hall, a former assist ant to Coy Smith, a Human Re sources Administration official, pleaded guilty yesterday to four counts of an eightcount indictment before State Su preme Court Justice John M. Murtagh.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Fanny Mite ($9.20) in 2:02 4/5, Valley Girl ($11.60) in 2:05 1/5 and Bewitched N. ($2.80) in 2:04 3/5 were Monday night's winners of their respective semifinals in the Pandora Pac ing Series for fillies and mares, nonwinners of $35,000 in 1969. Each onemile dash was for a gross purse of $10,000.

title: STADIUM CONTEST TO START AT 3 P.M.
description: No matter what the weather is like today, it was worse on that afternoon in December When Polly Ware bought her husband a brass bugle and Baseball Encyclopedia for Christmas.

title: Man Disarmed on Jet And Seized by F.B.I.
description: PITTSBURGH, April 6 (UPI) A young man who was upset because he thought he was being flown to Boston entered the cockpit of Trans World Airlines Flight 90 with a gun today, but was dis armed and the plane landed here without incident.

title: Uniformed Services Of the City Average 13 Sick Days Yearly
description: Mayor Lindsay released a re port yesterday saying that em ployes in the Fire, Sanitation, Correction and Police Depart ments were taking off more time for illness than in the past.

title: The Creaky Courts: Overhaul Needed to End Delays
description: The courts in the metropoli tan area, as nearly everyone connected with them readily admits, are overcrowded, un derstaffed and months behind in their work.

title: ShellBP Steps Up Outlay In Nigerian Oil Operations
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, April 6 (Reuters)The AngloDutch oil enterprise ShellBP today an nounced a 66million ($160 million) expansion of its oil operations in Nigeria.

title: 2 Gunmen. Slay 4 California Patrolmen
description: SAUGUS, Calif., April 6 Two gunmen killed four highway patrolmen in a gun battle outside a mountain cafe near here late last night.

title: Doris A. Swain Plans Nuptials
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 Miss Doris Anne Swain, member of the professional nursing staff of George Washington University, and Dr. Robert Francis Dyer Jr., an internist, plan to be mar ried in June.

title: Panel Urges Ombudsman At Princeton
description: PRINCETON, N. J., April 6 The creation of a post of ombudsman at Princeton Uni versity was recommended to day by a special committee of faculty members and students who have been considering re forms in the university's struc ture for nearly two years.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: LANSING, Mich., April 6 (AP)Wayne Tody, head of the Fish Division of the Michigan Department of Natural Resources, said that state officials would meet to morrow to review the mer cury pollution problem.

title: MOTOROLA CLOSES A COLOR TUBE PLANT
description: CHICAGO, April 6 (AP) Motorola, Inc., closed today its only colortelevisiontube plant and announced a twoweek shutdown of five colortelevi sion assembly plants in Illinois because of a drop in sales of color television sets in the last year.

title: STOCK PRICES DIP ON LONDON BOARD
Books of The Times
description: WHAT D. Keith Mano has been up to in his first three books is nothing less than an attempt to pump fresh plasma into the Christian novel. It's as though, on the death of Flannery O'Connor, someone had to pick up the burning cross and carry it like a flashlight into the mysteries, the swamps of faith.

title: 800 L.I.R.R. RIDERS DELAYED 2 HOURS
description: About 800 Long Island Rail Road commuters were trapped for morethan two hours yes terday morning when a train stalled in a tunnel under the East River.

title: Dr. Alfred Sturtevant, 78, Dies; Geneticist Won U.S. Medal
description: PASADENA, Calif., April 6 Dr. Alfred Henry Sturtevant, a major figure in American genet ics for many years, and a for mer professor of genetics at the California Institute of Technol ogy, died of cancer at a hospital here last night. He lived here and was 78 years old.

title: N.A.S.D. Appoints Cleveland Broker, As New President
description: WASHINGTON, April 6  Gordon S. Macklin Jr., a gen eral partner in the Cleveland brokerage firm of McDonald & Co., has been named presi dent of the National Associa tion of Securities Dealers, the association announged today.

title: Shipyard to Reduce Force
description: BOSTON, April 6 (AP)The Boston Naval Shipyard will eliminate 376 jobs outright dur ing the fiscal year 1971,; begin ning June 30, Capt. R. W. Burk, yard commander, announced yesterday. A thousand more jobs will be phased out through attrition to reduce the work force to the 6,000man level or dered by the Defense Depart

title: Trial of Housing Cases by City Urged
description: Mayor Lindsay asked the Legislature yesterday to take housing code violations out of the jammed Criminal Courts and allow city housing officials to levy fines in such cases.

title: ST. JOHN'S DEFEATS FORDHAM NINE, 81
description: Gil McDonald's debut as Ford ham baseball coach, which was delayed for over a week, was not a glamorous one yesterday. The former Yankee took the Rams to Jamaica for their open er and got a chilly reception and an 81 setback by St. John's.

title: White House TV Tour
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 (AP) Tricia Nixon, the President's daughter, will tape a television tour of the White House to be broadcast over the Columbia Broadcasting System network's show Sixty Minutes on May 26. The White House said the tour will include historic rooms and the family quarters on the second floor, including many rooms that have not been shown before on television.

title: Sports of The Times
description: ONCE upon a time the opening of a baseball season was an event of transcendental importance in the world of sports. The long winter vigil was over and the singleminded hibernation of the fans was at an end. Such was the situation for a considerable part of pro fessional baseball's first century, one that was completed with notable hoopla last year.

title: COCOA FUTURES UP ON GRINDING NEWS
description: Cocoa futures rose yesterday, following the issuance on Fri day of a guesstimate by a leading dealer that firstquarter grinding results in the United States would show a decline of about 5 per cent compared with the 1969 quarter.

title: Prosecution Alleges Corruption As Adams Trial Goes to Jury
description: State Senator William E. Adams was praised as a reputable official and assailed as corrupt during the summations of his trial yesterday in Federal Court.

title: Two Philadelphia Policemen Arraigned in Assault
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 6 Two Philadelphia policemen were arraigned today on charges of aggravated assault and battery in a growing con troversy over alleged police brutality.

title: Art Sale Will Raise Funds for Boys Club
description: A champagne reception will be held at the Edward S. Frisch Galleries, 973 Third Avenue, from 5 to 8 P.M. to day to open an art sale to benefit the Madison Square Boys Club.

title: Banding Delays Still Plague Bellevue
description: To passing motorists on te East River Drive, the new 22story Bellevue Hospital building at 26th Street and the drive appears almost ready for its first patients. tients.

title: Kennecott Copper Is Increasing Basic Prices by 4 Cents a Pound
description: The Kennecott Copper Corporation, the leading producer of American primary copper, raised its basic price by 4 cents a pound yesterday, and thus removed any doubts that the 7 per cent increase imposed last week by competitors would stick.

title: League Investigating Charges That Wings Didn't Try
description: Disturbed by what he termed a violent reaction to the final, improbable day of the National Hockey League season, Clar ence Campbell, the president, said yesterday he was making inquiries into the actions and words of Coach Sid Abel, whose Detroit club was trounced by the Rangers.

title: A Party to Aid Health Center
description: Supporters of the Judson Health Center will pretend they are sipping cocktails in Hong Kong at their cocktail dance and buffet dinner April 22 in the Pierre's Co tillion Room.

title: TV: This Land Is Mine, on Color Sets, at Least
description: AN affirmative statement of the national pleasures and rewards of an unpolluted and noncommercialized en vironment was made last night by Lester Cooper in his special TV film entitled This Land Is Mine. The program was seen on the network of the American Broadcasting Company.

title: Hagen Investments Barred By the S.E.C. From Trading
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 (UPI) The Securities and Exchange Commission today barred Ha gen Investments, Inc., of Okla homa City and its president, Ed J. Hagen, from engaging in the securities business. Mr. Hagen and his concern consented to a decree accusing them of selling unregistered stock.

title: Protesters End Occupation of the Harlem Y.W.C.A.
description: A group of black and Puerto Rican teenagers who had occupied the Harlem Y.W.C.A. for more than a month left quietly yesterday morning shortly before the sheriff arrived to arrest them on a contemptofcourt charge.

title: OUTPUT OF STEEL DECLINES IN WEEK
description: Steel production declined in the week ended Saturday by 0.9 per cent, compared to output the week before, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: THEATER INSTITUTE TO SERVE COLLEGES
description: Twelve colleges and universities have agreed to participate in the National Theater Institute, established last December by the Eugene O'Neill Memorial Theater Center in Waterford, Conn.

title: SOME BANK CURBS OPPOSED BY BURNS
description: WASHINGTON, April 6  Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, said today that he would like to see the termination of interest rate ceilings on bank deposits, at least as far as instruments of the moneymarket type are concerned.

title: AUGUSTA CHANGE SADDENS PLAYER
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., April 6  Gary Player, the favorite to win the Masters tournament that begins here Thursday, be lieves some of the romance has been taken out of the Au gusta National Golf Club course, site of the annual event.

title: A COMMUNAL SPIRIT LIFTS DANCE TROUPE
description: The Church Street Dance Company of Washington, which performed last night at the Cubiculo, is not so much a con ventional moderndance group as an apparent commune. It is a refreshingly different troupe marked by a flowerpower to getherness, expressed both in the themes of its dances and in the obvious friendship that gov erns the relationships of the dancers to one another as people.

title: Italian Bishops Meet
description: ROME, April 6 (Reuters) Italy's Roman Catholic bishops today began a sixday confer ence during which they will ex amine the growing crisis among the country's 43,000 priests. In opening the conference, Antonio Cardinal Roma said that the ma jor problems facing the clergy included rapid social change. new attitudes to authority, and modern theological research.

title: GLAMOUR STOCKS LEAD MARKET DIP
Pearl Bailey Is Invited By Nixon to Perform
description: Pearl Bailey has been in vited by President Nixon to entertain on Friday at a White House state dinner for Willy Brandt, Chancellor of West Germany.

title: JAPAN DUE EO EASE CURB ON PORTFOLIOS
description: TOKYO, April 6 (Reuters) Official Japanese sources said today the Japanese Govern ment would soon relax the present restrictions on foreign portfolio investments in Japa nese stocks.

title: Asian Bank Helps Indonesia In Agricultural Development
description: The Asian Development Bank has agreed to assist the Indo nesian Government in modern izing Bank Rakjat Indonesia, the country's major agricultur al development bank.

title: Rightists and Leftists Clash At University in Istanbul
description: ISTAMBUL, Turkey, April 6 (Reuters)Students of the right and left fought with guns, knives and gasoline bombs on the campus of Istambul Uni versity today.

title: FRENCH STUDENTS FAIL TO FIND UNITY
description: ORLEANS, France, April  The suspense grew along with the daylight early this morning as hundreds of French boys and girls stood or sat or lounged on the floor of the littered Palace of Sports in Orleans. They were waiting for a youth named JeanPierre Chassine.

title: International Loans Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, April 6The following is a list of loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: Justice Agency Ready to Help Press Integration, but Cautious on Tactics
description: WASHINGTON, April 6The Nixon Administration said to day that it was ready to co operate with the United States District Court in Florida in en forcing a school desegregation order that Gov. Claude R. Kirk Jr. has defied.

title: Arizona Bank in Offering
description: The Valley National Bank of Arizona announced yesterday a proposed rights offering to stockholders of 804,000 new shares on the basis of one new share for each 10 held April 23. Blyth & Co., Inc., was named underwriting manager.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Volunteers. The President named Henry Ford 2d to be chairman of the board of the National Center for Volun tary Action. Mr. Ford, 52 year old, has been a director of the Ford Motor Company since 1938. The National Cen

title: The Carswell Blunder
description: The Senate's defeat of the motion to recommit to the Judiciary Committee the nomination of Judge G. Harrold Carswell clears the way for a final decision tomorrow on the Fundamental question of Mr. Cars well's confirmation as Associate Justice of the Supreme Court. On this basic issue each Senator has the obligation to vote not in accordance with party loyalty but in accordance with his own conscience.

title: Sales Figures Are Revised
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 The Department of Commerce said today that it had revised upward the seasonallyadjusted retail sales figure for February. Sales in February totalled $29, 942,000,000, up more than 1 per cent from January and 2 per cent ahead of sales in February of 1969.

title: Vietnam Student Protests Spread in Spite of Police
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 6  A student protest movement is rapidly gathering momentum in South Vietnam despite Government efforts to stifle it.

title: Rank Xerox Earnings Up 37% For 28 Weeks Ended on Jan. 10
description: Rank Xerox, Ltd., in its re port issued yesterday for the 28 weeks ended Jan. 10, showed a 37 per cent increase in earn ings on a gain of 29 per cent in operating revenues, both set tins new records for the period

title: Computerized Mail Plan Seth
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 (UPI) The Post Office Department said today that nearly 75 per cent of the nation's letters now bear a Zip code, permitting nationwide conversion to a computerized sorting system. Postmaster General Winton M. Blount said the department would begin its overall com puterized sorting program in August.

title: Measles Threatens A Possible Delay In Apollo Mission
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., April 6  Measles posed a slight threat tonight to plans for launching the Apollo 13 moon mission this Saturday.

title: A JAPANESE DANCER IN IMPRESSIVE DEBUT
description: Yoko Morishita, obviously a young woman to be reckoned with as one of the world's first rate ballet dancers, made her local debut Sunday night at Kaufmann Concert Hall. If Miss Morishita, Yukiko Mushanokoji and Yuriko Kawaguchi, all of Tokyo's Asami Maki Ballet, are representative of their coun try's classic dancers, then the ballet counterpart of Japan's celebrated new breed of young virtuoso musicians already exists.

title: Soccer Results
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: Knicks Turn Back Bullets, 127114, and Gain Eastern Finals, 4 Games to 3
description: The New York Knickerbock ers, who electrified their public and broke open the National Basketball Association race with an 18game winning streak last fall, turned on their full blended power again last night in beating the, Baltimore Bullets, 127114. They thus cleared the first of three giant hurdles on the path to the league cham pionship.

title: Maurice Stokes Dies at 36
description: Maurice Stokes, the Cincin nati Royals' basketball star whose career was cut short in 1958 when he was stricken with encephalitis, died yesterday of a heart ailment. The 36yearold Stokes suffered a heart attack on March 30. Obituary on page 46.

title: U.S. AIDE APPOINTED TO HEAD THE H.R.A.
description: Jule M. Sugarman was named by Mayor Lindsay yesterday as the next head of the Human Resources Administration, the city's largest superagency.

title: Farmer Groups Unite on Goal of Economic Equity
description: ST. LOUIS, April 6  Wor ried farmers from throughout the United States abandoned their traditional stubborn inde pendence today and joined hands in an effort to improve the deteriorating lot of agricul ture.

title: STOKES DIES AT 36; BASKETBALL STAR
description: CINCINNATI, April 6 (AP) Maurice Stokes, the former basketball star with the Cin cinnati Royals, died today after suffering a heart attack March 30. He was 36 years old.

title: Sweden to Get New Plant
description: The Union Carbide Corpora tion announced yesterday that Unifos Kemi, a company it owns jointly with the Fosfat bolaget Company of Stockholm, would build a highdensity pol yethylene plant at Stenung sund, Sweden. The plant will have a capacity of 70 million pounds a year and will be the first of its kind in Scandinavia.

title: Nixon Sees Senators Drop Opener, 50
description: WASHINGTON; April 6 (UPI) President Nixon made a be lated appearance at the ball park today, but his rooting could not prevent the Washing ton Senators from losing to the Detroit Tigers, 50, for their eighth openingday defeat in a row.

title: 2 Held in Running Of Vegas Tables In Charities' Name
description: WHITE PLAINS, April 6A father and son accused of set ting up Las Vegas Nights in Westchester country clubs os tensibly to raise money for charity, were arraigned today on charges of promoting gam bling and possession of gam bling devices.

title: Militants Win a Point at Hunter: A New Governing Proposal Due
description: The president of Hunter College, Mrs. Jacqueline Grennan Wexler, agreed yesterday to establish a temporary congress, half student and half faculty, to propose a new governing structure for the school. The proposal would be submitted to a college referendum.

title: 12 F.B.I. Gambling Arrests
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 (AP) Federal Bureau of Investiga tion agents arrested 12 persons in three stats today on charges stemming from a $150,000a week gambling operation in northern Ohio, the bureau's director. J. Edgar Hoover, an nounced.

title: Observer: Don't Call Me, I'll Call Me
description: WASHINGTON, April 6  Robert Townsend urges busi ness executives to telephone themselves occasionally. When you're off on a business trip or a vacation, pretend you're a customer, he suggests. Tele phone some part of your or ganization and ask for help. You'll run into some real horror shows.

title: Colleague of Carswell Phoned To Get Fellow Judges' Support
description: WASHINGTON, April 6A colleague of G. Harrold Cars well on the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit said today that he had conduct ed a telephone campaign among Federal district udges in the South that resulted in their en dorsement of President Nixon's nominee to the Sunreme Court.

title: Cooke Visits Caracas
description: Cardinal Cooke, Archbisnop of New York, left by plane yesterday for a pastoral factfinding visit to three South American countries. Cardinal Cooke's first stop will be Caracas, Venezuela, where he will inspect a new parish supported by the New York Archdiocese. He also will visit Lima, Peru, and Santiago, Chile.

title: N.H.L. Playoffs
description: (4of7 game series)

title: WEEDEN REPORTS 1ST LOSS SINCE '46
description: Another large Wall Street brokerage house has had to use red ink in writing its an nual report for 1969.

title: A 2D SENATE RACE BY BUCKLEY DUE
description: The Conservative party is expected to nominate Dr. Paul L. Adams, its candidate for Governor in 1966, and James L. Buckley, its candidate for United States Senator in 1968, for those same offices when its State Committee meets tonight.

title: ALFRED FEINBERG, 87, ANATOMICAL ARTIST
description: Alfred Feinberg, an anatomi cal illustrator, died Sunday at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Med ical Center. He was 87 years old and lived at 270 Riverside Drive.

title: N.B.A. Playoffs
description: (4of7 Game Series) EASTERN DIVISION Baltimore vs. Knicks

title: COURT RULES POLICE CAN END A SPEECH
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 (AP) The Supreme Court today sustained the power of police to arrest street speakers who refuse orders to move on when crowds grow tense and hostile.

title: Committee on Crime Subpoenas Esposito Over Link to Scotto
description: Meade H. Esposito, Brooklyn Democratic leader, has been subpoenaed by the Joint Legislative on Crime for questioning about his relations with Anthony J. Scotto, vice president of the International Longshoremen's Association.The subpoena, directing Mr. Esposito to appear at 10 A.M. today at a closed session of the committee, was served on him last Thursday at Grossinger's, where he was attending the Democratic State Committee. A committee source said yesterday that a postponement sought by Mr. Esposito's lawyer had been granted. It could not immediately be learned when he will testify.

title: Nixon and Johnson Drop In on the Working Press
description: WASHINGTON, April 6A visitor from Texas was served breakfast in the White House today and then got a guided tour of the working space used by President Nixon.

title: EXPROT ALLEGES CIVILIAN SLAYINGS
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., April 6A former. Army helicopter pilot charged today that an Army major killed 33 unarmed men, women and children as they ran across an open field in a 1967 incident in the Cen tral Highlands of South Viet nam.

title: Charges That Police in Uruguay Torture Political Prisoners Stir Scandal
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 6Allegations that the Uruguayan police regularly tor ture political prisoners have prompted a Congressional in vestigation and set off a Gov ernment scandal here.

title: AcidWell Plans Dropped
description: NAGARA FALLS, N. Y., April 6The Hooker Chemical Corporation announced cancellation today of plans to construct a $1.6million deepwell aciddisposal system here. The project, which was opposed by conservation groups, had been planned since 1968. Raymond W. VerHoeve, vice president and general manager of the plant's industrial division, said that improved technology would make it possible to install new acidrecovery facilities capable of handling the waste acids originally intended to be disposed of in the well. Why pump away what we can sell? a official asked.

title: U.S. Attorney Plans Expanded Drive On Business Fraud
description: United States Attorney Whitney North Seymour Jr. announced yesterday an expanded program to crack down on whitecollar criminals.

title: Heroic Off the Court
description: They called Maurice Stokes Mighty Mo in college, but his efforts on the basketball court dimmed in comparison to the heroics he performed in hos pital therapy rooms during a 12yeat struggle to regain the use of his body.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: A recent Ietter from six professors of the Yale Law School supports the Justice De partment's constitutional objec tions to a statute lowering the voting age to 18. However, both the Department and the professors ignore the fact that the same bill also imposes a nationwide ban on state liter acy tests, and reduces state residence requirements for vot ing. Surely if Congress has the power to act by statute to change voting qualifications in the areas of literacy and resi dence, then it also has the power to act by statute to change the voting age.

title: Mother's Plea for SovietHeld Jews
description: THE auburn hair is gamine chic, the comlexion girl ishly flushed, the petite, 41 yearold figure trimly pack aged in a brown knit turtle neck dress. There Is no de spair in th epale blue eyes. Only the accent that marks her torrent of fluent English betrays her national origin.

title: Florida Floods Expected to Raise Produce Prices
description: TALLAHASSEE, April 6 Torrential rains in Florida's Salad Bowl farm region have damaged crops severely and caused concern for thousands of migrant laborers whose live lihood depends on harvesting spring vegetables.

title: Pole Meets Success Ina New Language
description: Leopold Tyrmand always believed that America's streets were paved with gold, or at least with good inventions such as freedom and opportunity.

title: Italy Sets Regional Elections
description: ROME, April 6 (Reuters)Pre mier Mariano Rumor told his newly formed Cabinet tonight that elections scheduled to di vide Italy into 20 semiautono mous regions would be held June 7.

title: Alcan Aluminum Picks Fabricating Unit Head
description: In another corporate de velopment, the Alcan Alumi num Corporation, the United States fabricating subsidiary of Alcan Aluminium, Ltd., announced yesterday that Eric F. West, who heads two sales divisions, would be come president of the fabri cating unit at the end of June.

title: DR. MILTON NEIBRIEF
description: LIVINGSTON, N J., April 6 Dr. Milton Neibrief, a surgeon, died of a heart attack yester day at St. Barnabas Medical Center. He was 57 years old and lived at 315 West End Road, South Orange.

title: A Utility Considers Filing Against G.E.
description: The Jersey Central Power & Light Company is proceeding with plans to file a claim against the General Electric Company for delays in comple tion of the Oyster Creek nu clear generating station. Jersey Central is an operating subsidi ary of the General Public Util ities Corporation.

title: BOSTON WINS, 43, IN STADIUM GAME
description: The Southern strategy of the New York Yankees failed in its first Northern exposure yester day.

title: N.B.A. Playoffs
description: WESTERN DIVISION

title: March Sales Down by 4% At 7 Large Stores Here
description: A decline in consumer buy ing, combined with an earlier Easter than last year, provided disappointing sales in March for seven of New York City's largest department stores.

title: New Sesame Street Corporation Plans Older Children's Series
description: The Children's Television Workshop, producer of the popular children's series, Ses ame Street, yesterday an nounced programing plans for next season and for a new reading series for older chil dren. At the same time it con firmed reports that it had be come an independent corpora tion.

title: 6 Dead in Manila In a Major Quake; Scores Injured
description: MANILA, April 7  Six per sons were killed and scores were injured today in an earth quake that shook this city and most of the northern half of the Philippines.

title: FLORIDIANS GIVEN FINANCIAL ASSIST
description: The American Basketball As sociation is giving temporary financial air to its Miami fran chise while the Floridians undergo reorganization.

title: Delay, on Data Laid to Builder of F111
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 The builder of the F111 attack airplane withheld evidence of major increases in the craft's, expected weight for several months of the original Senate inquiry into the program in 1963, a Navy expert testified today.

title: PHONE ANSWERERS ON STRIKE HERE
description: A strike by operators of tele phoneanswering services be gan here last midnight. oMre than 100,000 people were af fected, about half of them phy sicans and nurses.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: April 7, 1970

title: Royal Binoculars Missing
description: FOLKESTONE, England, April 7 (AP)  Queen Mother Eliza beth lost her binoculars at the Folkestone Races today. She left the binoculars on a chair in the stewards' box while she presented a cup to a winning owner. When she returned they were gone.

title: Hovercraft, Sales Low, Shuts a Plant
description: LONDON, April 7The Brit ish Hovercraft Corporation, de veloper of aircushion vehicles, announced today that it would close one of its two plants and reduce its work force because of a lack of orders.

title: Pro Handball Tour Set
description: CHICAGO, April 7 (UPI)A $100,000 professional handball tour was announced today by Ted Tannenbaum, a promoter. He said that Paul Haber, na tional champion for four of the last five years, had signed and that contracts had been sent to 23 other players. A portable glass court will be used in large arenas, he added.

title: FINCH FORECASTS INTEGRATION RISE OF 100% IN SOUTH
description: WASHINGTON, April 7Sec retary of Health, Education and Welfare Robert H. Finch, insist ing there would be no back ward motion, predicted today that the number of black chil dren in school with whites in the South would double by fall.

title: DR.T.H.VAIL MOTTER, TEACHER AND WRITER
description: PRINCETON, N. J., April 7 A memorial service was held at the Princeton University Chapel Sunday for Dr. T. H. Vail Motter, a historian, author and former teacher, who died at his home at 49 Palmer Square last Wednesday, after suffering a stroke. He was 69 years old.

title: Compromise Warning on Birth Pills Announced
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 The Federal Government made public today a compromise warning statement to be given to women with each package of birth control pills.

title: Indian Demonstrator Dies
description: NEW DELHI, April 7 (UPI) A demonstrator died today of injuries received in a clash be tween the police and 20,000 leftists who tried to storm the Indian Parliament yesterday, the Deputy Minister of Home Affairs, Vidya Charan Shukla, announced today. The demon strators demanded the resigna Lion of the Government.

title: Hunt Is Appointed to Head British West Indian Airways
description: British West Indian Airways has Lucian J. Hunt as its man aging director and chief execu tive officer. Mr. Hunt has been president of American Flyers Airline Corporation since 1566.

title: Nixon Troop Decision To Come This Month
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 (Reuters)  President Nixon will announce a decision this month on the next United States troop cut in Vietnam, the White House said today.

title: British Papers Raise Prices
description: LONDON, Wednesday, April 8 (Reuters)Three British na tional newspapers  including the biggestselling daily, The Daily Mirrortoday announced price increases. The Mirror, The Daily Express and The Sun will cost sixpence (six cents) each, a onecent rise.

title: Ban on Pickets Ruled Illegal
description: MIAMI, April 7 (AP)A Fed eral judge has ruled unconstitu tional a Dade County ordinance banning picketing in residential areasincluding the Florida White House. United States Dist. Judge William Mehrtens told the county yesterday that he was striking the ordinance because it was too broad in scope. County law enforcement officers requested the ordinance last fall after several marchers picketed President Nixons home on Key Biscayne.

title: Sports of The Times
description: WHEN the New York Knickerbockers were ruthlessly bulldozing their way through the league with their record 18game winning streak during the early stages of the season, they appeared to beand undoubtedly werethe finest basketball team in the land. But then the law of averages, along with normal wear and tear, began to erode that image. The once superhuman Knicks appeared alarm inzlv human at times. They even blew hot and cold throughout the first six games of their firstround playoff series with the Baltimore Bullets.

title: Listing of New Books
description: FICTION

title: Music: Ozawa Conducts
description: ONLY two works occupied the program Seiji Ozawa conducted last night in Phil h armonic Hall, but since one of them was the hourlong Symphony No. 4 by Bruckner, nobody felt cheated. Schu bert's Unfinished Symphony was the other work. Mr. Oz awa was at the helm of the Philadelphia Orchestra.

title: Voloshen Pleads Not Guilty in Prisoner Defrauding Case
description: Nathan Voloshen, accused of sing the influence of the office of Speaker of the House John W. McCormack, pleaded not guilty in Fetleral Court here yesterday to charges of de frauding a California prison in mate of $16,000 in return for promises to get him out of jail. vvv Mr. Voloshen, who is 74 years old, sat patiently yes terday while Judge Sylvester J. Ryan charged a Federal grand jury similar to the one that indicted him in the Federal Court.

title: EXECUTIVE AT I.B.M. TO HEAD TRADEPANEL
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 President Nixon announced to day the appointment of Albert L. Williams of Armonk, N: Y., as chairman of the President's Commission on International Trade and Investment Policy.

title: Amer. Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Police in Saigon Clash Again With Veterans
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 7Several companies of national policemen con tinued to patrol the down town streets of Saigon to night after clashing with 100 disabldd South Vietnamese veterans.

title: Welfare Recipients to Get I.D. Cards
description: For the first time, all welfare recipients in the city who cash welfare checks will be given identification cards, it was an nounced yesterday by Welfare Commissioner Jack R. Gold berg.

title: Judge Backs Newsman
description: A Federal district judge de clined yesterday to force a New York Times reporter to produce in court the notes he made of conversations with air traffic courtollers who claimed to be sick.

title: Hungarian Lands MIG In Italy and Asks Asylum
description: UDINE, Italy, April 7 (AP) A Hungarian Air Force lieutenant flew his Soviet built MIG15 fighter into Italy today and landed near where his former instructor brought in a MIG eight months ago. He immediately asked for po litical asylum.

title: House Votes $24Billion School Bill
description: WASHINGTON, April 7The House passed and sent to the White House today the most expensive education legislation in history, a $24.6billion bill that will probably preserve the Johnson Administration's edu cation programs until after the next Presidential election.

title: SAFETY RISK FOUND IN AUTO REPAIRS
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 Evidence that safetyrelated automobile repairs are often inadequately performedpar ticularly when the cost is I covered by newcar warranties has been developed in study commissioned by the Na tional Highway Safety Bureau.

title: Market Summary
description: Tuesday, April 7, 1970

title: FIGHTING EXPANDS IN CAMBODIA AREA
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, April 7Vietnamese Communist mili tary pressure on the Cambodian border province of Svayrieng increased last night and this morning and brought heavy fighting.

title: Shriver Tests Maryland Politics in Home Town
description: UNION MILLS, Md., April 7  In this tiny preRevolution ary War hamlet, where the German ancestors of R. Sargent Shriver began their rise to prosperity in the New World by grinding corn, the former Ambassador to France began building on his own hopes for a new life in America today.

title: Hanes Corp. Will Reduce Staff of Plant in Carolina
description: WINSTONSALEM, N. C., April 7The Ivy Avenue plant of the Hanes Corporation here will reduce its 1500employe force by 500 to 600, Robert E. Warhover, vice president and chief operating officer an nounced here today.

title: The Republican Boss
description: As his face smiled from posters decorating almost every wall, Governor Rockefeller yesterday received the enthusiastic endorsement of delegates at the Republican state convention to run for a fourth term. He Is now the official G.O.P. nominee. There will be no Republican primary to match the Democratic primary.

title: Crime Inquiry Hears Brooklyn Democratic Chief
description: Meade H. Esposito, Brooklyn Democratic leader, was ques tioned yesterday at a closed session of the Joint Legislative Committee on Crime.

title: Chase Bank Adds to Board
description: Richard Randolph Shinn, president of the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company, has been elected to the board of the Chase Manhattan Bank. He has been with Metropolitan Life since 1939 and has been an officer since 1953.

title: PETER SINCLAIR, 63, OF PAPER COMPANY
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 7 Peter T. Sinclair, chairman of the board of Crown Zellerbacb Corporation, died early today at Mount Zion Hospital, of a kidney ailment. He had been ill for several months. His age was 63.

title: WILBERT L. SMITH
description: MIDDLEBURY, Conn., April 7 Wilbert L. Smith, general manager of the SM News Com pany, Inc., of New York, from 1919 to 1955, died at the Mid dlebury Convalescent Hospital yesterday, of a liver ailment. He was 75 years old and lived in Roxbury.

title: Chou's North Korean Visit Is Viewed as Signaling Restoration of Normal Ties
description: TOKYO, April 7The state visit of the Chinese Communist Premier Chou Enlai, to North Korea, which began Sunday and ended today, is being viewed hre by analysts of Communist affairs as an index of North Ko rea's success in putting its rela tions with Peking back onto a normal basis.

title: Stravinsky Hospitalized
description: Igor Starvinsky, who was ad mitted Monday to Lenox Hill Hospital because of congestion in his lower left lung, was re ported to be somewhat im proved yesterday afternoon. A spokesman for the 87yearold composer said The picture to day is a little more optimistic, but I wouldn't say he is out of danger. His respiration seems to be improved, and the fluid seems to be leaving his lungs. Until the setback on Monday, Mr. Stravinsky had been re ported to be recovering nicely from a stroke suffered several months ago.

title: VOTE ON CARSWELL IN SENATE TODAY IS DUE TO BE CLOSE
description: WASHINGTON, April 7The Senate appeared almost evenly divided today on the nomina tion of Judge G. Harrold Cars well to the Supreme Court, with the final vote on confirma tion set for 1 P.M. tomorrow.

title: Astronauts' Food Getting a DowntoEarth Taste
description: MORE often than in any pre Iv lvious space mission, the three astronauts who head for the moon in the Apollo 13 spaceship scheduled for liftoff Saturday afternoon will have something resem bling normal eating habits. They'll be able to use spoons more frequently, eat their food from bowls and spread sandwich fillings on slices of fresh bread.

title: FRANK J. CAVANAUGH
description: NORTH BERGEN, N. J., April 7  Frank J. Cavanaugh, retired vice president of the Morgan Guaranty Bank of New York, died yesterday at a nurs ing home in Guttenberg. He was 73 years old and lived here at 7200 Boulevard East.

title: Manhattan Triumphs, 112, On 7 Unearned Runs in 5th
description: TEANECK, N. J., April 7 Manhattan took advantage of four Fairleigh. Dickinson errors in the fifth inning today and scored seven unearned runs en route to an 112 Metropolitan Conference victory.

title: LAKERS BEAT SUNS AND SQUARE SERIES
description: PHOENIX, April 7 (UPI) With Jerry West scoring 35 points, the Los Angeles Lakers defeated the Phoenix Suns, 104 93, tonight and sent their Na tional Basketball Association Western Division playoff series into the seventh and deciding game at Los Angeles Thursday night.

title: F.T.C. Accepts Consent On SCM Sales TieIns
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 (UPI) The Federal Trade Commis sion has accepted provisionally a consent decree to end a tiein sales complaint against the SCM Corporation, a New York maker of typewriters and bust ness machines.

title: NYTRONICS ADDS AIR DEVICES STOCK
description: Nytronics, Inc., announced yesterday that it had increased ith interest in Eastern Air De vices, Inc., to about 84 per cent of the outstanding shares by acquiring an additional 33.8 per cent.

title: Part of 20th Century Lmited Lives On: It's Home to the Circus
description: THE other night, a couple asked a cab driver to take them to West 35th Street and 12th Avenue. The cabbie did, but when he arrived at the destination, in a rather deserted neighborhood full of railroad cars hard by the West Side Highway, he pulled a gun on his passengers and said: All right. What are you trying to pull? Nobody lives here.

title: Argetsinger Will Join Chaparral After Leaving Watkins Glen Post
description: WHAT, Watkins Glen with out Cam Argetsinger? It seems unthinkable. But it's true, and we shall have to live with it.

title: Stalin's Daughter and Architect Get Marriage License in Arizona
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., April 7 Stalin's daughter, Svetlana Alli luyeva, who defected to the United States in 1967, and Wil liam Wesley Peters, an archi tect, have obtained a marriage license here.

title: Stanley Cup Hockey Playoffs Will Get Under Way on Four Fronts Tonight
description: The first United Statesonly Stanley Cup playoffs open to night on four fronts, while fans continue to shake their heads in bewilderment over the most bizarre finish in the National Hockey League's 53year his tory.

title: Executive Changes
description: S. Ralph Zimmerman Jr. has been elected chair man of the board and David F. Calliari, vice, president of finance and treasurer of Raybestosm Manhattan, Inc. Mr. Zimmerman, formerly executive, vice president, replaces William Simpson, who remains president and chief executive officer.

title: U.S. Asks Ban on Funds for Segregated Schools
description: WASHINGTON, April 7The Department of Justice brought suit today against the use of Mississippi state funds to pay teachers in private segregated schools.

title: Books of The Times
description: AMISTAD, a new biannual paperback periodical, takes its name from both the Spanish word for friendship and the name of a ship on which a successful slave mutiny occurred in 1839. Judging from the first issue of Amistad, the para dox in the title is fitting. Subtitled Writ ings on Black History and Culture and intended to provide regular supplementary reading to blackstudies college courses, Amistad comes in peace and shuns the rhetoric of violence (so far). Yet it intends

title: MORE PRICE RISES SET FOR COPPER
description: Price increases continued yesterday for primary copper and the copper content of a variety of fabricated products.

title: Yonkers Drivers
description: EASTERN HOCKEY LEAGUE

title: Hedy A. Cohn Becomes Bride Of C. E. Erbsen, News Official
description: Miss Hedy Apte Cohn of Rio de Janette; was married here yesterday to Claude E. Erbsen of London and New York, business manager and administrative director of the APDow Jones Economic Re port with headquarters in London, where the couple plan to live.

title: Defense Begins Its Case In Fiedler Trial Upstate
description: BUFFALO, April 7  The defense for Dr. and Mrs. Leslie A. iedler began preparing its case today after City Judge H. Buswell Roberts denied several motions for dismissal of the marijuanarelated charges.

title: PERCUSSION ARMY INVADES CARNEGIE
description: The stage at Carnegie Hall was a fortress last night  a sidetoside barricade bristling with vibrahraps, kettle drums, chimes, cymbals and a field drum and, in secondary depth, xylophones, gongs, bongos, conga drums and such minutiae as triangles, whistles, claves, bell trees and assorted prod ucers of scratches and rattles.

title: The Hypocrisy of Power
description: Behind all the questions of politics, ideologies and person alities in the Carswell case lies the larger issue of public con fidence and trust in the institu tions of the nation. This is the issue President Nixon over looked. That trust does not exist now. The authority of the Government, of the church, of the university, and even of the family is under challenge all over the Republic, and men of all ages, stations and persua sions agree that this crisis of confidence is one of the most important and dangerous prob lems of the age.

title: British Petroleum Prospects Additional Oil in Alaska
description: LONDON, April 7 (AP) British Petroleum, B.P., which broke into the American oil market with a big strike in Alaska, said today it was pros pecting for more oil in that state.

title: QUIET FRENCH UNIT WORKS ON IN LAOS
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, April 6 On the outskirts of Vientiane the signboard at the entrance to a spacious military compound of the oldfashioned, treeshaded colonial type reads Mission Militaire Francaise d'Instruc tion.

title: SENATOR ADAMS WINS ACQUITTAL
description: State Senator William E. Adams was acquitted yester day of charges that he had committed perjury and ob structed justice in an investiga tion of Medicaid.

title: G.I. Held in Threat to Pilot
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., April 7 (UPI)A 22yearold Brooklyn soldier who allegeadly threat ened the life of an Eastern Air lines pilot was held today in the county jail here in lieu of $1,000 bond. Pvt. Joseph D. Zito was taken into custody when the plane arrived here from New York. The pilot, Capt. B. S. Carnes, said that the soldier threatened him when he reproached him for refusing to bucsgle his seat belt.

title: HOUSE PANEL ASKS A DRUG TERM CUT
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 (AP) A House committee suggested today that the penalty for first conviction for possession of marijuana be reduced to no more than a week in jail.

title: Extramarital Conceptions Found High
description: WASHINGTON, April 7  Onethird of all firstborn chil dren in the United States from 1964 through 1966 were con ceived out of wedlock, a Gov ernment survey disclosed today.

title: Mrs. Diana L. Auchincloss Is Married Here
description: The Dana Chapel at the Madison Avenue Presbyterian Church was the setting yes terday afternoon for the mar riage of Mrs. Diana (Didi) Lippert Auchincloss to Fran cis Alexander Shields, an ac count executive with the in vestment banking house of Loeb, Rhoades & Co.

title: CARL MUELLER, 76, ILLUSTRATOR, DEAD
description: STAMFORD, Conn., April 7 Carl Mueller, a painter and il lustrator, died today at Court land Gardens Convalescent Home after a long illness. He was 76 years old and lived on illustrator, died today at Court Carl Mueller, a painter and Comstock Hill Road, Silver mine, and Greenfield Hill, Fair field.

title: Brewers, With 5 Errors, Routed by Angels in Debut, 120
description: MILWAUKEE, April 7Born out of bankruptcy after 4 years of gestation, the Brewers brought major league baseball back to Milwaukee today, but in name only.

title: In Memoriam
description: HEIZTZITCharles, in cherished memory. A beloved husband and father sorely missed.

title: Phone Pact Ratified
description: The Communications Work ers of America in the New York Telephone Company, last night accepted by a vote of 11,706 to 6,972 a new contract. The ratification by mail ballot af fects about 32,00 workers who will receive an average increase of 30 cents an hour.

title: STOCKS ADVANCE WITH TOKEN GAINS
description: Selected glamour issues came under renewed selling pressure yesterday, while the threat of a new policy of economic changes in Peru weakened prices of certain oil and copper stocks.

title: ORIOLES' M'NALLY BEATS INDIANS, 82
description: CLEVELAND, April 7 (UPI) Dave Johnson drove in three runs and Paul Blair doubled home two today to lead the Baltimore Orioles to an 82 vic tory Over the Cleveland Indians behind the fourhit pitching of Dave McNally.

title: Israeli Cup Soccer Team Faces Stars Here May 10
description: The Israeli World Cup soccer team will face a New York all star team in a special exhibi ion at Randall's Island on May 10.

title: 21 G.I.'s Awarded Medals of Honor Posthumously by President
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 (UPI) President Nixon presented the nation's highest award for bravery today to the families of 21 American servicemen killed in Vietnam.

title: NIXON PANEL ASKS MORATORIUM NOW IN MISSILES RACE
description: WASHINGTON, April 7A prestigious Administration ad visory committee has recom mended that the United States propose to the Soviet Union an immediate moratorium on fur ther deployment of strategic weapons when the talks on control of arms resume in Vienna next week.

title: Perot Is Rebuffed Again By Hanoi's Envoy in Laos
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, April 7 H. Ross Perot, the Dallas bil lionaire, was again re buffed by Communist represen tatives here today in his cam paign to represent the interests of military prisoners in the Vietnam war.

title: Dominican Election Farce
description: The Dominican Republic's second presidential elec tion since the 1965 civil war now seems certain to be a farceone that will increase the danger of another explosion instead of strengthening a fragile democratic system. None of the parties is blameless, and any path out of the crisis will be perilous.

title: PANTHER HEARING RESUMES IN PEACE
description: Pretrial hearings for 13 Black Panthers accused of plotting to bomb public places here re sumed yesterday and continued quietly all day, with consistent ly dignified behavior among de fendants and spectators.

title: Inquiry Into Jailing of Black G.I. Sought
description: A coalition of black political and social activists demanded yesterday that President Nixon authorize a factfinding team composed of our elected offi cials and a local community resident to investigate the im prisonment in Vietnam of a black soldier accused of as sault and resisting arrest.

title: Montsomery Resigns as Head Of the Lincoln Center Repertory
description: Robert Montgomery, the film and television star and onetime television consultant to former President Dwight D. Eisenhower, has resigned as president of the Repertory Theater of Lincoln Center.

title: Plans Are Canceled By German Concern For Carolina Plant
description: A West German chemical concern announced yesterday that it had suspended plans to build a huge chemical complex at Port Victoria, S. C., pending discussions on the formulation of pollution controls.

title: Holzman Terms Pride as Essential Ingredient in Knick Triumph
description: A few giddy minutes after the Knicks had subdued the Baltimore Bullets, 127114, and advanced to the Eastern Divi sion final of the National BaS ketball Association playoffs, Coach Red Holzman was asked what had inspired Dick Barnett to such a fine competitive edge?

title: Princeton Beats N.Y.U., 76, With Four Unearned Runs
description: PRINCETON, N. J., April 7 (AP)  Capitalizing on rival fielding errors to score four un earned runs, the Princeton baseball team beat New York University today, 76.

title: NEW VOTE SOUGHT ON ABORTION BILL
description: ALBANY, April 7Support ers of legislation to reform the abortion law will begin to revive the issue tomorrow when the Legislature returns from a week's recess and begins the push for final adjournment of the 1970 session.

title: Suit Filed to Bar Abortions At Hospital in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 7 The National Federation of Catholic Physicians Guilds and four other groups today filed suits seeking to restrain Thomas Jefferson University Hospital here from performing abortions.

title: SaksFifth Avenue Appoints Three New Vice Presidents
description: Murray Friedman, Roger Gor ing and Elliott Lang have been appointed vice presidents of Saks Fifth Avenue.

title: Sarazen Calls Gypsy Caddies Menace to BigTime Golf Tour
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., April 7 (AP)  Gene Sarazen pre dicted today that tour cad dies would be extinct in the near future in bigtime tour nament golf and would be replaced by boys driving golf carts who would merely service their professionals and not offer advice.

title: New Savings Bond To Bear 6% Is Set By U.S. Treasury
description: WASHINGTON, April 7  The Senate voted today to re quire the Treasury to offer a new type of savings bond bear ing interest at 6 per cent.

title: Major League Baseball
description: American League

title: ELI LILLY POSTS RECORD PROFITS
description: Eli Lilly & Co., a major ethical drug maker also in the agricultural and packaging products field, again posted the first quarter this year, it was reported yesterday from the company's Indianapolis headquarters.

title: Theater: Gamma Rays on Marigolds
description: OFF BROADWAY is at last warming up again. At the weekend we had the engaging Dear Janet Rosen berg, Dear Mr. Kooning, and now I can also most warmly recommended a new domestic drama that arrived last night at the Mercer O'Casey Theater. It is a new play by Paul Zindel and it is one of the best of the far.

title: AIR CONTROLLERS HELD IN CONTEMPT
description: WASHINCTON, April 7  A Federal district judge ruled to day that the Professional Air Traffic Controllers Organization had violated a law forbidding strikes against the Federal Government and held the group in contempt of court.

title: Poulsen of U.S. Clinches Combined Alpine Skiing Title
description: PYHAETUNTURI, Finland, April 7 (AP)Eric Poulsen of Olympic Valley, Calif., clinched the combined Alpine skiing title at the World University Games today by finishing sec ond in the special slalom.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The United States was urged yesterday to propose an immediate moratorium on the deployment of strategic weapons when the armscontrol talks with the Soviet Union resume next week. The proposal was made by the advisory committee to the Arms Con trol and Disarmament Agency. Senate Demo crats said that they would support such proposal. [Page 1, Column 8.1

title: SENATOR KENNEDY SCORES OIL POLICY
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 (AP) Congress must begin revamp ing the nation's oilimport pro gram if the Nixon Administra tion fails to be responsive to the needs of the people, Sena tor Edward N. Kennedy said today.

title: Honey Price Floor Continues
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 (UPI) The Government's price sup port program for honey, Agri culture Secretary Clifford M. Hardin announced today, will continue this year at an av erage of 13 cents a pound. In addition, Mr. Hardin said he was studying the possibility of broadening the program to make support loans on honey stored in bulk, both on and off farms.

title: 6 Foreigners in Colonial Golf
description: FORT WORTH, Tex., April 7 (UPI)Six golfers from four foreign countries will play in the annual national invitation golrf tournament at the Colo nial Country Club here May 11 to 17. They are Bobby Cole and Harold Henning of South Africa, Peter Townsend of Britain, Bruce Crampton and Bob Stanton of Australia and Bob Charles of New Zealand.

title: Stage: Marcel Marceau
description: THE stage at City Center where Marcel Marceau began a threeweek engage ment last night is alivewith fools, pretenders, losers, clowns. This is a oneman show only in the most literal sense.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Nixon Pastor to Hold Service
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 (UPI) The Rev. John Huffman, 29 years old, President Nixon's pastor in Key Biscayne, Fla., will conduct religious services at the White House on April 19. Mr. Huffman is a Presbyterian from Boston. He preaches ser mons geared to young people.

title: New Wave of Tension Brings Wilson Pledge to Keep Troops in Northern Ireland as Long as Needed
description: LONDON, Arpil 7The new wave of tension in Northern Ireland brought a pledge from Prime Minister Wilson today that British troops would stay as long as needed to maintain order.

title: Mills Tells Panel of His Conversion to President's Income Plan for the Poor
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 With all the fervor of an old time evangelist, Representative Wilbur D. Mills told today of his personal conversion to the Administration's modified guaranteed annual income plan for the nation's poor.

title: DOMINICAN TROOPS CLOSE UNIVERSITY
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Domini can Republic, April 7  Presi dent Joaquin Balaguer closed the national university and the headquarters of two major la bor unions with tanks and troops today in a show of mili tary backing for his reelection campaign.

title: The Senate's Duty
description: Every member of the United States Senate has the duty today of making a decision that could affect the course of government in the United States for years to come. It is a decision for which each Senator will have to answer to his own conscience.

title: TVCHANNEL 9, 8 P.M.
Conservatives Nominate Adams and Buckley
description: The Conservative party's state committee nominated two of the party's best votegetters yesterday for Governor and United States Senator.

title: 20 L.I. YOUTHS HELD IN NARCOTICS RAID
description: MINEOLA, L. I., April 7 Twenty youths, most of them high school students and one of hem the son of a high school principal, were arrested today on drug charges.

title: 6 Injured in Cassroom Blast
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., April 7 (AP)Three children and three teachers were injured, four of them seriously, in an explosion during a classroom science ex periment today. The police said there apparently was a leak in an alcohol lamp during an ex periment at the Indian Orchard Elementary School here. The

title: PAY BILL PASSED BY SENATE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 (AP) Acting quickly in the after math of the first postal strike in history, a Senate committee approved unanimously today bill to give all civilian and military Federal workers a Per cent pay increase.

title: Fire Sweeps Jersey Area
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., April 7 (UPI)  Some 150 firemen brought a generalalarm fire under control in about an hour and a half today after it de stroyed or seriously damaged 10 buildings in this city's urban renewal area. All but one of the buildings situated on Speed well Avenue near High Street were deserted and a few fami lies were evacuated without injury, the police said.

title: Flood Put on Restricted List For Not Reporting to Phils
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 7 (UPI)General Manager John Quinn announced today that Curt Flood had been placed on the Philadelphia Phillies' re stricted list for failure to re port.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: The criticism leveled against Judge Carswell recalls that made against Louis Brandeis, nominated by Woodrow Wilson in January 1916, and confirmed several weeks later after much bitter debate. The New York Sun wrote that Brandeis was utterly and even ridiculously unfit. The New York Press called the nomination an in sult to members of the Supreme Court. Opposition was also voiced by The Boston Trahs script and The New York Times.

title: Foreign Affairs: Even the Voice of the Turtle
description: PARISIn former days inter national law was ultimately maintained by the threat of war, and gunboat diplomacy was supposed to teach lessons to nations whose own police de partments failed. Now, how ever, the threat of war as such does not exist as a means of maintaining order since formal conflicts are excluded by every one as too dangerous and in formal conflicts aren't recog nized as existing.

title: Apollo Tests Hint 2 May Get Measles
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., April 7Doctors were keeping close watch tonight on the Apollo 13 astronauts after blood tests indicated that two of the three men may be fight ing off the German measles.

title: DR. S. B. BAMBERGER, CHEMIST, TALMUDIST
description: Dr. Seligman B. Bamberger, who retired in 1961 as vice president of the Delaware Chemical Company in Totten vine, S. I., died in a hospital here Monday after a brief ill ness. He was 74 years old and lived at 251 West 98th Street.

title: ISRAEL DISAVOWS GOLDIVIANN VIEWS
description: JERUSALEM, April 7The Israeli Government said in the Knesset, or parliament, tonight that it had rejected Dr. Nahum Goldmann's effort to meet President Gamal Abdel Nasser of the United Arab Republic be cause Dr. Goldmann was an unsuitable emissary for such a role.

title: Paris Troupe Opens at BarbizonPlaza
description: LE TRETEAU DE PARIS, a producing organization that sponsors French produc tions abroad with French Government support, led off a monthlong run at the Bar bizonPlaza Theater last night with Le Grand Vizir and Le Cosmonaute Agricola, two oneact plays by Rend de Obaldia.

title: Some Teachers at N.Y.U. Demand Dean's Ouster
description: A controversy has flared at New York University over Dr. Ivan L. Bennett Jr., dean of the Medical School, with some faculty members demanding his ouster for past research on biological and chemical war fare.

title: STUDENTS CONTINUE S.I. COLLEGE SITIN
description: Several dozen students at Staten Island Community Col lege continued their takeover of college offices yesterday to press their demand for a larger voice in school administration.

title: 50 BLACK MINISTERS ENDORSE ADDONIZIO
