description: NEWARK, April 7 (AP)May or Hugh J. Addonizio, who has been criticized for failing to aid black residents, has been endorsed by 50 black ministers who contend he has done more for Newark than any mayor has done for his city.

title: Police Taking Referendum On Job Action Over Pay
description: A ballot asking New York City's 24,100 policemen wheth er they will support a job ac tion involving an 80 per cent reduction in police service is to be mailed today.

title: Wrong Baby, Lawsuit Says
description: CHICAGO, April 7 (UPI) Mrs. Claudette Walker, 20 years old( of Chicago, has filed a $1million damage suit against Michael Reese Hospital, assert ing that the hospital gave her another woman's baby. The suit says that Mrs. Walker discov ered the alleged error when the Board of Health sent her a birth certificate for her daugh terborn March 4that listed an Irene Walker as the mother. A spokesman at Michael Reese said there was no record of another mother named Walker in the hospital between March 4 and March 31.

title: Students Plead Not Guilty
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., April 7 (AP)Twenty Springfield Col ege students pleaded not guilty today in the Springfield District Court to charges stemming from a threehour seizure yes terday of the college admin istration. Judge Socrates Gean ocopoulos continued the case until April 28. The white dem onstrators, who staged the takeover in support of a group of black students who were earlier suspended by the col lege, had been freed on bond.

title: Mets Take Opener From Pirates, 53, in 11 Innings
description: PITTSBURGH, April 7The magic that enabled the New York Mets to share top billing with the moon landings in 1969 survived the winter and en abled them today to achieve another first, the last uncon quered horizon left for them:

title: CONTRACTOR SAYS HE BRIBED DOWDY
description: BALTIMORE, April 7 (UPI) A construction company official who was indicted last week with Representative John Dowdy, Democrat of Texas, for perjury, conspiracy and bribery, pleaded guilty today before Judge Roszel C. Thomsen in United States District Court to a charge that he gave Mr. Dowdy $25,000 in cash at the Atlanta airport in 1965.

title: CORNELL BEGINS LOOTING INQUIRY
description: ITHACA, April 7Cornell University began judicial pro ceedings today against a group of black students who broke windows and stole items from the new university store.

title: Rector Bailey, Musician And Teacher, Dies at 57
description: Rector Ralley, a musician who taught and played numer ous instruments, died of cancer Saturday at Flatbush General Hospital in Brooklyn. He was 57 years old and lived at 813 Eastern Parkway, Brooklyn.

title: House Panel Votes To Impose Contract In Railway Dispute
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 The House Committee on In terstate and Foreign Com merce paved the way today for a forced Government res olution of the 18monthold dispute between the nation's railroads and their 48,000 shoperaft workers.

title: Market Place
description: WHILE the Nixon Admin istration expresses con fidence that the slowdown in the nation's economy has been tamedthat the slow down is neither too deep nor too shallowconcern exists at some private observation points that the decline is deepening unduly.

title: Mrs. Hart and Seven Guilty in War Protest
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., April 7 (AP)The wife of Senator Philip A. Hart, Democrat of Michigan, and seven leaders of a Mass for Peace in the Pentagon were found guilty today of violating Federal regulations governing use of the building.

title: Trial Plea Lost in Boston
description: BOSTON, April 7 (AP)The Massachusetts Supreme Court ruled today that the former chairman of the State Parking Authority was not entitled to a jury trial to decide whether an unauthorized person was present in the grand jury room before indictments were re turned charging him with lar ceny and conspiracy. The case of George L. Brady was re manded to Sufflok Superior Court for trial Monday.

title: PADRES' BIG THIRD ROUTS BRAVES, 83
description: SAN DIEGO, April 17 (UPI)  Nate Colbert's threerun homer capped a fiverun third inning and Pat Dobson, making his National League debut, throttled Atlanta tonight as the Padres cuffed the Braves, 83.

title: Augusta Links Changes Expected to Favor Long Hitters
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., April 7 Jack Nicklaus resumed prac tice today for the Masters Golf tournament and admitted re cent changes to the course were advantageous to him.

title: British Soccer Results
description: By Reuters

title: Northwest May Retread Bid for Goodrich
description: Ben W. Heineman, who last year lost his battle for control of the B. F. Goodrich Com pany, may make another bid for the tire and rubber con cern, which he insists is un dermanaged.

title: U.S. TO ENLIST TV IN ANTIDRUG DRIVE
description: CHICAGO, April 7Herbert G. Klein, director of communi cations for the Nixon Admini stration, said today that the White House would ask the commercial television industry at a conference on Thursday to assist the Government's drive against drugs.

title: Guardsmen Can Get MailDuty Benefits
description: All National Guard mem bers called to duty for one or more days during the re cent postal work stoppage are eligible for a number of veterans' benefits to which they would not otherwise have been entitled.

title: ANDREWS TO QUIT COILEGIATE POST
description: Carl W. Andrews Jr., head master of the Collegiate School, the nation's oldest independent day school, has announced his resignation effective June 30, 1971.

title: Tokyo Students See Mayor
description: Mayor Lindsay was visited yesterday at City Hall by two Tokyo high school students as part of the New YorkTokyo Sister City Program. The stu dents, Miss Masako Kobayashi and Mitsuo Makamura, both 17 years old, presented the Mayor with a letter from his Japanese counterpart, Ryokichi Minobe.

title: Charles Pisano, Headed Flavoring Oils Concern
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., April 7  Charles Pisano, the founder and president of the Citrus and Allied Essential Oils Company, Inc., of Floral Park, L. I., died of a heart attack at his winter apartment here yes terday. Mr. Pisano, who lived in Garden City, L. I., was 69 years old.

title: Wildcat Strikes by Teamsters Tie Up Freight in Several Areas
description: Spreading wildcat strikes by rebellious teamsters made thousands of trucks idle in transportation centers across the nation yesterday, para lyzed freight movements in some cities and triggered mounting layoffs in industries.

title: Regan of Buffalo Gives G.O.P. Ticket 2d Upstater
description: ROCHESTER, April 7Get ting a candidate from Buffalo was reported uppermost in Re publican thinking here today as the party; in a quick switch, designated Edward V. Regan to run for State Controller.

title: Governor and Goodell Top Republicans State Ticket
description: ROCHESTER, April 7  The Republican State Committee designated Governor Rockefel ler for reelection today along with his chosen running mates.

title: Soviet Officials Beat Drum for Moscow as Site for '76 Olympics
description: MOSCOW, April 7High Soviet officials suggested to day that no city, including Los Angeles, was as historic ally, culturally and statistic ally prepared to be the site of the 1976 Olympic Games as Moscow.

title: STOCKS DIP AGAIN IN AMEX TRADING
description: The American Stock Exchange turned in its fourth consecutive loss yesterday as the list de clined in very quiet trading.

title: Soviet Lofts Cosmos 330
description: MOSCOW, April 7 (AP)The Soviet Union launched an un manned satellite, Cosmos 330, today on a mission to carry out some unspecified type of space research.

title: The Tombs Called Dungeon of Fear
description: A world of fear, violence, filth and degradation has been described by many of the prisoners who answered an uncensored questionnaire about their living conditions while awaiting trial in the Tombs, the Manhattan House of Detention for Men.

title: FACSIMILE RECEIVER IS SHOWN IN JAPAN
description: TOKYO, April 7  Osahi Shimbun, one of Japan's lead ing newspapers, demonstrated today a home facsimile news paper receiver it has developed for printing both sides of a sheet simultaneously.

title: NEW TIME SYSTEM FOR MOON DEVISED
description: The Apollo 13 astronauts are scheduled to land on the moon at 45 centilunours past 22 lu nours in the ninth lune of the 585th lunation, according to Dr. Kenneth L. Franklin, astrono mer at the Hayden Planetarium.

title: SHORT OF PHILS BEATS CUBS, 20
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 7 (AP) Chris Short, returning after being sidelined a year by back injury that necessitated surgery, pitched a fivehitter today as the Philadelphia Phil lies defeated the Chicago Cubs, 20, in a National League base ball opener.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: CENSUS IS EXPECTED TO FIND 5 MILLION
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 (UPI)The Population Refer ence Bureau, guessed today that the 1970 Census would show 205.5 million Americans, plus at least 5 million more persons who were lost 10 years ago.

title: U.S. Life Unit Appoints
description: The U. S. Life Corporation said yesterday that Marden Miller, executive vice president, had been named to the addi tional post of president of Great National Life Insurance Com pany.

title: M.P.'s Question Trudeau On U.S. Ship With Nerve Gas
description: OTTAWA, April 7 (AP) The Canadian Government was asked today whether it had agreed to a United States ship ment through Juan de Fuca Strait off Vancouver Island of nerve gas bound from Okinawa to Oregon.

title: Advertising: An Arresting TV Sequence
description: The current series of Dodge commercials, whose Southern sheriff star has already gained national prominence, are well on their way to becoming a miniPeyton Place, at least to the folks in Bristol, Tenn.

title: U.S. Boxers in 44 Draw
description: LONDON, April 6 (Reuters) A Police Athletic League team from New York drew, 44, with the British Boys Clubs Associa tion in boxing tonight.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED ON LONDON BOARD
description: The London, stock market closed mixed yesterday as some late selctive buying partly off set an extended decline.

title: 2 in Canoe Mishap Found
description: MOAB, Utah, April 7 (UPI) Two men have been reunited after being swept apart in the Colorado River when their light canoe overturned. Cary Ken nedy of East Brunswick, N. J., had been wandering for two days when he was found along the UtahColorado border yes terday. Stephen Fostner of Toronto had hitchhiked from Cisco, Utah, to Moab after the mishap.

title: TIDIES PRINTERS ADD TO PRESSURE
description: The Typographical union in creased its economic pressure on The New York Times yes terday by extending chapel, or union, meetings and thus stop ping production in the compos ing room for about four hours a shift.

title: UConn Game Site Shifted
description: STORRS, Conn., April 7 (AP) The opening baseball game of the Yankee Conference be tween Connecticut and Massa chusetts will be played here Thursday instead of at Am herst, Mass., because of winter weather conditions at Amherst. The site of the return game April 28 will be shifted from Storrs to Amherst.

title: Right Course on Welfare
description: The Supreme Court has rightly refused to substitute its own judgment for that of the states on the wisdom of putting a top limit on the amount of welfare pay ments any poor family may collect. In effect, the Court has ruled that the Constitution leaves it to the Federal and state governments to establish standards of ade quacy and thus decide how much of governmental re sources will be allocated to welfare.

title: Portland Selects Avina
description: PORTLAND, Ore., April 7 (UPI)Jack Avina, coach at San Mateo Junior College in California, was named head basketball coach at the Univer sity of Portland today. Avina will replace Joe Etzel, who filled in as coach during the past season after the death of Ernie Smith.

title: SENATORS VICTORS OVER TIGERS, 144
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 (AP) Del Unser batted in four runs with a badhop single and triple and Mike Epstein and Lee Maye hit homers as the Wash ington Senators routed the De troit Tigers tonight, 144.

title: SWISS MAY AID U.S. ON BANK ACCOUNTS
description: The Swiss Government, long reluctant to cooperate in any way with United States law en forcement authorities on the subject of secret bank accounts, may now be willing to relent a little, Randolph W. Thrower, Commissioner of Internal Rev enue, implied here yesterday.

title: Offering Price Is $15 For Donaldson Shares
description: The First Boston Corpora tion announced yesterday that the offering price of shares in Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette, Inc., would be $15. First Boston is the managing underwriter of the 800,000share issue, which will be offered publicly to morrow.

title: Ottinger Quits Bar Association To Protest Stand on Carswell
description: Representative Richard L. Ot tinger, a candidate for the Dem ocratic nomination for Senator, announced his resignation yes terday from the American Bar Association because a commit tee of that organization en dorsed Federal District Judge G. Harrold Carswell for the Supreme Court.

title: MRS. WALTER D. WILE
description: Mrs. Edith Lowman Wile, biochemist and wife of Walter D. Wile, a retired lawyer, died Monday at Lenox Hill Hospital. She was 70 years old and lived at 49 East 96th Street.

title: San Diego Bus Drivers Back
description: SAN DIEGO, April 7 (AP) City bus drivers returned to work today under a court in junction that halted a strike throughout San Diego and neighboring cities. A oneday dispute over a new contract made 397 union drivers idle and affected 52,000 commuters.

title: Miss Carol Else Fernsler
description: BEDFORD, Mass., April 7 Miss Carol Else Fernsler plans to be married early next month to Donald W. Rose, son of William A. Rose, president of the New York Athletic Club.

title: Coast Vintners Stock White House Cellars
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 (UPI)California vintners re stocked today the wine cel lars of the White House with a variety of table wines and champagnes produced in President Nixon's home state.

title: Customs Station Planned
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 (AP) The Government hopes to build a customs and immigra tion station at Champlain, N.Y., at an estimated cost of $4.88 million, spokesman said today, The site is along Interstate 87, the Adirondack Northway. Funds have not been included in the proposed budget for the 1971 fiscal year, however.

title: PRICES OF BONDS SHOW A DECLINE
description: Bond prices declined for the second straight day yesterday and yields on new issues were increased without inspiring much enthusiasm from in vestors.

title: NEW DEAN NAMED AT COLUMBIA LAW
description: Michael I. Sovern, a 38year old Columbia University Law School professor who played a major role in efforts to reunite and reform Columbia after student disorders two years ago, was named dean of the Law School yesterday.

title: Janitors Shiver to Success
description: CHANDIGARH, India (AP) Fiftyone janitors, who stood outside the secretariat shiver ing, in the freezing cold in their undershorts, won their point  they were granted woolen uniforms.

title: Columbia Bows to Rutgers In Season's Opener, 105
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., April 7 (AP)Denny Mendoza's sixthinning double tied the score and Larry Robertson fol lowed with a tworun triple to pace Rutgers to a 105 baseball victory over Columbia today.

title: BROAD HOSPITAL AID BACKED BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, April 7, (AP)  The Senate passed 79 to 0 today a $6.2billion bill to extend and expand the Hill Burton hospital aid program. The measure goes far beyond President Nixon's recommenda tions.

title: HITLER REVEALED AS A TAX DODGER
description: BONN, April 7  Among all the other things, it turns out, Adolf Hitler was a tax dodger.

title: Cambodian Villagers Torn Between Fear of Rulers and Love for Sihanouk
description: BANTEAI  CHEI, Cambodia, April 5The Government ofl Salvation is here, said the youth, placing his left fist on the far left edge of the table.

title: Deborah Munsell Prospective Bride
description: BEVERLY, Mass., April 7 Mrs. Robert Edwin Munsell has announced the engage ment of her daughter, Miss Deborah Ann Munsell of New York, to Raymond Em ory Hartz Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Hartz of Bernardsville, N. J.

title: Fieldston Board Threatens Expulsion of Protesters for Future Disruptions of the School
description: A joint board of governors faculty committee at the Field stone school has informed par ents, alumni and students that severe sanctions, including pos sible expulsion, will be invoked in the event of further disrup tions.

title: Nathaniel G. Burleigh, 80, ExDartmouth Professor
description: HANOVER, N. H., April 7 Nathaniel G. Burleigh, profes sor of industrial management emeritus at Dartmotith College and a former acting dean of the Amos Tuck School of Business Administration, died here yes terday at the age of 80.

title: MAX BOZYK DEAD; YIDDISH ACTOR, 71
description: Max Bozyk, a popular per former in the Yiddish theater here, collapsed offstage after finishing a performance at Town Hall Sunday afternoon, and died, apparently of a heart attack. He was 71 years old.

title: CATHOLICS ASSAIL RHODESIA ON RACE
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, April 7 The Roman Catholic Church in Rhodesia protested today against newly enacted laws to increase the segrega tion of the races and indicated it might refuse to obey the Government of Prime Minister Ian D. Smith.

title: U.N. INQUIRY INVITES ARABS AND ISRAELIS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 7 The head of a threeman United Nations committee investigating Israeli practices affecting hu man rights in occupied Arab territories offered today to con vene the committee in Cyprus to hear any Israeli or Arab under Israeli occupation who may be willing to testify.

title: POSTS ARE DRAWN IN PACING SERIES
description: YONKERS, April 7Twenty five colts and two filliesthat was the story today as post positions for Friday night's threerace second round of the $65,000 Ed Sullivan Series were drawn at Yonkers Raceway to day.

title: Big A's Atmosphere Illuminates a Blind Man's World
description: Walter Lotz couldn't see the tote board at Aqueduct yesterday, or the white clouds that drifted lazily in a clear blue sky.

title: Broncos Sign Tight End
description: DENVER, April 17 (AP)The Denver Broncos signed today their No. 6 draft choice, John Mosier of Kansas, a tight end.

title: Fanny May Results for the Week
description: WASHINGTON, April 7Mortgage prices rose again at this week's auction of the Federal National Mortgage Association, the association reported today.

title: Soviet Ship on West Coast
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 7 (AP)  The freighter Ostro gozhsk, the second Soviet mer chant ship to call here in 22 years, docked today with cargo of titanium sponge.

title: Entertainer's Son Guilty
description: BRECKENRIDGE, Colo., April 7 (UPI)Jeffrey Ford, son of the entertainer Tennessee Ernie Ford, pleaded guilty to being disorderly person after mari juana possession charges were dropped, court officials said yes terday. Summit County Judge Lynn Carter granted a continu ance of the case before sen tencing.

title: Help Asked as Consumer Complaints Flood City
description: The city's Department of Consumer Affairs has received so many complaints recently that it is now asking volun teers to pitch in and help.

title: L.I.U. Defeats Post, 10, On 4Hitter by Cappello
description: Charlie Cappello, a lefthand er, pitched a fourhitter and struck 12 attbers to lead Long Island University o a 10 vic tory over C. W. Post College yesterday at the winner's field in Brooklyn.

title: Tax Evasion Is Charged To Financial Consultant
description: A former partner in the in vestment firm of Lazard Freres & Co. was indicted by a Federal grand jury yesterday and charged with having failed to file tax returns on his income of $318,000 from 1963 to 1965.

title: Judge Orders Charge Against Green to Stand
description: OTTAWA, April 7 (AP) The trial of Ted Green of the Boston Bruins began today with an attempt by the de fense to have the charge of common assault quashed on a technicality.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: April 8, 1970

title: BONN DEFENSE CHIEF CONFERS WITH LAIRD
description: WASHINGTON, April 7The West German Defense Minister, Helmut Schmidt, opened con ferences with Senior United States officials today on the future of American military commitments in Europe.

title: LAWRENCE SPIRER
description: Lawrence Spirer, president of the Sonneborn Associates Pe troleum Corporation died, ap parently of a heart attack, last Friday while on a business trip to Haifa, Israel. He was 50 years old and lived at 1237 Knickerbocker Avenue, Ma maroneck, N. Y.

title: SILVER FUTURES REGISTER A DROP
description: Silver futures prices on the New York Commodity Ex change here fell yesterday, in line with slightly lower prices obtained at the Government's silver auction in Washington.

title: Ames to Be Chairman at Lincoln Center When J. D. Rockefeller Retires in May
description: John D. Rockefeller 3d is retiring from Lincoln Center, the cultural complex he was instrumental in creating. On May 11 he will be succeeded as chairman of the board by Amyas Ames, currently board chairman of the New York Philharmonic.

title: New Town Hails Prepaid Group Practice as Prescription for Health
description: COLUMBIA, Md., April 5 A woman in her thirties who has lived in this oncerural area for almost a decade walked into a modern clinic here six months ago to re ceive her first physical ex amination in many years.

title: Robinson, Rua Backcourt Ace, Adept on Offense and Defense
description: The New York Knicks, having successfully got past one of the outstanding one onone players in the Na tional Basketball Association Earl Monroe of the Balti more Bullets must now contend with anotherFlynn Robinson of the Milwaukee Bucks.

title: After 6 Days of Intense Fighting, Foe's Upsurge Appears to Wane
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 7The enemy's country side upsurge on the battlefield appeared to be waning today after six days of intense fight ing.

title: Eisenhower to Throw Again
description: PITTSFIELD, Mass., April 7 (UPI)David Eisenhower, who threw out the first baseball of the season at the Washington Senators' game yesterday, will repeat his performance for the Senators' farm team here on April 25, the club said today.

title: Trumans Cast Local Votes
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., April 7 (AP)Former President and Mrs. Harry S. Truman turned out early today to vote in the municipal election and a special Income tax referendum.

title: Battle of the Titans
description: VIENNASitting on top of mammoth, newly discovered reserves of natural gas, the Soviet Union and the Nether lands are locked in a titans' struggle for the energy markets of Western Europe. A Soviet offensive, which has taken the Dutch somewhat by surprise, has already won customers in Austria, southern Bavaria, and Italy. The Dutch have sewed up Belgium, West Germany as far south as Stuttgart (which includes the industrially potent Ruhr), and France to Paris and the north east. The Royal Dutch Shell group and Standard Oil Compa ny (New Jersey), which opened up the vast Groningen Field in northern Holland, and their Dutch state partners, are now facing the Soviet state mer chants in a battle for markets in the rest of France.

title: Venezuelan Economy, Already Strong, Set to Grow
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, April 5The Venezuelan economy, the strongest in Latin America, is preparing to go into orbit again following a year that wit nessed the peaceful change in Administration and the attend ant business caution.

title: Midnight Cowboy Gets Oscar; Wayne and Maggie Smith Win
description: LOS ANGELES, April 7  John Wayne was named the best actor of 1969 for his role in True Grit tonight at the 42nd annual presentation of awards by the Academy of Mo tion Picture Arts and Sciences.

title: SCHOOLS' SEIZURE BY KIRK IS VOIDED
description: TAMPA, Fla., April 7A Fed eral district judge ordered to day that control of the Manatee County schools be returned im mediately to local officials and that a previously ordered inte gration plan be put into effect by Thursday morning.

title: New Man at the Helm
description: THE new board chairman of the Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts regards the center as almost the the equivalent of a cathedral  a symbol like Chartres, a symbol of our devotion to the arts. Amyas Ames, who became chairman of the New York Philharmonic on April 1, took on the job of reor ganizing Lincoln Center in 1968, and now can say, We've actually put our house in order. Lincoln Center is in sound financial shape. Mr. Ames, discussing his nomination in the Philhar monic board room this week, made the claim in a soft, matteroffact voice. A 6foot 1inch, blueeyed Brahmin whose background reads like something from The Late George Apley, Mr. Aines conveys the impression of a frank, open man who is still embarrassed to talk about himself in spite of his years in the publiceye.

title: Bridge
description: THE comparison of scores by teammates following play in a headtohead match often produces surprises, both pleasant and unpleasant. Perhaps the biggest surprise ever suffered by two players in these circumstances oc curred on the diagramed deal played Sunday in the Con necticut Valley Sectional Championships at Chicopee, Mass.

title: Keep the Trains Running
description: In these days of labor turmoil, it is a minor miracle that railroad shoperaft employes have stayed on the job through the 37 days of wage frustration decreed for them by Congress. The legislated truce expires Sat urday, and it would be reckless for Congress to push its luck by letting the new deadline pass without defin itive settlement of a dispute that has been on a sput tering fuse for a full year.

title: Suclanese Premier Announces An Amnesty for Insurgents
description: CAIRO, (UPI) April 7The Sudanese Premier, Maj. Gen. Gaafar alNimeiry, announced an amnesty today for insur gents in a recent antiGovern ment uprising, the Omdurman radio said.

title: New York Reserve Bank Softens Its Call for Economic Restraint
description: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York, which has long been the principal hawk on the need for economic restraint in the Federal Reserve System, indicated yesterday that it had softened its view on the economy a bit. In the April issue of its official Monthly Review, the bank said that the latest business news con tinues to indicate slowing in the United States economy.

title: The Tricks To Enhance Long Hems
description: MORE anguish than usual is mixed with the pre season hysteria on Seventh Avenue these days as fall collections take shape in de sign rooms. Most designers are as perplexed as the women who wear their clothes over the descent of the hemline. Should they make any short clothes? How can they make long ones look young and snappy?

title: Inquiry on F.B.I. in Klan Death Urged
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 Two organizations long active in Southern civil rights activi ties asked President Nixon to day to investigate the actions of the Federal Bureau of Inves tigation in the death of a wom an member of the Ku Klux Klan and the wounding of her male companion, also a Klansman, nearly two years ago.

title: Bradshaw and Teammates Visit Nixon at White House
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 (AP) Terry Bradshaw, profootball's No. 1 draft choice, and two of his Louisiana Tech teammates met President Nixon at the White House today and pre sented him with an autographed ball.

title: Births
description: HUFFMANHalley Anna. April 3, to Mr. and Mrs. B. Jan Huffman, Peoria, Ill. Grand parents, Mr. and Mrs. Benny J. Huffman, Peoria, Ill. and Mr. and Mrs. Gene H. Donovan, Monticello, N. Y.

title: AID TO LANDLORDS WEIGHED BY CITY
description: In an effort to avert a strike of building maintenance men April 21, the city's Rent Com missioner said yesterday that the Lindsay administration might raise the ceiling on the amount of wage increases land lords are permitted to pass on to tenants of rentcontrolled apartments.

title: Son for Arlo Guthrie
description: GREAT BARRINGTON, Mass., April 7 (AP)Arlo Guthrie be came the father of a son, named Benjamin, last weekend, the Fairview Hospital said today.

title: Linda S. Svirsky To Marry July 9
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., April 7  Miss Linda Susan Svir sky and Robert Dana Gordon will be married July 9 in New York.

title: Tolis Named Basketball Aide
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., April 7 (UPI)Art Tolis, head coach at Indian River (Fla.) Junior Col lege for the last four seasons, was named an assistant basket ball coach at Jacksonville Uni versity today. Tolis posted a 94 23 wonlost record at Indian River and his teams averaged 105 points a game. Jacksonville posted a 272 record this last season and lost to U.C.L.A., 80 09, in the National Collegiate final.

title: Vietnam Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 (AP) The Defense Department to day listed the names of the following servicemfen from the New York area as having been killed in Vietnam:

title: Mrs. Christine Frederick Dies; Home Economist and Author, 87
description: NEWPORT BEACH, Calif., April 7Mrs. Christine Freder ick, a home economist, author and lecturer, died of heart dis ease at a convalescent home here yesterday. Mrs. Frederick, the former Christine McGaffey, was 87 years old.

title: Franklin Bank's Net Declines in Quarter
A. E. DE JONGE, DIES; KINEMATICS EXPERT
description: A. E. Richard de Jonge, an engineer and teacher, and a life long student of kinematicsthe branch of mechanics that deals with motion in the abstract died at St. Luke's Hospital Monday of emphysema. He lived at 875 West End Avenue, and was 87 years old.

title: Black Hecklers Force Lindsay To Discard Model Cities Speech
description: A handful of black hecklers forced Mayor Lindsay to dis card his prepared speech at groundbreaking ceremonies for a new Model Cities housing project in Brooklyn's Bedford Stuyvesant section yesterday.

title: VATICAN EXPERTS DRAW UP CHARTER
description: Vatican legal experts have completed a new draft of a set of fundamental laws intend ed to serve as a constitution for the Roman Catholic Church.

title: N.H.L. Playoffs
description: (4of7 game series)

title: Kopechne Case Is Closed; No One Is Indicted by Jury
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass., April 7 The Dukes County grand jury voted today to indict no one in the death of Mary Jo Ko pechne. District Attorney Ed mund Dinis said, The case is closed.

title: Hope Yerkes Is Betrothed
description: Mrs. John L. Pool of New York and Leonard A. Yerkes Jr. of Wilmington, Del., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Hope Remsen Yerkes, to Robert Z. Bodan. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Casimir Bodan, also of Wilmington.

title: MONDAY NIGHT FIGHT
description: BANGKOK, Thailand  Berk rerk Chartvanchai, 110 pounds, outpointed Bernabe Villacampo, 109, the Philippines, 12 rounds. Chartvanchai won World Boxing Association fly weight title.

title: Tax Bills Called Fatal
description: BOMBAY, India (AP) In cometax bills provoked three fatal heart attacks, according to R. J. Vakil, director of the Indian Heart Foundation.

title: 3 Mideast Issues Seem Near Solution
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 7 In the Arab Middle East it is usually taken for granted that the great political problems, such as the ArabIsraeli con flict, are never solved. One just learns to live with them.

title: Seaway Is Reopened After Winter Hiatus
description: MASSENA, N. Y., April 7 (AP)Regular shipping began on the Saint Lawrence Sea way today.

title: ARMS INITIATIVE IS URGED BY BUNDY
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 McGeorge Bundy, who was na tionalsecurity adviser to Presi dents Kennedy and Johnson, proposed today that the United States take the initiative in the forthcoming talks with the So viet Union on control of stra tegic arms by deferring its planned deployment of a mis siledefense system and of mul tiple warheads for offensive missiles.

title: Sandra Knittle And S. C. Noble Planning Bridal
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L. I., April 8Mr. and Mrs. John W. Knittle of Cold Spring Harbor and North Baldwin, Me., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Sandra Schell Knittle, to Second Lieut. Scott Cromwell Noble, U.S.A., son of Joseph L. Noble of Rochester and St. Croix, Vir gin Islands, and the late Mrs. Kathryn Cromwell Noble.

title: Planners Seek to Shift Custom House Air Rights
description: The City Planning Commis sion has worked out an unusual change in the zoning law, in cluding a transfer of air rights tailored of a private develop er's plans to put up a 50story building at the foot of Broad way.

title: Muggings Anger Mansfield
description: WASHINGTON, April S (UPI) The Senate Democratic lead er, Mike Mansfield, said today that two Senate pages had been mugged in the shadow of the Capitol, and he urged the United States Attorney's office to investigate crime in the District of Columbia. The pages are Harold Sloan; 16 years old, of Seekoank, Mass., and Victor Gould, 15, of Seattle.

title: Wyoming Pipeline Plan
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 (UPI) The Panhandle Eastern Pipe Line Company today asked the Federal Power Commission to day for permission to build 88.6million of pipeline facili ties in Wyoming.

title: TEAMSTER CHIEFS MEET ON STRATEGY
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 The executive board of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters held an emer gency meeting here today, hoping to reassert its leader ship as labor chaos mounted in the trucking industry.

title: Detroit School Board Votes Plan to Redistribute White Students
description: DETROIT, April 8Detroit's school board approved last night a decentralization plan and boundary changes aimed at dispersing the white minor ity students among the city's high schools.

title: HUNTS POINT GROUP GETS CLINIC FUNDS
description: A neighborhood antipoverty group will operate a psychiatric clinic under a contract with the city, the first such agreement ever made, Mayor Lindsay said yesterday.

title: Katherine Sauer to Be Bride Of Pete Gogolak of the Giants
description: PLAINFIELD, N. J., April 8  Miss Katherine Jerusha Sauer and Peter Kornel Gog olak, placekicker with the New York Football Giants, will be married May 31 in Plainfield.

title: Alser of Sweden Captures European Table Tennis Title
description: MOSCOW, April 8 (AP) Hans Alser of Sweden won the men's singles title and Zoya Rudnova of the Soviet Union gained the women's crown to night in the European table ten nis championships.

title: Judge Carswell to Receive University Alumnus Award
description: MACON, Ga., April 8UPI) A Mercer University official said today that Judge G. Har rold Carswell would receive the school's distinguished alumnus award on May 2. The official added that it was dirty pool to say the judge had been turned down for an honorary doctor's degree.

title: 754 Saigon Troops Reported Killed Last Week, the Most in 2 Years
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, April 9 (AP)Enemy attacks killed 754 South Viet namese soldiers last week, the highest weekly Government toll in more than two years and the second highest of the war, South Vietnamese headquar ters announced today.

title: Lindsay Heads Mayors' Appeals for Automobile Pollution Curbs
description: DETROIT, April 8  Mayor Lindsay and seven other big city Mayors pressed demands for antipollution devices today in a private luncheon meeting with the presidents of three automobile companies.

title: Prince Felix of Luxembourg, 77, Husband of Grand Duchess, Dies
description: PARIS, April 8Prince Felix, of Luxembourg, husband of the Grand Duchess Charlotte, died this morning at Fischbach, his castle in the Grand Duchy. He was 77 years old.

title: Rockefeller MortgageLoan Plan Is Assailed
description: The chairman of the Federal Home Loan Bank Board warned yesterday that a proposal by Governor Rockefeller to force savings banks in New York to make mortgage loans on one and twofamily properties in the state at rates below the current market could backfire and result in less, rather than more, money for housing.

title: ESPOSITO SCORES 3 GOALS AT BOSTON
description: BOSTON, April 8With a smirk, Derek Sanderson held up his hands with the peace sign tonight, the ultimate insult toward the end of the game in which the Boston Bruins trounced the Rangers, 82.

title: Bogus Spelling on Bogus Bill
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., April 8 (AP)Bogus $20 bills circulating here have an ob vious flaw, detectives said to day. The name under the Pres ident's picture is spelled An drew Jaccson.

title: CHECKS ON POLICE URGED IN BRITAIN
description: LONDON, April 8An or ganization of British jurists is urging the appointment of in dependent civilian investigators to deal with complaints against the police.

title: Why Workers Rebel
description: From truck drivers to answering services, rebellious unionists are striking at the foundation of collective bargaining by upsetting agreements negotiated in good faith by their union leaders.

title: Paper in Jersey Is Struck By Pressmen and Printers
description: MORRISTOWN, N.J., April 8 (UPI)  Pressmen struck Mor ris County's Daily Record here today and were quickly joined on the picket lines by print ers, causing the paper to sus pend publication.

title: 350 at Columbia Fight Guards After Hearing Kunstler Speech
description: About 350 radical students clashed with campus security guards and broke several win dows at Columbia University last night after hearing a speech in which William M. Kunstler, defense attorney in the recent Chicago Seven conspiracy trial, advised against violence as not the right tactics at this time.

title: Laotians Hold Key Towns
description: VIENTIANE, April 8  Long after many observers here had expected the twin towns to fall, Laotian forces today were still holding off North Vietnamese attacks against Sam Thong and Long Tieng, 70 to 80 miles northeast of Vientiane.

title: Stalin's Dauhter Confirms Marriaje to Architect
description: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz., April 8 Svetlana Alliluyeva, the daugh ter of Stalin, confirmed today that she was married to William Wesley Peters, the vice presi dent of the Frank Lloyd Wright Foundation.

title: Vietnam Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 (AP) The Defense Department to day identified the follow ing servicemen from the New York area as having been killed in action in Vietnam:

title: Plant Has a Spicy Dispute
description: SHIPLEY, England (Canadian Press)  For religious reasons, Pakistani workers could not eat the meals prepared at a York shire engineering plant, so they heated their own curries on radiators, until other workers complained about the smell. In a compromise, an Indian restau rant delivers meals to the fac tory canteen.

title: ORBIT MARKETS RESUME ADVANCE
description: The bond market, which fal tered early this week after a recent sustained advance, re sumed its upward course yes terday.

title: Chair Named for Dr. Rusk
description: Arnold Schwartz, vice presi dent of the Brookdale Founda tion, announced yesterday the endowment of a professorship at the New York University of Medicine to known as the Howard A. Rusk Chair in Re habilitation Research. Dre Rusk is chairman of the department of rehabilitation medicine at the New York University Med ical Center and director of its Institute of Rehabilitation Med icine, which he founded in 1948.

title: Market Place:
description: THE MEETINGS took place at Boston College last week while the students were on their Spring vacation.

title: CARSWELL CALLS TEST AGONIZING
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., April 8 Like his leap into national prominence, Judge G. Harrold Carswell's goodby today was brief.

title: Of Returns Are In So Far I.R.S. Reports Only 60%
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 (UPI) The Internal Revenue Service prepared today for the tradi tional lastminute rush by tax payers trying to file returns before the April 15 deadline.

title: Observer: The Time of the Gritted Teeth
description: WASHINGTON, April 8  Incometax time usually brings out the worst in everybody, or at least in everybody who has to pay income tax.

title: Theater: Musicalizing Hogan's Goat
description: WHOEVER imagined that William Alfred's verse drama Hogan's Goat could be made into a Broadway musical? The answer is now history, for last night this musicalization opened at the Broadhurst Theater. It was called Cry for Us All. I found myself crying only for Mr. Alfred.

title: Senators' Cousins Fined
description: SAN DIEGO, April 8 (UPI) Two teenage cousins of Sena tors Stuart Symington, Demo crat of Missouri, and Albert Gore, Democrat of Tennessee, were fined $120 each and placed on probation yesterday on misdemeanor charges involv ing possession of marijuana. Nicholas S. Symington, 18 years old, and Mark B. Gore, 19, both of Washington, pleaded guilty to the charges.

title: Personal Finance: A. T. & T. Warrants
description: It took more than 300 years, but the common stock warranta kind of security disdained in the best of cor porate circles until nowhas gained respectability. Next Monday, the American Tele phone and Telegraph Compa ny will start selling 31,386, 540 of them.

title: Reconsidering Abortion Law
description: The State Assembly has decided to take a new vote today on the abortion reform law that narrowly missed passage last week. The Senate already has given its approval to this urgent measure; it would now be on its way to Governor Rockefeller for signa ture if parliamentary maneuvering by Speaker Duryea had not kept it from mustering the requisite majority in the Assembly when it was first considered.

title: HOUSE PANEL SEEKS TANK MISSILE TEST
description: WASHINGTON, April 8  The House Armed Services Committee voted today in closed session to instruct the Army to make a comparison shoot off test between an existing antitank missile sys tem, the Shillelagh, and one under development, the TOW.

title: Caddies and Others Succumb to Spring Lethargy as Golfers Take Final Practice at Augusta
Dolphins Name Line Coach
description: MIAMI, April 8 (UPI)  Monte Clark, an offensive tackle for the Cleveland Browns, was named today as offensive line coach for the Miami Dolphins of the American Conference.

title: Bogus Spelling on Bogus Bill
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., April 8 (AP)Bogus $20 bills circulating here have an ob vious flaw, detectives said to day. The name under the Pres ident's picture is spelled An drew Jaccson.

title: Soviet Official Stresses High Cost of Pollution and Calls for Stronger Protective Laws
description: MOSCOW, April 8  A So viet conservation official, call ing for stricter laws to pro tect natural resources, has de clared that water pollution alone is costing the economy more than $6billion a year.

title: Kopechne Inquest's Transcript Held Up at Direction of Court
description: BOSTON, April 8The Mas sachusetts Supreme Judicial; Court agreed today to hold up release of the transcript of the secret Mary Jo Kopechne in quest pending a decision on the status of the inquest sten ographer's notes.

title: PATH Service Is Returning To Normal as Dispute Eases
description: Commuter service on the Port Authority TransHudson rail line was close to normal last night as a slowdown by Local 1330 of the International Brotherhood of Carmen ap peared to be nearing an end.

title: U.S. and Other Nations Plan to Increase Resources of Area Development Bank
description: WASHINGTON, April 8  The United States and them countries of Latin America are nearing agreement on a major increase in the lending re sources of the InterAmerican Development Bank.

title: Disputed Goal Decisive
description: PITTSBURGH, April 8 (AP) Nick Harbaruck, a Pittsburgh Penguin rookie who is a native of Poland, scored a controver sial goal with just over seven minutes remaining tonight that gave the Penguins a 21 victory over the Oakland Seals in the first game of the National Hock ey League quarterfinal playoffs.

title: 6% Drop in Quarter
description: 6% Drop in Quarter

title: Hester Urges a Strong Policy on Protests
description: With the return of spring bringing a crescendo in dem onstrations and disruptions in colleges and universities across the country, New York University's president says a clear, strong policy can help preserve everyone's best in terests.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Commission on Internation al Trade LawCommittee on Laws on International Sales of Goods10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: T. V. Commercial Scores In Final Day at Santa Anita
description: ARCADIA, Calif., April 8 (UPI)T. V. Commercial, with Bill Shoemaker in the Saddle, won the $33,200 San Marino Handicap today. It was the fea tore of the 48th and final day of the winter meeting at Santa Anita.

title: Rupert Hambro Weds Mrs. Butler in London
description: LONDON, April 8Mrs. Robin Butler, London editor of Vogue, and Rupert Nicho las Hambro, a member of the English merchant banking family, were married here to day at the Chelsea Registry Office. The civil ceremony was followed by a service of blessing at noon at the Chel sea Old Church.

title: Attacks Terrorize Pakistanis in London
description: LONDON, April 8In the twilight gloom along Com mercial Road, the dull red brick homes are locked and silent. The Pakistani children peer wideeyed through white window curtains, gazing ner vously at the strangers pass ing on the street.

title: CLARK CALLS CLASH SAD DAY FOR COURT
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 (AP)Former Attorney Gener al Ramsey Clark today called this a sad day for the Su preme Court because it has been subjected to a confronta tion between it and the Presi dent rind with the Senate.

title: Modern Museum Displays Photography as Sculpture
description: IS every threedimensional object featuring some va riety of photographic image on one or more of its surfaces necessarily a work of sculp ture? This is the question posed in the exhibition called Photography Into Sculpture, which opened yesterday at the Museum of Modern Art. Fiftythree works by 23 American and Canadian art ists are included in this exhi bition, which has been organ ized by Peter C. Bunnell, curator of the museum's De partment of Photography.

title: Patrolman Wounded in Eye; Assailant Seized in Bronx
description: A Bronx patrolman was wounded in an eye yesterday afternoon by a ricocheting shot gun pellet after kicking open the door of an apartment in which an armed man had attemoted to take refuge.

title: Roswell Gilpatric Plans to Wed Mrs. Paula M. Washburn May 12
description: Mrs. Paula Melhado Wash burn and Roswell Gilpatric, who was Deputy Secretary of Defense under President Ken nedy, have set May 12 as the date for their wedding. The ceremony will take place at Mrs. Washburn's apartment here.

title: Books of The Times
description: ONCE upon a time in Long Beach, Calif., a high school sophomore started an underground newspaper. It was banned on campus by his principal, who warned him that he was jeopardizing his future; that his reputation as a trouble maker would go into a Federal Bureau of Investigation dossier; that he persisted only because he wasn't good enough to make the official student biweekly. Still,

title: 30 PUPILS IN U.A.R. SAID TO DIE IN RAID
description: EL HUSSEINIYA, United Arab Republic, April 8,  Is raeli jets attacked the nearby village of Bahr el Bakar to day, and Egyptian officials put the dead at 30 elementary school pupils and one teacher.

title: SEDERS TO COMBINE PRAYERS, PROTESTS
description: Outdoor freedom Seders during Passover that will com bine prayers from a new Hag gadah with political protest against the modern pharaohs of business and government are being planned for New York, Ithaca and Washington by a co alition of Jewish peace groups.

title: SISCO STARTS TRIP TO MIDEAST CAPITALS
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 The Administration's top Mid dle East negotiator, Joseph J. Sisco, the Assistant Secretary of State for Near Eastern and South Asian Affairs, left today for quick visits to Arab capi tals and Israel, pursuing the drive for greater flexibility in the longstalled peacemaking efforts.

title: GUILD HONORS TIMES FOR POVERTY SERIES
description: For the second consecutive year the Newspaper Guild of New York has conferred its an nual Page One Award on The New York Times for the Best Example of a Crusading News paper.

title: MeaslesSusceptible Astronaut May Be Replaced
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., April 8Apollo 13 mission planners announced tonight that they may replace one of the astro nauts who is susceptible to German measles with a backup pilot in order to launch the scheduled moon flight on Sat urday.

title: Cornell Blacks Rampage After Amnesty Is Denied
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Thursday, April 9More than 100 black students at Cornell University marched through the campus last night, breaking scores of windows in at least six build ings and overturning two parked cars.

title: Drop in Income for Quarter Shown by Parent of Bank
N. & W. Names a New President
description: John P. Fishwick, hailed as the father of the plan for merging the Chesapeake & OhioBaltimore & Ohio rail roads into the Norfolk & West ern Railway, was named presi dent and chief executive offi cer of the N.&W. yesterday.

title: ANSWERING WORKERS REJECT PHONE OFFER
description: Operators of telephone an swering services rejected a new contract offer last night and continued their dayold strike that has cut off service for 100,000 phone users, about onethird of them doc tors and nurses.

title: The Fun Is Over Fall Look Is Long
description: THE die is cast. Seymour Fox cast it this week. Not with frivolous, faddy fun clothes. With serious coats and suits, the kind that take weeks to tailor properly and cost from $300 to $500. They're for rather conserva tive women who don't go in for kicky fashions  and they're all below the knee. It's more than just long, said the manufacturer who is also his own designer. It's a new proportion. It means the waist changes, the neck lines change, the pockets change?

title: Vietnam Land Reform
description: Sixteen years of broken promises on land reform provide warrant for skepticism about the new legisla tion President Thieu has signed, yet there is now more reason than before to believe that tenant farming at last will be virtually ended in South Vietnam.

title: Mutual Funds Opposed As Members of Big Board
description: The Dreyfus Fund, one of the nation's oldest and largest mutual funds, expressed op position yesterday to fund mem bership on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: ALCATRAZ INDIANS REJECT PARK PLAN
description: ALCATRAZ, Calif., April 8 The Indians on this former prison island in San Francisco Bay rejected yesterday a Gov ernment proposal to turn the island into a park that would have maximum Indian qual ities.

title: Amer. Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Pipers' Strong 3d Period Seals 117107 Defeat of Nets
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD,L. I., April 8A 71point spree in the third quarter helped the Pitts burgh Pipers open a command ing lead and roll to a 117107 American Basketball Associa tion victory over the New York Nets at Island Garden tonight.

title: Protesters Disrupt Classes at Hunter
description: Student demonstrators blocked elevators and chained corridor doors at Hunter College yester day, disrupting most day and evening classes at the 19,000 student branch of the City Uni versity.

title: Australian Couple Awaiting Arrival Of Pacer Today
description: YONKERS, April 8Mr. and Mrs. Mery Wanless, the owners of Lucky Creed, the Australian stallion who will compete in the $150,000 International Pac ing Series on May 8, 15 and 22 at Yonkers Raceway, have hardly stood still since they arrived in this country on March 30.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Orderly Process

title: 4 Stony Brook Aides Suspended Over Alleged Campus Incident
description: STONY BROOK, L. I., April 8 The State University here an nounced today that it had sus pended the director of its high school equivalency program and three of his staff members' pending an investigation of charges that the staff members had threatened, beaten and pistolwhipped four youths in the program.

title: While It Fights, Army Sells Battlefield Scrap to Highest Bidder
description: LONGBINH, South Vietnam, April 8This is probably the first war in American history in which the Army cleans off its battlefields and sells the scrap to the highest bidder as it fights.

title: VOLUME ON AMEX HITS 2YEAR LOW
description: Volume on the American Stock Exchange fell to its low est level in more than two years yesterday as prices con tinued to decline.

title: Philippine Quake Toll 10
description: MANILA, April 8 (AP)The death toll in the Philippine earthquake rose to 10 today as three more persons died in a Manila hospital. Authorities feared the toll would gohigher asreportscameinfromtheprov as reports came in from the provinces.

title: MutualFund Snag Is Tackled in House
description: WASHINGTON, April 8A junior Republican member of the House Commerce subcom mittee initiated an attempt to day to break the deadlock in the subcommittee that has blocked adoption of mutual fund reform legislation for three years.

title: Coeds in India Seek Soccer
description: NEW DELIH, India (AP)  Coeds at Calcutta College have ?? to complain to Prime ?? ?? if cricked ?? ?? ?? ??.

title: How the Senators Voted
description: WASHINGTON, April 8Following is the Senate roll call vote today rejecting the nomination of Judge G. Harrold Carswell to the Supreme Court:

title: Army Drills Plebes for Football War
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., April 8 For the first time since 1966, Army has opened spring football practice following a losing season. Spring drills were delayed that year while the cadets looked for a new head coach and finally set tled on Tom Cahill, the plebe (freshman) coach who took the varsity to an 82 wonlost rec ord. He has re mained as head coach, much to the delight of Army fans, players and brass.

title: JARYIS OF BRAVES BEATS PADRES, 61
description: SAN DIEGO, April 8 (AP) Rico Carty drove in four runs with a homer and sacrifice fly tonight as the Atlanta Braves defeated the San Diego Padres, 61, behind the fivehit pitching of Pat Jarvis.

title: PHILS GET INFIELDER IN PLACE OF FLOOD
description: ST. LOUIS, April 8 (AP) The contract of Guillermo Mon lanez, a first baseman, has been assigned to the Philadelphia Phillies as compensation for Curt Flood's failure to report the St. Louis Cardinals' general manager, Bing Devine, said to day.

title: Kirk Again Defies Integration Order Of Federal Judge
description: BRADENTON, Fla., April 8 Defying a Federal district judge for the second time in three days, Goy. Claude R. Kirk Jr. of Florida tonight again seized control of the Manatee County school sys team and canceled an inte gration plan that the judge ordered put into effect by to morrow morning.

title: CONTEST MARKED BY POWER PLAYS
description: CHICAGO, April 8 (UPI) The Chicago Black Hawks spot ted the Detroit Red Wings the first goal tonight and then ral lied on scores by Pit Martin, Stan Mikita, Chico Maki and Eric Nesterenko for a 42 vic tory in the opening game of their Stanley Cup playoff series. All but one of the six goals came either on power plays or when the scoring team was shorthanded. The exception was Gordie Howe's score, the last Detroit goal, with 11 min utes in the game.

title: MRS. AUSTEN RIGGS OF MENTAL CLINIC
description: STOCKBRIDGE, Mass., April 8Mrs. Alice MacBurney Riggs, widow of Dr. Austen Fox Riggs, an internationally known psy chiatrist and author, died today at her home here. She was 93 years old.

title: CONCERT REVIEWS IOWA COMPOSERS
description: The Contemporary Music So ciety likes to give New Yorkers a look at what composers are doing around the country, and Tuesday night at the Guggen heim Museum it presented mem bers of the Center for New Music from the University of Iowa. What they are doing there is what they are doing here.

title: Bixby to Head Rockefeller Drive for Reelection
description: ROCHESTER, April 8Gov ernor Rockefeller announced today that the chairman of his reelection campaign would be R. Burdell Bixby, the chairman of the New York State Thru way Authority and the head of an informal committee that has been planning Rockefeller po litical strategy for the last year.

title: SCHOOL PLAN GETS MIXED RECEPTION
description: The Board of Education's plan for redistricting Manhattan re ceived a mixed reception yes terday at a public hearing at tended by several hundred bor ough residents.

title: View From the Bridge: Ships or Commuters?
description: There was agreement among governmental and civic organizations yesterday that something ought to be done about the Jersey Cen tral lift bridge over Newark Bay. There was disagreement, however, on how the job should be tackled.

title: Tunney's Daughter Remains In Custody After Hearing
description: CHESHAM, England, April 8 (UPI)  A magistrates court ordered today that Joan Tunney Wilkinson he held in custody for another week while the police continue their investiga tion of charges that she mur dered her husband.

title: CITY ACTS TO PAY ITS BILLS QUICKLY
description: A task force to speed pay ment of bills by the city to contractors and suppliers of materials was appointed yester day by Mayor Lindsay.

title: SWEDES NOW SEEK TO ENTER MARKET
description: LONDON, April 8Sweden, in a shift of policy, is now eager to join the Common Mar ket if her special political needs can be met.

title: Atlantic Ave. Bill Is Dead for Now
description: ALBANY, April 8Respond ing to protests by a group of Brooklyn homeowners, the sponsors of a controversial bill for the rehabilitation of Atlan tic Avenue said today that they would withdraw the legislation from consideration this year.

title: Wings Shift Game Again
description: DETROIT, April 8 (AP) The Detroit Red Wings changed today their Saturday game with the Chicago Black Hawks hack to a night game. The No. 3 game in the fourofseven Stanley Cup Hockey series originally was booked as a night game but was changed to an afternoon contest by the Red Wings cariler this week.

title: Miller Recital Postponed
description: The recital of contemporary piano music originally an nounced for performance by Robert Miller at the 92d Street Young Men'sYoung Women's Hebrew Association on Sunday has been postponed to May 26.

title: 83 to Tee Off Today in Masters
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., April 8 Gary Player of South Africa and two United States pro fessionals, Jack Nicklaus and Arnold Palmer, were con sidered prime favorites to day to win the Masters golf tournament that begins here tomorrow.

title: '70 Economic Lag Seen; Profits at Factories Off
description: The view that the economy was slowing down was given further support here yesterday as toplevel bankers forecast that 1970 would be the first of two or three years of sub standard growth.

title: Film Festival in Canital To Focus on Pollution
description: About 50 movies on the problems of pollution will be shown in Washington at the Environmental Film Festival, which runs from April 23 to 25.

title: COMMON MARKET STIRRED ON EXNAZI
description: PARIS, April 8  The West German Foreign Ministry is quietly canvassing opinion on placing a former Nazi diplo mat on the Executive Com mission of the European Eco nomic Community, arousing strong unfavorable reaction in Brussels, Paris and The Hague.

title: BALTIMORE SEALS VICTORY IN SECOND
Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Pirates, at Pittsburgh. (Radio  WJRZ, WNBCFM, P.M.)

title: IND RIDER SLASHED; SUSPECT GIVES UP
description: A tall man stepped into a southbound EE local of the IND subway after it stopped at the 34th Street station yes terday and, for no apparent reason, walked over to a 75 yearold man and slashed him with a long knife on both sidees of the face.

title: BEAN OIL FUTURES ACHIEVE RECORDS
description: Soybean oil futures advanced to new highs for the season in the two options offered, while meal and soybean fu tures also closed strongly on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday.

title: Acquisition Made By John's Bargain In $16Million Deal
description: John's Bargain Stores Corp oration announced yesterday it has completed the previously announced acquisition of Sprayregen & Co., members of the New York Stock Exchange, for $16million in preferred stock of one of its subsidiaries.

title: In The Nation: Let's Hear It for Finch
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 Bully for Bob Finch! He man aged at his news conference Tuesday to make the Nixon Administration seem bold and progressive on school desegre gation, and that was no mean feat.

title: Canada Acts in U.N. To Protect Arctic Against Oil Spills
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., April 8Canada has taken action here to protect her rights to defend her Arctic coasts against possible oil pol lution if tankers begin using the Northwest Passage.

title: Leary Pleads for Bail
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 8 (AP)Timothy Leary, the psy chedelic drug advocate, asked the California Supreme Court yesterday to let him out of prison on hail while he appeals a conviction for possessing marijuana.

title: Gulf Resources Subsidiary To Trim Zinc Output 15%
description: The Bunker Hill Company, a subsidiary of the Gulf Resources and Chemical Corporation, an nounced yesterday in Houston that it would match the actions of competitors by cutting zinc production about 15 per cent.

title: SOUTHERN UTILITY TO ADD FACILITIES
description: The Southern Company plans to spend $1.5billion on new electric operating facilities in the threeyear period ending 1972, Harllee Branch Jr., chair man, told a luncheon meeting of the New York Society of Security Analysts yesterday.

title: Philharmonic Manager Is Put to Test
description: For 27 years, Helen Thomp son have been giving profes sional advice to symphony orchestra managers. Yester day, she started seeing how her own advice works.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Thursday, April 9, 1970

title: Australia and France Set America's Cup Test
description: SYDNEY, Australia, April 8 (Reuters)  Australia and France, vying for the right to challenge the United States for yachting suprema cy in the 1970 America's Cup series, will meet in art elimination test starting Aug. 21, the Royal Sydney Yacht Squadron said today.

title: GUSTAF A. TENGGREN, CHILDREN'S ARTIST
description: WEST SOUTHPORT, Me., April 8  Gustaf Adolf Teng gren, illustrator of children's books, died Monday in a Booth bay Harbor hospital after a brief illness. He was 73 years old.

title: TIGERS SET BACK SENATORS, 3 TO 0
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 (UPI) Bill Freehan hit a tworun homer and Joe Niekro chalked up a sixhit shutout in his American League debut to night to lead the Detroit Tigers to a 30 victory over the Wash ington Senators.

title: Parvin Plans Change of Name To Counter Adverse Publicity
description: The ParvinDolirmann Com pany, which has been involved in a welter of controversy for more than a year on charges ranging from illegal stock deal ings to seeking influence with Federal officials, plans to change its name to the Recrion Cor poration.

title: Kaiser Aluminum Will Increase Primary Price 1c a Pound to 29c
description: The Kaiser Aluminum and Chemical Corporation an nounced yesterday in Oakland, Calif., that it would raise the price of primary aluminum to 29 cents a pound from 28 cents and would impose cor responding increases on fabri cated products.

title: Proxy Statement Reveals Pay of Penn Central Chief
description: It was disclosed yesterday that, when Paul A. Gorman was hired by the Penn Central Com pany as its president and chief executive officer last Dec. 1, directors of the transportation company gave him an employ ment contract under which his salary was $250.000 a year.

title: LENDING BUILT UP IN LATIN AMERICA
description: LENDING BUILT UP IN LATIN AMERICA

title: London Star Writes Musical About Rise Of a Union Leader
description: LONDON, April 8A grand slam for Trevor Peacock, who wrote its book and score and appears as its star, Erb, at the Strand Theater, amounts to another broken date in the Brit ish musical's flirtation with la bor relations subjects.

title: Pro Dog Handlers Also Win Ribbons Outside Show Ring
description: Aprofessional handler's per formance in the show ring is only the tip of the dogtraining iceberg, said Mrs. Lois Meistrell at the Dog Fanciers Club luncheon yesterday at the Overseas Press Club. It's the part of the iceberg that isn't seen, she said, that means so much  the months spent get ting the dog ready and other activ ities for which the public isn't aware. Mrs. Meistrell, a member of the Professional Handlers Association and a breeder, exhibitor and stew ard for nearly 30 years, gave some example of the little known roles played by the professional.

title: 45 Jewish Activists Arrested After Protest on Philanthropies
description: Singing as they were led away, 45 young Jewish activists were arrested yesterday after taking part in a sixhour occu pation of the midtown offices of the Federation of Jewish Philanthropies.

title: Advertising: Hosiery in the Supermarkets
description: A year ago the Hanes Cor poration (a name to conjure with in hosiery) came to DancerFitzgerald  Fitzgerald (a big name in packagegoods advertising) with a shriveled up pair of stockings and an equally shriveled set of panty hose. Hanes, a leading brand in department store sales, wanted to get into super markets and drugstore chains to compete with some 600 brands sold there.

title: NEVA PILGRIM SINGS SONGS OF ECSTASY
description: Four previously unperformed songs by Ralph Shapey were sung by Neva Pilgrim, soprano at Carnegie Recital Hall last night in a recital sponsored by Carnegie HallJeunesses Musi cales.

title: Thieu Plans to Seek Legislation Enabling Him to Rule by Decree
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 8 (Reuters)  Premier Tran Thien Khiem told the Sen ate today that President Nguy yen Van Thieu intended to send legislation to Parliament to en able him to govern by decree.

title: AQUEDUCT TO USE THE SYSTEM FIRST
description: With the intention of further increasing revenue from thor oughbred racing to the state treasury, as well as attracting more patrons, the New York Racing Association announced yesterday that it would offer exacta betting at its tracks.

title: ROBERT INGALLS, 51, CONNECTICUT COACH
description: WILLIMANTIC, Conn., April 8D. Robert Ingalls, assistant to the athletic director at the University of Connecticut, died today at Windham Community Hospital. He was 51 years old.

title: GRAND PRIX GETS I.L. T. F. BACKING
description: Amid much pomp in London, the International Lawn Tennis Federation authorized yester day an experimental Grand Prix circuit of 18 men's tourna ments this year, including the Wimbledon and United States Open championships.

title: CARDS' 5RUN 9TH ROUTS EXPOS, 72
description: MONTREAL, April 8 (UPI) Richie Allen, making his first regularseason appearance in a St. Louis uniform, drove in three runs with two doubles and a homer today as the Cardinals scored a 72 victory over the Montreal Expos, tally ing five runs in the ninth inning.

title: BUCKLEY PREDICTS A SHIFT BY VOTERS
description: James L. Buckley, the Con servative party candidate for United States Senator, predict ed yesterday that his party would do better at the polls this year than ever before be cause the trend is toward the, conservative view.

title: St. Louis Routs Worsley
description: ST. LOUIS, April 8 (UPI) Ab McDonald and Terry Crisp scored two goals each tonight in leading the St. Louis Blues to a 62 victory over the Minne sota North Stars in the first game of their Stanley Cup quar terfinal series.

title: U.S. BRIEF CRITICAL OF BUSING ORDER IN SOUTHERN CASE
description: WASHINGTON, April 8The Government entered the con troversial Charlotte, N. C., school desegregation case to day, suggesting that a United States district judge had corn mitted an abuse of discretion by ordering an extreme bus ing plan.

title: DENVER STOCK SALE NEWHOUSE PROPOSES
description: DENVER, April 8 (AP)  Samuel I. Newhouse has pro posed the public auction of some 15,000 shares of The Denver Post as part of a Fed eral District Court settlement between Mr. Newhouse and the newspaper.

title: Goldmann Declares Some Israeli Aides Favored His Plan
description: JERUSALEM, April 8  Dr. Nahum Goldmann, president of the World Jewish Congress, said today that a number of influen tial Israeli Cabinet ministers who voted against his proposed meeting with President Gamal Abdel Nasser of the United Arab Republic were in favor of such a mission as a private venture.

title: Principal Held in Room
description: Thirtyfive students at Ben Mamin Cardozo High School in Bayside, Queens, were arrested yesterday after they allegedly barricaded the principal in a conference room and restrained him from leaving when he told them that their discussions of student demands could not take place during class hours.

title: The Carswell Decision
description: The Senate's rejection, by the astonishing vote of 51 to 45, of the nomination of Judge G. Harrold Cars well to the Supreme Court is a triumph of constitu tional responsibility over political partisanship.

title: 42,000 TIRES FAIL TESTS FOR SAFETY
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 The Department of Transporta tion announced today that more than 42,000 Goodrich auto mobile tires had failed Federal safety tests and could be haz ardous under certain condi tions.

title: McCarthyism From the Left
description: McCarthyismthis time emanating from elements of the New Left instead of the Old Rightis beginning to reappear on some college campuses.

title: Printers and Papers Here Report Some Progress in Talks and Turn Attention to Money Issues
description: Negotiators for the printers and the city's major newspa pers began to grapple with the critical money issue yesterday after having made some prog ress on noneconomic matters.

title: CITES REVERSALS BY HIGHER COURTS
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 Senator Marlow W. Cook of Kentucky, who held one of three Republican votes crucial for the confirmation of Judge G. Harrold Carswell to the Supreme Court, said today that he finally decided to vote against confirmation after at tending a White House cere mony yesterday for the post humous presentation of 21 Medals of Honor.

title: Conservative Rabbis Elect Levi of Queens as Leader
description: KIAMESHA LAKE, N.Y., April 8The Rabbinical Assem bly, an international association of Conservative rabbis, elected Rabbi S. Gershon Levi of New York as president of the 1,000 member body today.

title: STOCKS CLOSE DAY IN DRAW SESSION
description: Computer stocks recovered somewhat yesterday from their recent battering while leading industrial issues held to an even keel.

title: F.D.A. CALLED TOOL OF FOOD INDUSTRY
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 A team of investigators directed by Ralph Nader issued a report today portraying the Food and Drug Administration as a tool of the food indus try, controlled by political pressures and unable and un willing to protect the consumer.

title: Gift Exchange Is Inflated
description: SARASOTA, Fa. (AP)Mrs. Madeline Mitts informed the newspaper here that the Sola Bay Yacht Club would have a party at which members would exchange $1 gifts; The story on the part said $100 gifts.

title: CeaseFire Reported Proposed by Laotian Premier
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, April 8 (UPI)  The Laotian Premier, Prince Souvanna Phourna, re portedly proposed today that peace talks suggested by the proCommunist Pathet Lao be preceded by a ceasefire and a halt in United States bombing except against the Ho Chi Minh Trail.

title: GOLDBERG FAVORS CONSCRIPT LIMIT
description: Arthur J. Goldberg, candi date for the Democratic nomi nation for Governor, urged yes terday that New York legis lators support a bill that ques tions the right of the Admin istration to send conscript troops to Vietnam.

title: New Dean Is Chosen At Bryn Mawr College
description: BRYN MAWR, Pa., April 8  Mary Patterson Mc Pherson, associate dean of Bryn Mawr College, has been elected dean responsible for all academic activities of the undergraduate college.

title: Hundreds of Mayors Hold Protest March in Paris
description: PARIS, April 8Several hundred mayors sporting the tricolor sash of their office marched through part of the Left Bank of Paris today to protest the poor state of mu nicipal finances.

title: Petleas and Melisande Offers New Singers in Principal Roles
description: Is it really possible to be come a Pelleas or a Melisande in, and for, just one perform ance? Richard Stillwell and Lois Crane may have asked themselves that question Tues day night as they took over the title roles of Debussy's opera in the New York City Opera production at the New York State Theater.

title: 9 INDICTED BY U.S. OVER I.R.S. BRIBES
description: Eight reputed Mafia members were indicted here yesterday by a Federal grand jury on charges of bribing Internal Rev enue Service agents. A ninth was indicted for not paying, his income tax.

title: PRAGUE NOW UNSURE OF RUSSIANS' VISIT
description: VIENNA, April 8President Ludvik Svoboda of Czechoslo vakia returned home today from Moscow amid signs that the Communist leadership in Prague was puzzled by the widespread rumors of possible power shifts in the Kremlin.

title: MARINE HIJACKER INDICTED IN ITALY
description: ROME, April 8 (AP)Italy Indicted Raffaele Minichiello to day on eight charges but did not accuse him of having hi jacked the Trans World Air lines jet he seized at gunpoint over California last November.

title: NIXON WILL PRESS FOR CONSERVATIVE
description: WASHINGTON, April 8  President Nixon was described today as being disappointed by the Senate rejection of Judge G. Harrold Carswell but determined to press his search for a conservative candidate for the Supreme Court.

title: SSC&B Agency Adds HighRanking Officer
description: SSC&B has lengthened its roster of executive vice pres idents with the addition of Michael G. Turner, a senior vice president at Ogilvy & Mather. He will also be a director and a member of the executive committee when he starts to work on May 1.

title: Quake Felt in Philippines
description: HONOLULU, April 8 (AP) A moderate earthquake was re corded today in the vicinity of Luzon in the Philippine Islands, the Honolulu observatory of the International Information Center reported.

title: Soviet Ship on West Coast
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 7 (AP)  The freighter Ostro gozhsk, the second Soviet mer chant ship to call here in 22 years, docked today with a cargo of titanium sponge.

title: Gross Quits as C.O.P. Chairman In Jersey to Run for the Senate
description: TRENTON, April 8  Nelson G. Gross resigned as New Jer sey's Republican state chair man tonight and will announce his candidacy tomorrow for his party's nomination for United States Senator.

title: Building Closed at Stanford
description: STANFORD, Calif., April 8 (AP)  Facing threats of more disruptions by antiwar pro testers, Stanford University's president, Kenneth S. Pitzer, has ordered a building housing Reserve Officer Training Corps classrooms closed for 90 days to all but authorized students and instructors. Mr. Pitzer acted yesterday after demon strators caused disruptions twice at Stanford and once at the University of Californa in Berkeley.

title: A MAJOR SETBACK
description: WASHINGTON, April 8The Senate, turning down President Nixon on a nominee for the Su preme Court for the second time, rejected Judge G. Harrold Carswell today, 51 to 45.

title: Caliente Race Track Head Indicted on Tax Charges
description: SAN DIEGO, April 8 (AP)  John S. Alessio, who rose from shoeshine boy to millionaire manager of a race track, was indicted by a Federal grand jury yesterday on charges of income tax evasion and fraud.

title: VORSTER ASKS END OF WHITE DISUNITY
description: DURBAN, South Africa, April 8Prime Minister John Vor ster called last night for ending the divisions that have long prevailed in South Africa's white minority.

title: BOSCH IS DUE BACK IN SANTO DOMINGO
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Domini can Republic, April 8Former President Juan D. Bosch is to return here next week to lead his Dominican Revolutionary party in the crisis over the presidential election.

title: N.H.L. Playoffs
description: (4of7 game series) EASTERN DIVISION Boston vs. Rangers

title: Dissenter Fails to Dim Auto Show's Shine
description: WHILE thousands of visi tors streamed into the Coliseum the other night to view the gleaming new cars at the annual International Automobile Show, Steven Is raeloff stood outside, holding court as he leaned against his purple Dodge Challenger.

title: Politics and the Carswell Vote
description: WASHINGTON, April 8  there is no simple explanation or the votes of the 51 Sen ators who rejected Judge G. Harrold Carswell's nomination to the Supreme Court today. Many votes were cast auto matically for liberalism or against conservatism. Many were plainly cast to dramatize President Nixon's vulnerability or even to discredit him politically as a champion of Southern racism. The crucial ballots by a few Republicans, and notably Mar low W. Cook of Kentucky, were cast not in defiance of the White House but with regret that Mr. Nixon had to be hum bled a second time on this Court appointment.

title: CELANESE PROFIT OFF IN QUARTER
description: The Celanese Corporation earned $15.7million, or $1.10 a share, in the first quarter this year, down 16 per cent from a net of $18.4million, or $1.31 a share, for the same period a year ago. Sales of $259.5million compared with $299million in the first quar ter of 1969, a decline of 13 per cent, reflecting primarily the sale of the company's petroleum subsidiaries effective Jan uary 1.

title: TeenAgers Throw a Boy Into Rubbish Fire in Bronx
description: A 12yearold boy was seri ously burned yesterday in Cro tona Park, the Bronx, when he was thrown into a rubbish fire by three teenaged boys. He suffered seconddegree burns of the face.

title: 3 DIRECTORS SHARE MARGO JONES PRIZES
description: Winners of the Margo Tones Awards, given annually to com panics fostering the works of new playwrights, were an nounced yesterday.

title: The Patronage Court an Issue Again
description: Four years after the Demo cratic primary for Manhattan Surrogate was waged over the issue of reforming the court's patronage practices, the two judges who admin ister more than $1billion worth of estates a year are pursuing contrasting legal concepts that are expected, once again, to become im portant campaign issues.

title: Guatemalan Red Slain By a Rightist Group
description: GUATEMALA, April 8 (Reuters)A group of right ists today clubbed a Com munist to death in revenge fo rthe killing of ambassador Karl von Spreti of West Germany.

title: Harcourt, Brace Reshuffles Its Team
description: In an internal reorganiza tion at Harcourt, Brace & World, Inc., William Jova novich has stepped down as president to become chair man of the board, while re retaining the title of chief executive officer.

title: DEMOCRAT IS CHOSEN NEW ORLEANS MAYOR
