description: NEW ORLEANS, April 8 (AP) City Councilman Moon Land rieu, a Democrat, was elected Mayor yesterday in a general election that showed surprising Republican strength and gave the Legislature its only G.O.P. Representative.

title: Cherry Blossoms Awaited
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 (UPI) The 1970 Cherry Blossom Festival has opened without the cherry blossoms. The tree limbs were almost hare, held hack by a chilly spring, as the festival opened yesterday. But officials predicted that the branches would he laced with pink and white by next week end, in time for the end of the annual festival.

title: Yemen Ratifies Accord To End Saudi Dispute
description: ADEN, Southern yemen, April 8  The Yameni radio said today that the National Assembly of neighboring Ye men had endorsed the terms of an agreement that would end the sevenyear dispute between the republican authorities in Yemen and the kingdom of Saudi Arabia.

title: House Plants Are Fashion at Bendel's
description: ONE of the games that Henri Bendel enjoys the most is called surprise and the idea is to always come in first. The new Plant Stand that takes up a large 57th Street window and greets cus tomers as they are ushered through the front door of the store is a case in point.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Immigration. The President signed a bill amending the Immigration and Naturaliza tion Act to eliminate delays experienced by fiances of Americans in getting immi grant visas. Financees of United States citizens and the fiances' minor children can be admitted for perma nent residence provided the marriage takes place within 90 days of entry into the country. The bill also makes it easier for aliens with spe cial skills to work in this country.

title: C.B.S. and Time Ask Newsmen's Release
description: Time Inc. and the Columbia Broadcasting System appealed to news organizations through out the world yesterday to help assure the safety and gain the release of five newsmen, in cluding two Americans, who are reported to have been cap tured by the Vietcong in Cam bodia on Sunday and Monday.

title: Seoul Cavein Kills 18
description: SEOUL, South Korea, April 8 (Reuters)At least 18 persons were killed and nine others feared buried under tons of concrete after a fivestory apartment house collapsed here today.

title: An English Professor Who's Researching Recipes
description: MRS. WILLIAM OWEN, an English professor who recently took her doctorate in 18thcentury poetry, has plunged right back into the tomes of 200 years ago, but with a different focus. This time it's on the cooking of Colonial America.

title: Sports of The Times
description: ONCE, baseball, like spring, halfsurprised us: We would awake one morning, with no special warning, and there, a Louisville Slugger sprung from a crocus bed, was the fresh new season. There would have been har bingers, to be sure, vague reports from Florida and Califor nia of a rookie who could do it all, of dissension among the world champions, of a rules change that would wipe out our choicest memories. But when the season opened, it opened suddenly and the promise of it took our breaths away. The season is in its fourth day today and it might as well be July. The reports from the South were continuous and unpleasant last month and they made it clear that fans could very well question what two generations had taken for grantedthat baseball was basically fun to play and own, and that baseball was basically honest.

title: U.C.L.A. GLEE CLUB GIVES CONCERT HERE
description: The Men's Glee Club of the University of California at Los Angeles paid its respects to German baroque sacred music, at the start of its concert in Alice Tully Hall last night.

title: ANOTHER QUIET DAY AT PANTHER HEARING
description: The pretrial hearings of 13 Black Panthers accused of pot ting to bomb public places were conducted quietly yester day for the second day.

title: Chicago Priests Seek an End of Rule on Celibacy
description: CHICAGO, April 8 (AP)An association of Roman Catholic priests from the Chicago arch diocese, the nation's largest, will ask Pope Paul VI to rescind the rule prohibiting priests from marrying.

title: Negro Elected in Long Beach
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., April 8 (AP)Voters here have elected the city's first Negro Council man. In a special election yes terday, James Wilson, a 42 yearold management consult ant, was chosen to fill the un expired term of Councilman Cemmett Sullivan. Mr. Wilson will serve until June, 1972.

title: Phelps to Coach Fordham Basketball
description: Richard Phelps, 28 years old, the chief recruiter in Penn's fouryear growth from college basketball oblivion to a nationally ranked power, was named yesterday as the Fordham coach.

title: ARTIFICIAL BLOOD TRIED IN ANIMALS
description: WASHINGTON, April 8  Artificial blood, milky and opa lescent in appearance, may have a future in medical emer gencies in some kinds of special medical treatment and in preserving tissues for trans platation, a scientist suggested today.

title: Burch Sees Role as Public's Guardian
description: CHICAGO, April 8  Dean Burch, chairman of the Federal, Communications Commission, told the nation's broadcasters today that they should not re gard him as their friend in Washington or as their foe, but as the man charged with seeing that they serve the public. Fur ther, he criticized television's programing for children.

title: Penn Central Marks Turbo Train's Birthday
description: The New YorkBoston Tur bo Train became a birthday party on wheels yesterday its first anniversary in serv ice  as passengers were served free cake and coffee to commemorate the event.

title: U.S. Arms Ship, Freed, Leaves Cambodia
description: REAM, Cambodia, April 8 The hijacked freighter Colum bia Eagle, her cargo of 1,753 long tons of napalm and her crew of 13 were returned to United States control today, and she sailed quickly out of Cambodian waters.

title: Janet Maxfield Will Marry in June
description: GREENWICH, Conn., April 8The Rev. Dr. Otis A. Max field, senior minister of the Second Congregational Church here, and Mrs. Max field have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Janet Maxfield, to David W. Duncan, son of Mr. and Mrs. Donal B. Dun can. A June wedding is planned.

title: ASSEMBLY REVIVES BILL ON ABORTION FOR 2D VOTE TODAY
description: ALBANY, April 8Support ers of abortion reform revived their bill to end the present state law after tortuous parlia mentary maneuvering during which 12 absent members were ordered brought to the cham ber by whatever force neces sary.

title: F.A.A. Ready to Relax Flight Restrictions Imposed in Airport Work Stoppage
description: The Federal Aviation Ad ministration announced that yesterday that emergency flight restrictions imposed 10 days ago in New York and Chicago because of the air traffic con troller sickout would be re duced because some controllers had returned to work.

title: Ginastera Work Replaced
description: Alberto Ginastera's Milena, Cantata No. 3 for Soprano and Orchestra, which was originally announced for its world pre miere performances in the New York Philharmonic concerts of April 16, 17 and 18, will be replaced by Stravinsky's The Song of the Nightingale. The Ginastera work was not com pleted in time for presentation next week.

title: Listing of New Books
description: FICTION

title: CAMBODIA REPORTS 300 OF FOE KILLED
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Thursday, April 9  Official sources said that Cambodian troops killed 300 Vietcong early today after a latenight ambush between the town of Svayrieng and Prasot, 16 miles from the border with South Vietnam.

title: Tenant Units Urge City to Confiscate Buildings
description: A group of tenant organizers released their own report on housing yesterday, contending that landlords were enjoying superprofits and proposing that the city confiscate poorly maintained buildings and let community organizations man age them.

title: Former Rep. Johnson Pays Visit to the House
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 (AP)Former Representative Lyndon B. Johnson, Demo crat of Texas, exercised to day his right to appear on the House floor.

title: Two Colorado Men Gain In Bowling at Knoxville
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., April 8 (UPI)  Two Colorado men moved into the top 10 in reg ular singles and allevents to day in the American Bowling Congress tournament.

title: SENATE APPROVES FEDERAL PAY RISE
description: WASHINGTON, April 8The Senate passed a 6 per cent raise today for 5.6 million Federal employes.

title: Bridge
description: THE team championship of the Metropolitan Com mercial Bridge League, con tested over a fivemonth period, ended recently in a slender victory for Interna tional Business Machines, whose team won nine of its 12 matches.

title: American Motors Expects '70 to Be Losing Year
description: DETROIT, April 8The Amer Scan Motors Corporation chair man, Roy D. Chapin Jr., in speech before automotive ana lysts In New York City today, the text of which was released here, said 1970 will be a loss year. The auto manufacturers' fiscal year ends Sept. 30.

title: Savings Bond Move Clarified
description: The senate was voted to re quire the Treasury to offer a new type of Savings Bond bearing interest at 6 per cent. In yesterday's editions of The New York Times, it was in correctly indicated in a head line that such a Savings Bond was already set by the Treasury. Actually, the bill must first go to conference with the House, where the Treasury will pre sumably makes its position known.

title: GREEK PROSECUTOR URGES HARSH TERMS
description: ATHENS, April 8The pros ecutor at the Athens military tribunal trying 34 intellectuals on sedition charges asked to day for one death penalty, four life sentences, prison terms to taling 288 years, and three ac quittals.

title: Congress Imposes Settlement in Railway Dispute
description: WASHINGTON, April 8  Emergency legislation designed to avert a threatened railroad strike sped through Congress today and was sent to the White House.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: 72 Killed, 282 Hurt in Osaka by Gas Blasts at Subway Construction Site
description: OSAKA, Japan, Thursday, April 9A total of 72 persons were killed and 282 injured yesterday when a series of gas explosions ripped a subway construction site in downtown Osaka.

title: NIXON POPULARITY PUT AT A NEW LOW
description: PRINCETON, N. J., April 8 Public approval of President Nixon's performance dropped; to a new low just before he dispatched troops to move the mail in New York City, the Gallup poll said today.

title: Coast Antismag Director
description: LOS ANGELES, Apri 8 (AP) Los Angeles County's Board of Supervisors named yesterday Robert Chass, a staff member of the Air Pollution Control District since it was estab lished in 1947, to head the dis trict. Mr. Chass placed first in a competitive civil service ex amination.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: CONCORD, N. H.In a few years, if all goes well, New Hampshire fishermen will be catching an unusual Canadian brook trout, the Assinica, that often weighs 611 pounds.

title: Satellites for Nuclear Detection And Mapping Launched by U.S.
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., April 8The United States launched a pair of nucleardetection sat ellites early this morning from its East and West Coast launch ing centers.

title: Abortion Bill Advocate
description: ALBANY, April 8  Con stance E. Cook has led the fight for abortion reform in the State Assembly this year in a tailored, matronly manner, rarely raising her voice and never doubting ul timate success.

title: 6 Sherpas Die on Everest
description: KATMANDU, Napal, April 8 (AP)  Six Nepalese Sherpas have been killed by a huge block of is that fell while guid ing a Japanse expedition up Mount Everest, according to a message reaching here today. It was the worst disaster ever r portd on the world's highest mountain.

title: MAGIC: It's Madison Ave.'s Answer to Crime, Competition and Third Ave.
description: THE elegant stretch of Madison Avenue between 59th and 74th Streets has decided to fight back  against the fading of Its image, against competition from boutiques and depart ment stores in other sections of the city, and against hold ups and vandalism.

title: MORE TOP U.N. JOBS FOR WOMEN SOUGHT
description: GENEVA, April 8The United, Nations Commission on the Status of Women adopted a, strong resolution tonight urging Secretary General Thant to give women more highlevel jobs on the United Nations staff.

title: Public TV's Convention Happy To Be Told Someone's Listening
description: Fiftyfive per cent of all television viewers in an eight city survey watch public televi vision, the 1970 Public Televi sion Conference was told yes terday. What is more, 65 per cent of the 8.5 million house holds covered by the survey reported that they watched public TV during the week of the survey.

title: Article 1  No Title
Defendant Gagged Again
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 8 (AP) A defendant in a murder trial was gagged and shacked in court today for the second time since his trial began fast week. Judge Leo Weinrott or dered George Kenney, 21 years old, of Philadelphia, gagged again after the defendant re peatedly tried to address the jry. Judge Weinrott warned him four times that he would be gagged again.

title: DR. ROBERT SCOON OF PRINCETON DEAD,
description: PRINCETON, N.J., April 8  Dr. Robert IVI. Scoon, chairman of Princeton University's phi losophy department from 1934 to 1952, died today at his home here. He was 83 years old.

title: 1 in 5 Court Nominations Have Failed
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 President Nixon will not stand alone in history for having his Supreme Court nominations rejected.

title: MORE FLEXIBILITY EVIDENT IN METS
description: PITTSBURGH April 8To morrow night the New York Mets will play at Forbes Field for the last time. Even if Three River Stadium, the new home of the Pittsburgh Pirate, is not ready on May 29, the schedulea moving day, it will he be fore the Mets return here on Aug. 7.

title: ALLIED DEATH TOLL AT 11MONTH HIGH
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 9Allied forces in South Vietnam suffered their highest number of combat deaths last week in nearly a year, accord ing to official reports today.

title: Discordant Zionist
description: JERUSALEM, April 9  There are certain people in this country who don't like me, no matter what I do, Dr. Nahum Goldmann said  nearly a dedade ago.

title: LOUIS G. DE REYNOLD
description: GENEVA, April 9Louis Gon zague de Reynold, Swiss writer and historian, died today in the hospital at Fribourg, Switzer land, his native city. He was 89 years old.

title: BOSTON RALLIES FROM 21 DEFICIT
description: BOSTON, April 9The inabil ity to perform the act known as scoring that affects the Rangers in the Stanley Cup Playoffs helped bury them again tonight against the suddenly tame Bruins.

title: LAKERS TRIUMPH OVER SUNS, 12994
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., April 9 (UPI)The Los Angeles Lakers, paced by Elgin Baylor and Wilt Chamberlain bounced back from a 31 playoff deficit to night as they wrapped up the Western Division semifinals with a 12994 rout of the Phoenix Suns.

title: Eddie Bracken Ventures Acids Miami Beach Theater
description: Eddie Bracken Ventures, Inc., the recently formed theatrical leasing and producing corpora tion, has taken over the Ele theater will he used to comple ment the summer activities of several summer theaters the company acquired early this year.

title: MARSHALS FACING THREAT IN FLORIDA
description: BRADENTON, Fla., April 9 United States Attorney John Briggs said tonight that the Federal Government would take control of the Manatee County schools despite a barricade of armed state troopers and threat from the office of Gov. Claude R. Kirk Jr. that Federal marshals would be fired upon.

title: Mr. Finch's Dilemma
description: Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare Robert H. Finch played a familiar role this week in upholding the views of a small and despondent liberal cell within the Administration when he pledged redoubled efforts to promote desegregation within the nation's schools.

title: WAYNE M. HART
description: CHATHAM, N. J., April 9 Wayne M. Hart, formerly al patent lawyer with the Ameri can Car and Foundry Company in New York, died yesterday at a nursing home in Florham Park. He was 80 years old and, lived here at 371 Fairmount Avenue.

title: WARREN APPEALS TO BAR OF NATION
description: Former Chief Justice Earle Warren chastised the bar of the nation yesterday as he appealed to the legal profession to awake to its responsibility to help end the divisiveness which is plaguing us and bring the spirit of justice into every courtroom in our land.

title: MURCER'S HOMER IN SIXTH DECIDES
description: Bobby Murcer wants an eye examination but Ray Culp would insist that his eyesight is 2020, at worst.

title: Penguins Top Seals Again
description: PITTSBURGH, April 9 (AP) Two secondperiod goals within 34 seconds by Nick Harbaruk and Wally Boyer paced the Pittsburgh Penguins to a 31 victory over the Oakland Seals tonight in the second game of the Stanley Cup playoffs.

title: N.B.A. Playoffs
description: WESTERN DIVISION Los Angeles vs. Phoenix

title: DONALDSON SELLS SHARES TO PUBLIC
description: Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette, Inc., became the first publicly owned member of the New York Stock Exchange yester day with the sale of 800,000 of its common shares through an underwriting group headed by the First Boston Corporation.

title: Church Council Aids Vietcong Medical Fund
description: GENEVA, April 9  The World Council of Churches said today that it had con tributed $25,000 toward a recent shipment of 16 tons of medical supplies and equipment to the provisional revolutionary government of the vietcong in South Vi etnam.

title: Carmichael, in Washington. Terms Arab Struggle Just
description: WASHINGTON, April 9  In a speech at George Wash ington University, Stokely Car michael, a blackmilitant spokesman today denounced Israel as a colony of European Jews illegally settled on Arab land.

title: PRICES ON AMEX CONTINUE TO SHIP
description: The American Stock Ex change's pricechange index dropped to its lowest level in almost two years yesterday as the list continued to decline in slightly steppedup trading.

title: Israel's Role Questioned by Goldmann
description: WASHINGTON, April 9Dr. Nahum Goldmann, a leading figure among an older genera tion of Zionists, is openly ques tioning whether the present day state of Israel is truly the realization of the Zionist dream.

title: Sorry, Wrong Number
description: Premier Golda Meir acted rashly and, in our view, most unwisely in torpedoingby making public a private invitation to a distinguished Israeli citizen to meet with President Nasser in Cairo. Her move, together with the Israeli Cabinet's flat rejection of the proposal, makes more difficult than ever any behind thescenes maneuvers that could lead toward Arab Israeli peace.

title: TEACHING AIDES END STRIKE AT WISCONSIN
description: MADISON, Wis., April 9The University of Wisconsin teach ing assistants voted 534 to 348 today to end a 25day strike against the University of Wis consin.

title: MINNEAPOLIS STRIKE STAGED BY TEACHERS
description: MINNEAPOLIS, April 9 (AP) Defying a state nostrike law and a court restraining order, more than half of the Minne apolis public school teachers abandoned classrooms today to enforce demands in next year's work contract.

title: ABORTION REFORM IS VOTED BY THE ASSEMBLY, 76 TO 73; FINAL APPROVAL EXPECTED
description: ALBANY, April 9The dra matic lastminute switching of a single vote in the Assembly today moved New York State a step closer to the reform of its abortion law.

title: Radillo Announces He Is In Primary For Representative
description: Herman Badillo, the former Bronx Borough President, an nounced his candidacy for the House of Representatives yes terday in the new 21st Con gressional District, which in cludes parts of the Bronx, Manhattan and Queens.

title: Mainlining Amphetamines Rising Problem in Sweden
description: STOCKHOLM  There is something decidedly Amer ican about the developing drugabuse problem in Swe den.

title: Cards Crush Expos, 713
description: MONTREAL, April 9 (UPI)  Joe Torre drove in three runs with a homer and two singles and Jos Cardenal stole home for the St. Louis Cardinals today as they beat the Montreal Expos, 73.

title: Exact Bus Fare Guards Drivers and Eases Their Job
description: It' easier now is the unani mous comment of a group of New Yorkers who carry on one of the more nervewracking oc cupations heredriving the mu nicipal buses.

title: Nixon Talks on War Thursday; May Announce New Troop Cuts
description: WASHINGTON, April 9The White House announced today that President Nixon would re port to the nation on Vietnam in a nationally televised ad dress next Thursday.

title: Court Enjoins Violence at Cornell
description: ITHACA, N. Y., April 9 After a night in which some 150 black students tore through the Cornell University campus, breaking windows and over turning two cars, the univer sity today obtained an injunc tion against further acts of force, violence, damage or dis ruption.

title: UNIVERSITY CHORALE SINGS AT TULLY HALL
description: If all there is to choral sing ing is limpid tone, transparent sonority, graceful nuance and accurate rhythm, the Madrigal Singers of Wahington Univer sity are a paragon of their kind.

title: Officials at Paris Talks Get Plea on Missing Newsmen
description: PARIS, April 9  Twenty five newsmen covering the Vietnam peace talks here ap pealed to the four delegations today to do what they could to establish the whereabouts and to obtain the release of 10 journalists missing in Laos and Cambodia while on assignment.

title: Cahill Seeks Legislators' Aid For $47Million Education Plan
description: TRENTON, April 9  Gov. William T. Cahill urged a joint session of the Legislature to day to approve a $47million education program for New Jer sey that would embody two sharply controversial measures  nearly $10million in state aid to private and parochial schools and a teacher incentive system based on merit pay increases.

title: CITY SWEARS IN TWO TO ACT ON ASBESTOS
description: Two new officials of the En vironmental Protection Admin istration were sworn in at City Hall yesterday to enable the city to take swift action against a growing pollution danger insulating asbestos that is sprayed in the construction of new buildings.

title: First Plane Designed and Built in Israel Makes Inaugural Flight
description: LYDDA, Israel, April 9The first plane designed and pro duced in Israel, the Arava, made its inaugural flight here today in a ceremony heavy with mili tary overtones.

title: That Flag or Sun Hanging on the Wall May Be a Carpet
description: TIME was when rugs were hung on walls to ward off drafts. But the current interest in hanging woven or tufted carpeting on walls is inspired more by fashion, the art and poster boom and the appeal of supergraphics. Regal Rugs was well aware of the popularity of boldly patterned wall hangings when it commissioned six designers to create several new approaches. The recently introduced col lection of 35 designs called Tufted Wallcraft includes many naturalistic and several abstract or geometric pat terned rugs, ranging in size from 15inch squares to 4by 6foot rectangles, and in price from about $40 to about $300.

title: Canadian Movement Seeking Home Rule for West
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia, April 5An Edmonton, Alberta, man: It's time that the western Canadians should have full control of our re sources and capital and the responsibility of building our own future.

title: HOUSE UNIT VOTES BUSING CURB ANEW
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (UPI)  The House Appropria tions Committee approved a $4.1billion school money bill today, adding freedomofchoice and antibusing amendments aimed at blunting the drive for desegregation.

title: Giants' Rally Downs Astros
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 9 (AP)  Steve Whitaker's two run single highlighted a five run eighth inning for San Fran cisco today as the Giants beat the Houston Astros, 74.

title: An AntiLiberal Novel in Soviet Attacked by Youth Newspaper
description: MOSCOW, April 9  An in fluential Soviet newspaper to day sharply attacked a recent ly published novel that has drawn the ire of liberal intel lectuals here.

title: Students Benefit in RushTicket Plan
description: At Lincoln Center's Vivian Beaumont Theater, a City College philosophy major with an armful of books re cently paid $2 and sat in a $9 seat for Camino Real. That same week, a Pratt Institute student sporting an Indian headband watched the Merce Cunningham Dance Company at the Brooklyn Academy of Music from a $5.95 orchestra seat. He had paid $1 admis sion.

title: Hospitals Called Unprepared For Wave of Abortion Requests
description: Hospitals across the state both public and privatehave done virtually nothing to pre pare for the demand that is expected when and if the liber alized legislation on abortion goes into effect.

title: Guards Travel 18 Holes With Gary Player
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., April 9 Nine security officers accom panied Gary Player through out the South African golfer's opening round today in the Masters tournament.

title: 2 Officials Quit Anticrime Unit In a Blow to Nixon's Program
description: WASHINGTON, April 9The Nixon Administration's prin cipal program for attacking crime in the streets, already under fire from Congress and urban groups, suffered another blow today with the resigna tion of its administrator and another high official.

title: Drugs Are a Bad Scene, ExAddicts Tell Students
description: A high school junior in mod clothes, wearing his long black hair in a Custer cut, shouted into the micro phone on the assembly floor at Martin Van Buren High School yesterday morning.

title: ... and Protective Reaction
description: While South Vietnamese troops have been extending their operations into Cambodia in contravention of declared American policy, a new incident has raised similar questions about Washington's control over allied military activities elsewhere in Southeast Asia. That incident was a recent air action over North Viet nam in which an American fighterinterceptor, escort ing an unarmed reconnaissance plane, shot down a North Vietnamese MIG21.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES HAVE STRONG DAY
description: Cash prices of soybean oil and meal were strong yester day and this led to a demand for all soybean futures on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Policy on Marriage Changed
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, April 9 (UPI)For the first time in the 17year history of the Toledo Hospital School of Nursing, student nurses will be permit ted to be married. The school's board of trustees said yester day that it voted to change the rules because there no longer remains any reason why our students should not marry.

title: Dr. Mead Calls Alarmism A Threat to Pollution Fight
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (AP) Dr. Margaret Mead warned antipollution crusaders yester day to avoid the doomsday ap proach for fear of straining credulityt or inducing a fatal istic belief the situation is be yond hope.

title: LAKERS TRIUMPH OVER SUNS, 12994
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., April 9 (UPI)The Los Angeles Lakers, paced by Elgin Baylor and Wilt Chamberlain bounced back from a 31 playoff deficit to night as they wrapped up the Western Division semifinals with a 12994 rout of the Phoenix Suns.

title: DAMAGE SUIT FILED ON PARVIN'S VALUE
description: CHICAGO, April 9 (AP)A $2.5million damage suit was filed yesterday on b??alf of Charles O. Finley, an insurance man, charging that the Parvin Dohrmann Company, Inc., and some of its directors had con spired to make stock in the company appear more valuable than it was.

title: LEE D. SHERMAN, 69, A SECURITIES DEALER
description: Lee D. Sherman, president since 1939 of L. D. Sherman & Co., Inc., 52 Broadway, deal er in overthecounter securi ties, died yesterday in Memo rial Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived at 120 East 90th Street.

title: Atlas Heads Parking Unity
description: Anthony H. Atlas, a lawyer, was named yesterday as di rector of the new Parking Vio lations Bureau. The agency, a unit of the Transportation Ad ministration, is expected to be in operation by July 1. It will enforce and adjudicate non moving traffic offenses in the five boroughs.

title: NEWSPAPER TALKS BOG DOWN ON PAY
description: The leaders of some news paper unions showed impa tience yesterday with the lack of progress on economic issues in their negotiations with the city's four major papers.

title: ALFRED A. ROETKEN
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., April 9 Alfred A. Roetken, a former radio consultant at Bell Labora tories, Murray Hill, N. J., died Tuesday at his home here. He was 67 years old.

title: Difficulties Beset Australia's America's Cup Yacht
description: SYDNEY, Australia, April 9 The skipper and some of the crew of Gretel II, the potential Australian challenger for the America's Cup, were announced tonight. It was reported that the yacht was running into dif ficulties in its preparation for a sailoff against France later this year.

title: State Racing Group Approves Exacta Betting for Flat Tracks
description: The State Racing Commis sion approved yesterday the re quest of the New York Racing Association to institute exacta betting at Aqueduct, Belmont Park and Saratoga, the three tracks under direction of the N.Y.R.A.

title: Annual Session Plan Voted By New Hampshire House
description: CONCORD, N. H., April 9 (AP)The New Hampshire House has passed, 337 to 5, a measure designed to lead to ward annual sessions of the legislature.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: April 9, 1970

title: Mrs. Myrdal, at Geneva, Asks Curbs on GermWar Studies
description: GENEVA, April 9  Mrs. Alva Myrdal of Sweden sug gested today that the disarma ment conference meeting has conclude a separate interna tional agreement that would require the signers to report whether they were developing substances that could be used in chemical or bacteriological warfare.

title: Arab Buildup Reported
description: AMMAN, Jordan, (Reuters) April 9The commander of the Saudi Arabian forces in Jordan said today that Arab armies along the eastern front with Israel were being built up and that the buildup would con tinue until the occupied Golan heights and westbank area were liberated.

title: ORIOLES TRIUMPH OVER INDIANS 131
description: CLEVELAND, April 9 (AP)  Tom Phoebus stopped Cleveland on two hits and Don Buford drove in five runs with two homers and a sacrifice fly to day as the Baltimore Orioles crushed the Indians, 131, for a sweep of their seasonopening threegame series.

title: Vietnamizing in Cambodia...
description: Reports from Saigon indicate that substantial num bers of South Vietnamese troops have been fighting alongside Cambodian forces against North Vietnamese and Vietcong units in Cambodia.

title: Minister Shoots 2 Youths
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (UPI) The Rev. Roy Settles shot to day two teenagers who had broken into his church, the po lice said. The Baptist minister said he was in his study when he heard noises at the rear Of the building. He called the po lice, went to investigate and fired five shots at youths who fled when he saw them. A 17 ??

title: Pakstani Capital: Madness to Some, It Is a Lovely Garden City to Others
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, April 1This is quite a thing for us, said a government of ficial. Ten years ago it was all barren. Now it's going to be a lovely garden city.

title: Amer. Basketball Ass'n
description: STANDING OF THE CLUBS

title: Italian Quintet Wins Title
description: SARAJEVO, Yugoslavia, April 9 (UPI)Ignis of Italy won the European basketball champions cup today by downing Sska of the Soviet Union, 7974, in the final.

title: U.S. Rejects Canadians' Claim To Wide Rights in Arctic Seas
description: WASHINGTON, April 9The United States today rejected Canadian claims to jurisdiction over extensive areas of arctic waters and said that it would not recognize Canada's right to control American vessels on the high seas in the far north.

title: On Weekend Menus: Stuffed Flank Steak and Peach Cake
description: IN the menus below, dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: Music: Szell's Beethoven Enchants Packed Philharmonic
description: GEORGE SZELL rounded out his New York Phil harmonic season last night with a program by that per ennial bestseller, Beethoven. There was not a vacant seat in the house, and outside Phil harmonic Hall people were pleading for tickets. Part of the frenzy, of course, could be attributed to the conduc tor. Mr. Szell is believed by many to be the greatest liv ing Beethoven specialist.

title: Theater
description: IT is always rash to use superlatives, but it does most forcibly occur to me that The Nest, which bold ly calls itself a play and even more boldly opened last night at the Mercury Theater, must be on any reasonable short list of the worst plays I have ever seen. I feel there is very little to add.

title: RAIL TONMILEAGE SHOWS A 1.9% DROP
description: WASHINGTON, April 9  Freight traffic on United States railroads and intercity truck tonnage in the latest week ended April 4 were both below the volume in the correspond ing week of last year.

title: Lieut. John B. Adams Jr. Weds Miss Nena Powell Bowman
description: THE PLAINS, Va., April 9 Miss Nena Powell Bowman was married here this after noon to First Lieut. John Buchanan Adams Jr., U.S.A., son of Mr. and Mrs. Adams of Fairfield. The Rev. Robert Pierce performed the cere mony in Grace Episcopal Church.

title: Henry Moore Gives Views on Sculptures
description: We'll have to give them a real good rubup, said Henry Moore briskly, gazing at his marbles in the velvet draped back room of Knoed ler's, 14 East 57th Street. Suiting action to words, he borrowed a bystander's hand kerchief and began industri ously to dust Square Form With Cut, a curved form of black serpentine that sat on a kneehigh base.

title: British ExConvict Gives 5Star Guide to Prisons
description: LONDON, April 9 (UPI) A former convict has pub lished a fivestar guide to ma jor prisons in Britain, recom mending them on the basis of food, atmosphere and sur roundings.

title: CHICAGO TRUCKERS SIGN 3YEAR PACT
description: WASHINGTON, April 9Chi cago's independent truck driver unions signed a new contract today with local carriers, near ly doubling the wage and fringe benefits that were included in the tentative agreement last week between the national trucking industry and the Inter national Brotherhood of Team sters.

title: COLUMBIA VISITED BY FUTURE CHIEF
description: Dr. William J. McGill, who will take office as president of Columbia University in the fall, was heckled yesterday as he met a large group of Columbia students for the first time.

title: NEGOTIATIONS END FOR SALE OF JETS
description: Negotiations for the sale of the New York Jets to a group that included Allie Sherman, the former Giants coach, were terminated yesterday and ownership will be retained by the present group headed by Philip H. Iselin, with Weeb Ewbank as general manager and bead coach.

title: Martin, U.S.L.T.A. Head, Asks Changes in Player Categories
description: A sweeping policy state ment urging revisions in the Davis Cup, player categories, scoring system and adminis tration of the sport is being prepared by Alastair B. Martin, president of the United States Lawn Tennis Association.

title: Major League Baseball
description: American League

title: High Hanoi Official Leaves Paris Today; Saw No U.S. Aides
description: PARIS, April 9  Le Duc Tho, a member of the polit buro of North Vietnam's Work ers' (Communist) party and a key figure in the negotiations that led to the agreement to hold peace talks, will return to Hanoi tomorrow without hav ing made contact with the American delegation during his stay here of more than two months.

title: COOP STUDY FINDS NUMBER OF BIASES
description: The American Jewish Com mittee charged yesterday that Jews were apparently being excluded from 60 per cent of a sample of 139 cooperative apartment buildings the com mittee investigated on Manhat tan's East Side.

title: Hunter's Leader and Protesters Meet
description: A tense truce went into ef fect at Hunter College yester day following the suspension of classes at noon.

title: Miss Roberta Rosenstock a Bride
description: Miss Roberta Rosenstock, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Rosenstock of River dale, the Bronx, was married yesterday afternoon to Dr. Thomas PlattsMills, a phy sician. He is a son of John PlattsMills, a lawyer and former Labor member of Parliament, and Mrs. Platts Mills of London.

title: Store Sales Decline
description: WASHINGTON, April 9The Commerce Department today estimated last week's depart store sales at $598million, down 16 per cent from the year earlier. Total retail store sales last week were about $6,786. 000,000, down 3 per cent from $7,007,000,000.

title: Hirsch to Talk Here Tonight
description: Elroy (Crazy Legs) Hirsch, the athletic director at the University of Wisconsin, will speak at the Founders Day din ner of the Wisconsin Alumni Club of New York tonight at 7 at the Princeton Club, 15 West 43d Street.

title: Mrs. Mitchell Bids Newspaper Crucify Fulbright
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., April 9Mrs. John N. Mitchell, wife of the United States Attorney General, telephoned The Arkan sas Gazette at 1 A.M. (2 A.M. Washington time) today and urged the newspaper to cru cify Senator J. W. Fullbright for his vote against confir mation of Judge G. Harrold Carswell to the United States Supreme Court.

title: Cambodian Troops Leave Embattled Border Region
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, April 9  The Cambodian military authorities have withdrawn all troops from the tip of the sec tion of Svayrieng Province known as the Parrot's Beak, abandoning it for the time being to the Vietnamese Com munists, according to high mili tary sources.

title: PHILS DOWN CUBS ON RALLY IN 7TH
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 9 (UPI)  Deron Johnson's threerun homer marked a fourrun seventh inning today and gave the Philadelphia Phillies a 53 victory over the Chicago Cubs.

title: Church Honors Woman
description: LITTELFIELD, Tex. (AP)  Mrs. Ellen Massengill, a public school teacher, was presented school teacher, was, presented with a 32yearpin by the First Baptist Church here for never having missed Sunday School.

title: Business Warned on Credibility
description: An attentive group of con sumerminded, and possibly consumerwary, businessmen and women were given the following guidance yesterday by a vice president of a ma jor retailstore complex:

title: Bridge:
description: TEAMS headed by Jeff Ru bens and Murray Schnee, both of New York, will meet in one semifinal of the Great er New York Double Knock out Championship for the Von Zedtwitz Trophy, while groups headed by Peter Le ventritt and Harry Fishbein, also of New York, clash in the other.

title: CREDIT MARKETS QUIET AND STEADY
PhilcoFord Names a President, Fourth Since Ford Took Over
description: The PhilcoFord Corporation has a new presidentits fourth in the eight years since the Ford Motor Company took it over. Henry Ford 2d, chairman of the parent, Ford Motor, an nounced yesterday that Philip Caldwell, a vice president of Ford Motor, would be president of PhilcoFord with direct re sponsibility for consumer prod ucts and industrial electronics operations.

title: Israeli Planes Attack Near Area in Egypt Where 30 Pupils Were Killed
description: JERUSALEM, April 9Israeli bombers returned to the Suez Canal region tonight, a day after a raid there that the Egyp tians said had killed 30 school children.

title: Couple Sails the East Coast To Help Clean Up Waterways
description: WITH sailing places along the East Coast getting uglier and uglier, according to the American Littoral Society, boatyards and yacht clubs are now being shown what they can do about it. A southport, Conn., couple, not waiting for Earth Day (April 22), set sail last month to pass the word from Florida to Maine.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON RISE MODERATELY
description: The London stock market moved moderately higher yes terday as selective demand offset uncertainties over the new national budget.

title: SEASON'S PREVIEW OF N.E.T. IS A HIT
description: Public television's station managers and programers got a preview yesterday of what they can expect in national programing next season. They liked what they saw.

title: Vote in Assembly on Abortion Bill
description: ALBANY, April 9Following is the rollcall vote in which the Assembly today approved liberalization of the abortion law.

title: WILLIAM G. TOWNSEND
description: LINDEN, N. J., April 9Wil liam G. Townsend, an assistant treasurer of the First National City Bank of New York, died yesterday at Memorial General Hospital, Union, after a long illness. He was 55 years old and lived here at 66 Berlant Avenue.

title: MARKET HODING A STEADY COURSE
New Books
description: FICTION

title: Bache Announces Changes in Ranks Of Top Executives
description: Bache & Co., one of the na tion's largest brokerage houses, announced a number of high level management changes yes terday, including the formal appointment of John E. Leslie as chief executive officer.

title: BRIAN JOB BREAKS U.S. SWIM RECORD
description: CINCINNATI, April 9 (AP) Brian Job, Stanford University freshman, cracked the Ameri can 100yard breaststroke rec ord twice today in the Amateur Athletic Union national men's and women's swimming cham pionship.

title: ART PRIZE AWARDED TO KRAMER OF TIMES
description: Hilton Kramer, art news edi for of The New York Times, has been named winner of the third annual Elsie O. and Philip D. Sang prize for critics of the fine arts, it was annouced yes terday by Knox College, a pri vate, nondenominational, co educational liberal art college in Galesburg, Ill.

title: LEE HANDLEY
description: PITTSBURGH, April 9 (UPI) Lee Handley, who played eight seasons as an infielder for the Pittsburgh Pirates, died yesterday apparently of a heart attack. He was 56 years old.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: SPEEDIER DIVORCE GAINS IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, April 9Without debate, the Senate passed and sent to the Assembly today a bill cutting the waiting period for a divorce from two years to one.

title: Justice Agency Says High Court Must Rule on AllBlack Schools
description: RICHMOND, April 9The Department of Justice told a Federal court today that Nixon administration policy permitted the existence of predominantly Negro schools in urban areas and that it was time the Su preme Court decided whether judicial policy would do the same.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Theodore H. Thiesing, 79, Dies; Lawyer Held U.S. Posts in 20's
description: Theodore H. Thiesing, an in ternational lawyer and a leader in GermanAmerican organiza tions here, died Wednesday night in Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 79 years old and lived at 912 Fifth Avenue.

title: 2 Catalogue Chains Post Small Gains For Easter Sales
description: Two of the big three compa vies in the department store catalogue chain field reported yesterday minimal sales gains during the justended Easter season.

title: Guggenheim Reported Selling 51% of Newsday
description: The TimesMirror Company of Los Angeles was reported yesterday to have decided to acquire controlling interest in Newsday, Inc., of Garden City, L. I., the nation's biggest sub urban newspaper, despite op position from Newsday's mi nority stockholders.

title: DR. ARTHUR E. DOME, Y.M.C.A. AIDE, DIES
description: MYRTLE BEACH, S. C., April 9Dr. Arthur E. Dome, former controller of the Young Men's Christian Association of Greater New York, died Monday at Ocean View Memorial Hospital after a long illness. He was 72 years old and had recently moved here.

title: K. C. Norris 2d Becomes Fiance Of Miss Lobdell
description: RED BANK, N. J., April 9 Mr. and Mrs. Francis Lob dell have made known the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Katherine Adams Lobdell, to Kingsley Cham berlain Norris 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Kingsley F. Norris of Locust.

title: Moscow Drops Criticism Drive; Key Officials Reported Ousted
description: MOSCOW, April 9The So viet Union is nearing Lenin's centenary with a sudden shift in the political atmosphere that has stirred an unusual amount of speculation in the Western diplomatic community.

title: President Nixon's Opportunity
description: The central facts about the Supreme Court, despite all the turmoil, are the same today as they were before the Senate vote on Judge Carswell. All the Senate has said is that the highest court in the land de serves an outstanding man. Within this single reasonable principle, President Nixon is free to choose from a very large company of distinguished conservatives and is clearly in command of the situation.

title: Italy Hit by New Strikes
description: ROME, April 9 (UPI)Gar bage littered the streets of Rom page littered the streets of Rome, hotel service was cur tailed and striking textile workers marched through Milan today in new labor unrest. Cleaners and garbage collectors were in the second day of a strike, and hotel bellboys, clerks and waiters began a 72 hour walkout.

title: The Structure of Inflation
description: In one of his Proverbs of Hell, the poet William Blake said, He who desires but acts not, breeds pesti lence. There can be no doubt that President Nixon desires an end to the plague of inflation. But he acts notnot even on the findings of his own study groups.

title: SIMPSON OF REDS TOPS DODGERS, 30
description: LOS ANGELES, April 9 (UPI) Johnny Bench broke up scoreless game with a leadoff home run in the seventh and Wayne Simpson hurled a two hitter after retiring the first 16 men he faced in his first major league appearance tonight as the Cincinnati Reds scored 30 victory over the Los Angeles Dodgers.

title: Conscience Money Order
description: DODGE CITY, Kan. (AP) Ben Lincecum, manager of the Montgomery Ward store here, received a money order for $10.50 and a note that read: I am a teenager and I took six pairs of hose from your store. I am sorry.

title: Britain Deplores Deaths
description: LONDON, April 9 (Reuters) Britain today deplored the loss of civilian lives in yester day's Israeli air attack, which Egypt said had killed 30 chil dren.

title: Prison Pooling Plan Urged
description: LEWISTON, Mont., April 9 (UPI)Legislators from Mon tana, Wyoming, North Dakota and South Dakota have adopted a resolution calling for a study of the possibility of sharing prison facilities for women in mates. Delegates to a three day meeting here also want to pool their facilities for treat ment of mentally disturbed children and disturbed felons.

title: Royals Top Athletics, 31
description: KANSAS CITY, April 9 (UPI) Ed Kirkpatrick doubled home, a firstinning run and scored on a wild pitch tonight to give. the Kansas City Royals a 31 victory over the Oakland Ath letics behind the fivehit pitch ing of Bill Butler and Dave, Morehead.

title: Iraq Oil Output Slips
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, April 9 (Reu ters)The Iraq Petroleum Com pany and associated companies announced today that their oil production in March, 1970, was 5,972,486 tons, a drop of more than 400,000 tons from the yearearlier period.

title: Screen: The Extortion Career of Oshima's Boy
description: The following review orig inally appeared on Sept. 20, 1969, when the film was shown at the New York Film Festival. The movie is being exhibited here commercially.

title: Aaron Belts No. 555
description: SAN DIEGO. April 9 (AP) Hank Aaron clouted his 555th career home Tun and gathered his 2,961st hit tonight to help the Atlanta Braves and Jim Nash beat the San Diego Padres, 61.

title: U.S. Diplomat in Yemen First Time in Two Years
description: SANA, Yemen, April 9 (AP) An Amercan diplomat has ar rived in Yemen to handle United States interests for the first time in more than two years.

title: Alcoa and Reynolds to Increase Prices
description: Increases in basic aluminum prices swept rapidly through the industry yesterday as ma jor producers followed the lead given late Wednesday by the Kaiser. Aluminum and Chemi cal Corporation.

title: Sisco Meets Schumann
description: PARIS, April 9 (Reuters)  Mr. Sisco today discussed the Middle East situation with For eign Minister Maurice Schu mann in a meeting here.

title: A.B.A. to Revise System Of Rating Court Nominees
description: WASHINGTON, April 9The American Bar Association's system of passing on the qualifications of Supreme Court nominees may be changed significantly by the time Presi dent Nixon's new nominee is named.

title: Hearing Set on Expanding City Council
description: The firk step toward a pos sible expansion of the City Council to increase its Negro and Puerto Rican membership was scheduled this week.

title: Satisfied Golfers at Augusta Signal Their Pleasure in Their Own Way
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., April 9 When the starter on the first tee announced, Juan Rodri guez, the skinny little golf er in the white straw hat commented, Better known as Chi Chi. The nearby spec tators laughed, and he kept them laughing throughout his twounderpar 70 in today's opening round of the Masters tournament.

title: F.T.C. Acts to Curb Unwanted Mail Ads; Metromedia Named
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (AP) The Federal Trade Commis sion began a crackdown on un wanted mail advertising today by charging a major seller of mailing lists with duping con sumers through misleading Questionnaires.

title: Apollo 13 Decision Due Today; Preparations for Shot Pressed
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., April 9Apollo 13 countdown prep arations continued tonight, but mission officials were still not sure whether to attempt the launching on Saturday with a substitute astronaut or to post pone the moonlanding flight for a month.

title: Sports of The Times
description: LEW ALCINDOR is not the first of the magnificent giants to assume a domi nating role in professional basketball. Wilt Chamberlain and Bill Russell already have preceded him. But the time is not too distant when the oversized rookie of the Milwaukee Bucks will be greater than either. Fortunately for the New York Knick erbockers, that day has not yet arrived.

title: Rent Stabilization Law is Ruled Unconstitutional
description: The city's 1969 Rent Stabilization Law, which regulates rents and evictions in 375,000 relatively new apartments here, was declared unconstitutional yesterday by the Appellate Division of the State Supreme Court.

title: TODAY'S PROBABLE PITCHERS
description: Boston at Washington (n)Lon borg (711) vs. Coleman (1213).

title: 11 Pounds of Cocaine Taken in Midtown Raid
description: Eleven pounds of pure co caine, with a street value of more than $2.5million, was seized yesterday afternoon in a raid at a midtown apart ment house.

title: U.S. Seeks to Have Controllers Prove Their Illness to Doctors
description: In a new strategy aimed at ending the 16day walkout of Federal air traffic controllers, the Government announced yesterday that it would ask 16 courts around the country to make sick controllers prove they are ill to doctors.

title: PRESIDENT ANGERS FOES OF CARSWELL
description: WASHINGTON, April 9Sen ators who voted yesterday to reject the nomination of Judge G. Harrold Carswell to the Su preme Court reacted angrily to President Nixon's statement to day that the judge had been rejected solely because he was a Southerner and interpreted the Constitution cautiously.

title: Blues Sink Stars by 21
description: ST. LOUIS, April 9 (UPI) Gary Sabourin and Phil Goyette scored St. Louis goals tonight to give the Blues a 21 triumph over the Minnesota North Stars in the Stanley Cup quarter finals. The Blues, West Division champions, lead their series, 2 to 0.

title: Osaka Gas Leak Detected Sunday
description: OSAKA, Japan, April 9 (UPI)The police said today that a gas leak was reported four days ago in a subway construction site where gas main explosions yesterday killed 73 persons and injured 282 others.

title: Laotian Outpost Shelled
description: VIENTIANE, April 9 (UPI)  Hundreds of North Viet namese troops encircled a Gov ernment outpost northeast of the Plaine des Jarres today and brought it under artillery fire, highranking Laotian military sources said. It was the first confirmed use of artillery by the North Vietnamese in Laos.

title: Interior Aide Sworn
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (AP) Fred J. Russell, 53 years old was sworn in today as Under Secretary of the Interior. He succeeds Russell E. Train, who was appointed chairman of the new President's Council on En vironmental Quality last Jan uary. Mr. Russell, a former in dustrialist and real estate de veloper, has been deputy direc tor of the Office of Emergency Preparedness since February, 1969.

title: School Aide Says State Orders Halt In Sickle Cell Tests
description: An East Harlem school dis trict that had been testing school children for sickle cell anemia said it was told to stop by the state Department of Edu cation, the program's sponsor.

title: G.M. Asks Defeat of Critics' Proposals
description: DETROIT, April 9The Gen eral Motors Corporation asked its stockholders today to vote against two proposals from The Project on Corporate Responsi bility, a committee interested in consumer affairs and the environment.

title: Utah Development Sets a Stock Sale
description: The Utah Development Com pany, a subsidiary of the Utah Construction and Mining Com pany, will receive $19,950,000 for the sale of 10 per cent of its stock to Utah Mining Australia, Ltd., an Australian concern, it was announced yes terday.

title: U.S. SET TO FREE 2 IN '68 DRAFT CASE
description: WASHINGTON, April 9The Justice Department will move to drop the criminal conspiracy case against the Rev. William Sloan Coffin Jr. and Mitchell Goodman, who were convicted in 1968 with Dr. Benjamin Spock of conspiring to counsel evasion of the draft.

title: Wajima Outpoints Carter
description: TOKYO, April 9 (AP)Koichi Wajima of Japan regained his Japanese junior middleweight boxing crown tonight by gain ing it 10round split decision over George Carter, United States Air Force sergeant. Car ter, Insed in Tokyo, was mak ing his first defense of the title he won from Wajima in Feb ruary.

title: Hair Producer Wins Stomp Rights
description: The world rights to Stomp, the multimedia protest musical environment entertainment, have been ac quired by Michael Butler, pro ducer of Hair.

title: Text of Nixon Statement on High Court
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 Following is the text of a formal statement issued by President Nixon late this afternoon:

title: GOULD TO LEAVE POST AT STATE U.
description: Dr. Samuel B. Gould re signed yesterday as chancellor of the State University of New York, effective Oct. 1.

title: Executive Changes
description: John E. Kunz has been elected vice president of the A. O. Smith Corporation. He formerly was gen eral manager of the company's tubular products division.

title: TESTS SCHEDULED FOR JOBS IN CENSUS
description: Tests for jobs in connection with the current census will be given tomorrow, from 9 A.M. to 2 P.M. at schools in Man hattan, the Bronx, Brooklyn and Queens, the regional direc tor of the Bureau of Census an nounced yesterday.

title: CREDIT RESTRAINT EASES MARKEDLY
F.T.C. CHIEF URGES NEW COURT TACTIC
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 Caspar W. Weinberger, the chairman of the Federal Trade Commission, suggested today that the commission might, in the future, use consent settle ments more sparingly in its cases against business for ille gal restraint of trade.

title: DR. HAROLD FULL, AN EDUCATOR, 50
description: Dr. Harold Full, associate professor of education at Queens College of the City University of New York, died of a cerebral hemorrhage yes terday. He was 50 years old.

title: ISRAELIS ARE INVITED BY EUROPEAN GROUP
description: GEEVA, April 9An inter governmental European organi zation for the promotion of re search into molecular biology has announced that Israel is being accepted as a member state.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: WHEN a fight to save a stream, a marsh or a pond from pollution or de velopment is carried on by a local organization, this is often the only approach pos sible in the limited time avail able. Whether that approach will result in the desired re sult is sometimes question able. Obviously, sheer num bers and the prestige of the organization involved have a bearing on the outcome.

title: Foreign Affairs: Put Out More Flags
description: THE HAGUEWilly Brandt is an imposing, eminent and popular statesman and there fore as he arrives in Washing ton for the official part of his state visit he may properly look forward to an enthusiastic re ception.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: April 10, 1970

title: Chef Goes Out to Eat
description: TOKYO (UPI)Pierre Cas sier, head chief of Maxim's de Paris in Tokyo, says one of has favorite foods is Jauanese sushi (raw fish). But he has to go ?? to eath ?? Maxim's a ?? of the Paris original, ?? only French food.

title: Doris Hart Is Named U.S. Wightman Captain
description: Doris Hart, the topranking women's tennis player in the United States in 1954 and 1955, was named captain of the United States Wightman Cup team yesterday.

title: Court Order Halts a Strike Against Louisville Railroad
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., April 9 (UPI)A temporary restraining order issued today by a Federal judge ended a wildcat strike by shoperaft employes against the Louisville & Nashville Rail road.

title: Demonstrators Greet U.S. Envoy in Sweden
description: STOCKHOLM, April 9 (Reu ters)Dr. Jerome H. Holland, the new United States Ambas sador to Sweden, arrived here today and was met by scores of policemen and about 100 demonstrators at the airport.

title: Loeb Backs Limiting Big Board Members
description: Loeb, Rhoades & Co., one of Wall Street's largest and best known investment bank ing and brokerage bonuses, took a vigorous stand yester day against institutional mem bership on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Widow and ExWife Attend Sheppard's Burial in Ohio
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, April 9 (AP)Dr. Samuel H. Sheppard was buried here today follow ing a private funeral service.

title: House Unit Would Ban Laundry Agent
description: WASHINGTON, April 9  The House Government Opera tions Committee approved unanimously today an unpub lished report by one of its sub committees that urges the Gov ernment to force the detergent industry to remove phosphates from its products by 1972.

title: DANCE THEATER UNIT OFFERS 4 PREMIERES
description: Dance Theater Workshop has a chameleonlike knock for interestingly diverse program ming and last night at the Man hattan School of Music present ed five works, four of which were premieres. They ranged in style from the casual Non Structured Improvisation of Art Bauman's to the precisely athletic Poison Variations of Elizabeth Keen's.

title: L. I. Soldier Killed in War
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (UPI) The Defense Department en nounced today that Specialist 4 Lawrence C. Bigelow of the Army, who IS from Lake View, L. I., had been killed in action in Vietnam.

title: Advertising: Seeking Secret of Schhh...
description: The morning started rou tinely enough with oatmeal and a newspaper full of de pressing news in a crowded subway. And the meeting scheduled for 9:30 in Room 1247 at Ogilvy & Mather seemed to promise nothing out of the ordinary.

title: TYDINGS URGES U.S. CUT FORCES IN KOREA
description: WASHINGTON, April 9  Senator Joseph D. Tydings urged President Nixon today to withdraw one of the two Amer ican infantry divisions in South Korea as evidence of his inten tion to implement the Nixon Doctrine of reducing the Ameri can military presence in Asia.

title: Drama Academy To Honor Burton At April 26 Fete
description: About 600 persons are ex pected at the Plaza on April 26 when the American Musi cal and Dramatic Academy holds a benefit dinner dance to cushion the expense of moving to new quarters, es tablish a scholarship fund and honor its former director, Philip Burton.

title: U.S. LETS OFFICERS ENTER CAMBODIA
description: WASHINGTON, April 9A spokesman for the Defense De partment, in response to in quiries about an American of ficer seen in Cambodia, said today that military advisers in South Vietnam have been au thorized to cross the border into Cambodia for protocol meetings.

title: MUSEUM TO SHOW JAPANESE MOVIES
description: A retrospective series of 90 Japanese feature films produced over the last 50 years, making it the most comprehensive showing in the history of the Museum of Modern Art, will be shown starting Sunday and con tinuing through July Sunday Few of the films have ever been seen in this country. They represent the work of 32 directors.

title: SENATE, 726, BIDS PRESIDENT SEEK HALT ON MISSILES
description: WASHINGTON, April 9The Senate called upon President Nixon today to propose to the Soviet Union an immediate sus pension in further deployment of offensive and defensive stra tegic weapons.

title: Twins Beat White Sox
description: CHICAGO, April 9 (AP) Harmon Killebrew, the 1969 American League home run champion, belted his first of the season for two runs in the first inning today to help the Minnesota Twins post a 64 victory over the Chicago White Sox.

title: CITY WOULD RAISE RESIDENT TAX 75%, COMMUTERS' 400%
description: Mayor Lindsay proposed a 75 per cent increase yesterday in taxes on resident job holders and an average 400 per cent rise in commuter levies. It ap peared unlikely, however, that the plan would be approved by the State Legislature.

title: Chemical New York Lists a 21.3% Drop In Quarterly Profit
description: The Chemical New York Corporation, the holding company parent of the Chemical Bank, reported yes terday a 21.3 per cent de cline in net income for the first quarter, reflecting heavy losses in securities transactions.

title: Terry Rhodes Plans Nuptials
description: WASHINGTON, April 9  Miss Terry Ellen Rhodes and Geoffrey Lewis Jr., who are working with the Department of Health, Education and Welfare's Head Start project here, plan to be married in September.

title: U. S. Judge Signs Order Limiting Disclosure Reporter Must Make
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 9 Federal Judge Alfonzo J. Zirpoli has signed an order limiting the Federal Government's power of subpoena on Earl Caldwell, a New York Times correspondent.

title: Reversal Won by Groppi; Contempt Citation Voided
description: MADISON, Wis., April 9 (UPI)A Federal district judge ruled today that the Wisconsin Assembly violated the constitu tional rights of the Rev. James E. Groppi last year when it cited him for contempt.

title: Benefit for Briarcliff
description: The Briarcliff College Club of New York will hold a cocktail party and reception on Monday from 5:30 to 9 P.M. at Wednesday's, 210 East 86th Street. Mrs. Wil liam H. Buchanan Jr. is chairman of the event.

title: Market Place
description: FOR a while, it looked as if a nasty situation might be shaping up. There was Ocean Technology, a tiny De troitbased mutual fund, with a fifth of its assets in a com pany called International Proteins.

title: COSTS FORCE IVIES TO DOUBLETEAM
description: HARTFORD, Conn., April 9 The eight Ivy League athletic directors concluded two days of fiscal meetings today aimed at finding ways to cut expenses.

title: Who Says Men Don't Like Midis?
description: THERE have been no hair pulling matches about them. No sales campaigns. No fashion ambassadors such as Mrs. Georges Pompidou to help put them across. Even women who are ready to battle designers and stores about long hemlines for themselves, raise few objec tions if a man wears a midi coat.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Procedure of Liberals

title: NICKLAUS GETS 71 AND PALMER A 75
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., April 9  Tommy Aaron, the slim Geor gian who is still seeking his first triumph on the United States pro circuit, began his bid for the Masters golf title today with a 68.

title: Dr. Jean Van Tassel Smith, Connecticut Veterinarian
description: NORWALK, Conn., April 9 Dr. Jean Van Tassel Smith, state veterinarian for the Con necticut Department of Agricul ture and Natural Resources for the last 18 years, died today of a heart attack at Norwalk Hospital. He was 64 years old.

title: 17 Seized at Embassy
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (UPI)  Seventeen protesters were arrested outside the Soviet Em bassy today after handcuffing themselves to the gales. The police used bolt cutters to free the demonstrators, All 17 were charged with demonstrating within 500 feet of an embassy. Spokesmen for the Philadelphia Committee for Human Rights Now said the group look I hr action to point out the pathe tic situation of the persecuted Jewish minority in the Soviet Union.

title: MARIJUANA JURY CONVICTS FIEDLER
description: BUFFALO, April 9Dr. Les lie A. Fiedler, the author and critic, and his wife were found guilty by a sixman jury today of maintaining premises where marijuana was used, a misde meanor for which they could be sentenced to a year in jail.

title: Mother of Boy Heroin Victim Wins Right to Keep Children
description: Judge Justine Wise Polier of Family Court ruled yesterday that the mother of a 12yearold boy who died last year of heroin poisoning could keep her re maining children with her, sub ject to court supervision.

title: Telephone Answerers Accept New Contract
description: The twodayold strike of operators of telephone an swering services ended abruptly yesterday when bal loting of workers in New York City and others in Nas sau and Suffolk Counties showed a majority approval of a contract offer.

title: Egypt Terms U.S. Cynical
description: CAIRO, April 9The United States was accused here today of cynical indifference to the killing of 30 Egyptian school children yesterday by Israeli fighterbombers.

title: PEACE TERMS GIVEN IN LAOTIANS' REPLY
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, April 9 The Laotian Government today formally answered the Pathet Lao's terms for peace with counterproposals that showed wide divergence between the views of the two sides and left sent prospects of an early settlement of the war.

title: ABRAM ABANDONS RACE FOR SENATE
description: Morris B. Abram, former president of Brandeis Univer sity, withdrew yesterday as a candidate for the Democratic nomination for United States Senator and endorsed Theodore C. Sorensen.

title: PRESIDENT BITTER
description: WASHINGTON, April 9  President Nixon denounced to day the Senators who rejected his two nominees to the Su preme Court and declared that the Senate as presently consti tuted would not approve a Southern conservative. There fore, he said, he will look out side the South for a candidate to fill the vacancy on the Court.

title: Penn Central Orders Cars
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 9 (UPI) Penn Central Railroad has or dered 15 dieselelectric freight locomotives, 137 largecapacity boxcars and the remodeling of 60 dieselelectric locomotives at a total cost of $13.7million. The 15 new locomotives were, ordered from the General Elec tric Company for $3.7million.

title: Surveys Report Backlog of 500,000 Criminal Court Cases Here and Urge New Methods of Speeding Justice
description: Two reports on the Criminal Court systemone showing backlog of more than half million cases and the other call ing for modern management techniques to break the back logwere released by the city yesterday.

title: Greater Emphasis on Research Held Key to Birth Control Gains
description: BOSTON, April 9  New breakthroughs in contraceptive technology comparable in im pact to birth control pills will require greater emphasis on basic research into the repro ductive process, Dr. Roy Hertz, a researcher, said here today.

title: F111 IS DEFENDED AS BEST OF TYPE
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 Senator John G. Tower de fended the F111 attack plane today as the world's best for its mission.

title: Minor Senate Changes Snag Bill Raising Federal Pay
description: WASHINGTON, April 9A bill raising the pay of postal workers and other Federal em ployes was rushed through the House today in an effort to head off new postal strikes. The vote was 370 to 7.

title: FRANK E. DUNKER SR.
description: NEWTON, N. J., April 9 Frank E. Dunker Sr., chairman and former president of the Newton Trust Company, died yesterday in Newton Memorial Hospital. He was 75 years old and lived at 31 Liberty Street.

title: Scholarly Authors Receive Bancroft History Prizes
description: The 1970 Bancroft prizes for distinguished works in American history, diplomacy and international affairs were presented to three authors last evening at an award din ner in Low Library of Colum bia University. Awards were presented to Dan T. Carter for Scottsboro: a tragedy of the American South, Charles Coleman Sellers for Charles Wilson Peale, and Gordon S. Wood for The Creation of The American Republic, 17761787.

title: Ruth V. Martin Sets Marriage
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., April 9 Mr. and Mrs. Robert E. Martin have announced the engagement of their daugh er, Miss Ruth Victoria Mar tin, to William Samuel Kies 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Kies Jr. of Greenwich, Conn., and Juno Beach, Fla.

title: Kopechne Case Data Ordered Released; New Appeal Filed
description: BOSTON, April 9 (AP)The transcript of testimony and the inquest report on the death of Mary Jo Kopechne may be re leased Wednesday, Superior Court Judge Wilfred J. Paquet ruled today.

title: Despite Denials by Rhodesians, Race Seems Key Issue in Election Today
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, April 9  Robin James, an old Eton ian with a ginger mustache who is a political enemy of Prime Minister, Ian D. Smith, said in an interview the other day: Race is not an issue in this election campaign.

title: JASPER RHODES
description: Jasper Rhodes, a retired pa trolman, said to be the third Negro to become a member of the New York Police Depart ment, died Monday in Morrisa nia Hospital. He was 80 years old and lived at 938 St. Nicholas Avenue.

title: TALLY BY MARTIN IN 3D BREAKS TIE
description: CHICAGO, April 9 (AP)Pit Martin's tiebreaking goal with less than 5 minutes to play and Dennis Hull's insurance score with a little more than a min ute left lifted the Chicago Black Hawks to a 42 victory over the Detroit Red Wings tonight in a quarterfinal game of the Stanley Cup playoff.

title: Many Ills Seen Slowing France Despite Recent Economic Gains
description: PARIS, April 9Insufficient research, low profit margins, a shortage of outside investment, financing difficulties of French multinational companies and the burden of exchange con trols are combining to Inhibit France's development as a suc cessful industrial nation.

title: Note to Readers
description: The weekly table of Fed eral Reserve statistics and the condition of major com mercial banks in New York and Chicago is omitted from this issue because of com posingroom delays caused by union meetings.

title: PITCHER FANS 13, YIELDS FIVE HITS
description: PITTSBURGH, April 9Dock Ellis of the Pittsburgh Pirates outpitched Jerry Koosman, struck out 13 batters and de feated the New York Mets to night, 21.

title: Card of Thanks
description: WILEYAlbert. The family of the late Dr. Albert Wiley gratefully acknowledge the many kind and generous expres sions of sympathy extended to them on their great loss.

title: Books of The Times
description: LOSING BATTLES. By Eudora Welty. 436 pages. Random House. $7.95.

title: Greek Martial Law Eased, But Restrictions Remain
description: ATHENS, April 10  Pre mier George Papadopoulos an nounced an easing of martial law today, restoring some con stitutional rights to the Greek people, but he warned that they were not ready for the return of parliamentary democ racy.

title: Lindsay Asks New Taxes Affecting City's Motorists
description: Three new tax proposals that would affect city motorists were proposed yesterday by Mayor Lindsaythe first in stallment of a budgetbalancing package that city officials were working out in private negotiations with aides of Governor Rockefeller.

title: ROBERT L. OTTO
description: CINCINNATI, April 10Rob ert L. Otto, who worked for radio stations and newspapers here for more than 40 years, died yesterday at the age of 61.

title: Perot Says Pressure Of Opinion in U.S. Might Free P.O.W.'s
description: H. Ross Perot, the Texas bil lionaire who has made two trips to Southeast Asia on be half of American war prison ers, returned from the second trip yesterday and said he be lieved public opinion in the United States could change North Vietnam's views and might even obtain release of some of the 1,500 American prisoners believed to be held in North Vietnam.

title: Bal des Berceaux on April 24 to Aid French Group
description: The Committee of French American Wives has arranged the 26th annual Bal des Berceaux for April 24 at the Plaza.

title: 32,000 Chicago Drivers Are Locked Out
description: Chicago trucking companies locked out 32,000 drivers yes terday in an effort to counter the divideandconquer tactics of union negotiators trying to wreck a tentative national wage agreement.

title: Edlefsen Upset by Fairlie In Florida Tennis, 62, 64
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., April 10 (AP)Brian Fairlie of New Zealand upset fourthseeded Tom Edlefsen of Los Angeles, 62, 64, today to gain the semi finals of the Masters invitation tennis match.

title: Copter Takes Ill Woman Off Soviet Fishing Ship
description: A young woman, member of the crew of a Soviet fish ing trawler, was evacuated by a Coast Guard helicopter yesterday afternoon.

title: Court Says Man Lacks Qualities of Stewardess
description: MIAMI, April 10 (UPI) Federal Judge Charles Fulton has agreed with Pan Ameri can World Airways that Celio Diaz Jr. just did not qualify as a stewardess.

title: Theater: And I Met a Man Arrives
description: EARLIER this season there El was a play called The Jumping Fool, in which a man having a nervous break down is obsessed by an acro bat. Last night a play called And I Met a Man opened and in it a woman having a nervous breakdown is pos sessed by a guru. Beneath the overplay of mysticism both are small doniestic traumas.

title: McCartney Breaks Off With Beatles
description: LONDON, April 10Paul Mc Cartney said today he had broken with the Beatles over a series of differences.

title: Lucky Creed Arrives for Pacing Series at Yonkers
description: YONKERS, April 10Lucky Creed was one of 20 Australian standardbreds that arrived at Kennedy airport this morning. All 20 were vanned to the United States Department of Agriculture quarantine station at Clifton N. J.

title: RABBI HERBERT HENDEL
description: LEVITTOWN, Pa., April 10 Rabbi Herbert Hendel, spiritual leader of Temple Shalom, died of a heart attack yesterday at Lower Bucks County Hospital. He was 53 years old.

title: Lee Wins at Forum, Stopping Melendez In the Ninth Round
description: A pair of prizefighters from Washington restored a measure of fistic prestige to the National Capitol last night in The Felt Forum by scoring convincing knockout victories.

title: Manhattan School of Music Planning Summer Session
description: The Manhattan School of Music at Claremont Avenue and 122d Street, will offer a summer session this year for precollege students, candidates for bachelor's and master's de grees and music educators. The announcement of the new venture was made by George Schick, president.

title: 2 Villages in Vietnam: Prosperity and Stagnation
description: NHONTRACH, South Viet nam, April 8  Phuhol and Nhonthanh are two villages only a few miles apart in the Nhontrach district southeast of Saigon.

title: Yukon Flourishes as Mineral Output Soars
description: SKAGWAY, Alaska  About 750 persons live in this dusty port town ringed by snow capped mountains and most de pend for their livelihood on the onetrack railroad that snakes southward through the Coast Mountains from the Yukon, bringing minerals to the tide water.

title: Action on Jordanian Front
description: JERUSALEM, Apil 10  Fighting was renewed on the IsraeliJordanian front today with heavy shelling of Israeli settlements and an air strike against Jordan.

title: First Live TV Shots Planned For Recovery of Apollo 13
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., April 10 (AP)A helicopter hovering over the Apollo 13 spaceship after it lands in the Pacific April 21 hopes to relay the first live closeup television pic tures of the recovery of a team of American astronauts.

title: LOBBIES INCLUDED WIVES AND CLERGY
description: ALBANY, April 10The ad vice and pressure on Assembly men who voted for and against abortion reform yesterday were as personal as a midnight chat with a wife and as sensitive as a personal call from a monsig nor.

title: Alcindor and Bucks a Major Obstacle on Garden Court
description: Confrontation  eyeball to Adam's applewith basket ball's basic problem begins for the New York Knicker bockers today when they face supertall Lew Alcindor and the Milwaukee Bucks in the opening game of a four ofseven National Basketball Association playoff series.

title: Auto Industry Layoffs Set Back Drive to Train HardCore Jobless
description: DETROIT  Barry Robinson sat in a friend's small room over a used furniture store, looked down at the floor and said in despair: Just about the time I got straightened out they laid me off. I'm out on the street again.

title: Market Summary
description: Friday, April 10, 1970

title: Hepburn Extends Stay
description: Katharine Hepburn has ex tended her engagement as the star of Coco an additional two weeks through June 27, it was announced yesterday by Frederick Brisson, producer. The added time will permit the pro ducer and Alan Jay Lerner, the musical's librettist and lyricist, to conclude arrangements to find a successor to Miss Hepburn.

title: City Rent Ceiling May Go Up to 3.3%
description: Benjamin Altman, the city's Commissioner of Rent and Housing Maintenance, said yes terday that a ceiling of 3.3 per, cent on rent increases seemed to be in order to allow land lords to pay expected wage rises for building maintenance employes, whose contracts ex pire April 20. The present ceil ing is 2.5 Der cent.

title: Needham Picks New Chief After President Resigns
description: The executive committee of the Needham Packing Company, Inc., announced yesterday the resignation of James L. Need ham as president and chief ex ecutive officcer, effective im mediately.

title: M.I.T. Varsity Eight to Oppose Columbia Today on the Harlem
description: The Columbia varsity crew, which won two races over half a dozen southern eights during its spring vacation period in Florida, will row against the Massachusetts Institute of Tech nology today in the feature event on the Harlem River.

title: Yancey Is Certain He Will Win On Augusta CourseSometime
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., April 10 Behind him, against a back drop of towering pine trees, was the tee sign. In its cen ter, painted in green on a white background, was a cir cled 16, above that it read 190 vds and below. par 3.

title: J.S. Jet Crashes at Base In Thailand, Killing 3 Men
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Satur day, April 11. (AP)  A United, States Air Force plane that had been hit by antiaircraft fire over Laos crashed into officers', quarters at Udorn Air Base in, northeastern Thailand yester day, killing at least three Amer icans and injuring 30.

title: NEW CHIEF IS NAKED BY HARPER & ROW
