description: Winthrop Knowlton, execu tive vice president of Harper & Row, was elected president and chief executive officer of the 152yearold book publish ing company yesterday in a special meeting of the board of directors.

title: METALS TRADING SHOWS ADVANCES
description: In moderate trading, the three metalsplatinum, silver and coppershowed advances yesterday on a mixture of news.

title: Senator Church for A.J.D. End; Calls Latin Program Net Loss
description: WASHINGTON, April 10  Senator Frank Church charged today that the United States aid program to Latin America had proved to be a net loss and proposed that the Agency for International Development be shut down and the keys thrown away.

title: Orioles Turn Back Tigers in 10th, 32, For 4th in a Row
description: BALTIMORE, April 10 (UPI)  Brooks Robinson's twoout single in the bottom of the 10th scored Frank Robinson from second base to lift the Balti more Orioles to a 32 victory over the Detroit Tigers today in their home opener before a crowd of 33,638.

title: Market Place
description: IF you have bought mutual fund shares since the be ginning of 1969, chances are your head is bloody, even bowed.

title: 5 of 6 U.S. Moon Veterans Eligible for Future Flights
description: SPACE CENTER, Houston, April 10 (UPI)One man from the first two American moon landing crews has left the space program for a job else where in Government. The five others remain eligible for re peat moon flight assignments, and one of them, Richard F. Gordon, is on the backup crew for Anollo 15 next year.

title: 'How to Suceed With Sex' Arrives
description: "WOULD you like to start here, in the center of the room, and progress to the bed in steps of growing eroticism?" the sweet-limbed young call-girl unaffectedly asks. Clean-cut young Jack agrees. And together they begin the climax that leads to the conclusion of "How to Succeed with Sex," an occasionally pleasant dirty movie that opened yesterday at the Penthouse and Pacific East theaters.Principally, one will wish to see this movie for its women, who are lovely. But one may also listen to its dialogue, which is ironic, literate, and occasionally even funny.The title derives from a book that Jack (Zack Taylor) buys to help him seduce his fiance, Sandy (Mary Jane Carpenter), a most resolute and unlikely virgin, and that speaks to him, in a gravelly voice, throughout the movie. He succeeds part of the time and fails part of the time, and fantasizes like crazy all off the time.Often the fantasies get in the way of success or failure, and then "How to Succeed with Sex" declines into a nervous classy photography approach to its subject that seems designed chiefly to keep you from seeing enough. But once in a while the fantasies suggest a real point of view that is more complicated and more sophisticated than the film's premises might have led you to expect.An amphibious film, at least half of "How to Succeed with Sex" takes place in swimming pools and at marinas and on a sailboat off the California coast. In this context the cult of the body, especially the Southern California body, seems a reasonable religion  for which Victoria Bond and Bambi Allen and Luanne Roberts and all the nameless beauties who bounce through Jack's dreams are healthy prophets.But on the other side, Shawn Devereaux, a cocktail lounge pick-up, and the only girl in the cast who looks old enough to have graduated high school, parodies pornography consciously, and with a civilized wickedness that indicates she is all together, body and soul.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: April 10, 1970

title: M'ANDREW VICTIM OF SEVENRUN 3D
description: ST. LOUIS, April 10Richie Allen, Astroturf and the New York Mets made their debuts in the home of the St. Louis Car dinals tonight, and the Mets came off second best.

title: Art: Xeroxophilia Rafies Out of Control
description: AN exhibition that will gladden the hearts of in curable Xeroxophiles every where opened yesterday at the New York Cultural Cen ter, 2 Columbus Circle. Re garded by its sponsors as an art exhibition, the show is called Conceptual Art and Conceptual Aspects. It con sists, for the most part, of Xeroxed copies of various texts (not all of which are intended for reading), which are mounted on the walls or displayed in cases just as if they wereyou must forgive the expressionworks of art.

title: The Commissioner Replies
description: DENNY McLAIN'S suspension until July 1 was a pun ishment for the misconduct of associating with gamblers, an act that does not conform to the high standards required of baseball players, said Commissioner Bowie Kuhn in an interview Thursday evening. While this misconduct could cast doubts on the game, the risk was lessened by the public image of the 26yearold pitching star as a man apart whose behavior was likely to be isolated as typically Denny McLain rather than reflective of routine baseball player conduct.

title: Topics: F. D. F. After Twenty  Five Years
description: It is now a quarter century since that fragrant April day in 1945 when a shaken world heard that Franklin Delano Roosevelt was dead. As the rushing years have crowded our minds with new issues and anxieties, F.D.R.'s reputation has undergone fluctuation and vicissitude. Older people, to the end of their days, will never forget when and where they heard the news of his death; but the young of 1970 find him a remote and not especially relevant figure.

title: STOCKS RETREAT ON LONDON BOARD
description: The London stock market closed quietly lower yesterday.

title: FORUM HEAD SEES TEST IN F.C.C. CASE
description: Lawrence K. Grossman, pres ident of Forum Communica tions, Inc., the challenger in the WPIX, Channel 11, broadcast license contest, asserted yester day that the forthcoming hear ings on the dispute would test for the first time the Federal Communications Commission's recent ruling that requires that licensees show substantial and solid performance before they receive renewals.

title: U.S. Backs First Merger Under Jersey Banking Law
description: WASHINGTON, April 10 (UPI) The Treasury Department ap proved today the first merger of New Jersey's grossly under sized banks under the state's new branching and merger law. The law divides the state into three banking districts.

description: HOUSTON, April 10 (AP) Dr. Frank E. Vandiver has re signed as acting president of the Rice University but the school's trustees apparently have not rejected or accepted the resignation.

description: ELIZABETH, N. J., April 10 In closing testimony today, Judge Ralph De Vita of Union County District Court repeated under crossexamination his de nial of charges that he had at tempted to bribe a prosecutor and obstrust justice.

title: Abortion Reform at Last
description: After years of patient effort and emotioncharged debate, New York State is expected soon to have on the books an abortionreform law that leaves the deci sion on abortions, up to the 24th week of pregnancy, where it rightfully belongswith the woman and her physician.

title: Douglas Chides His Critics
description: Justice William O. Douglas had a cautionary word yester day for detractors upset by his latest book, which warns that violence may prove to be the only effective re sponse to the country's ills. He said they would like his future writings even less.

title: Just Like the Market Some Lower Prices, Some Higher
description: PRICES are dancing around as much as hemlines on Seventh Avenue these days, except that the hemline movement is mostly down ward. The cost of clothes, like everything else, is going up, but manufacturers are finding various means of countering this trend.

title: Hawaii Volcano Erupts
description: HILO, Hawaii, Apail 10 (UPI) Kilauea Volcano sent foun tains of lava 25 feet high yes terday, and the flowing lava wiped out a parking lot in Ha waii Volcanos National Park. The eruption, considered mod erate, was the latest in a se ries that began May 24, 1969.

title: St. Clair Fishing Banned By Michigan's Governor
description: TORONTO, April 10 (UPI) Gov. William G. Milliken of Michigan announced a ban to day on fishing in Lake St. Clair and the St. Clair River as precautionary measure due to contamination there. Canada ordered a ban last week.

title: Eastern Fights Hijackers With Tightened Security
description: Eastern Airlines, following the slaying of one of its co pilots last month, has started a broad new security program to deter hijackings. A byprod uct of the tightened antihijack ing security efforts has been the apprehension of passengers carrying narcotics and of fugi tives from the police.

title: CURB URGED IN USE OF PCB CHEMICAL
