description: A 17year old suspect was arrested late yesterday after noon in the fatal stabbings of an elderly couple and their 25 year old daughterinlaw in the Rosebank section of Staten Island.

title: Atlantic Richfield's Earnings Fell 9% in the First Quarter
SYRIAN JETS RAID ISRAELI POSITIONS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 25 The Syrian Air Force struck at the Israelis today, 24 hours after Israeli jets had raided a Syrian military camp near the occupied Golan heights.

title: The Best of the Blues
description: AN allblue garden requires special thought and choice of material since few plants produce pure blue bloom. Regrettably, most catalogues describe flowers that are actually mauve, lav ender and purplish or cerise blue. One has almost to see plants in bloom to be certain of their color quality.

title: Festivals and Shows
description: PLANTING FIELDS Arbo retum of the State Uni versity of New York at Oyster Bay, L. I. is showing an exhibition of gar den and nature photographs by Samuel H. Gottscho. Mr. Gottscho, now celebrating his 95th year, has selected some of his favorites taken during more than 50 years of pho tography. The exhibition will be open from now through May at the Arboretum Center daily from 10 A.M. to 4 P.M.

title: William Bundy to Speak
description: PROVIDENCE, April 25 (AP) William P. Bundy; a Defense and State department official in the Kennedy and Johnson Administrations, will speak at Brown University April 29. Mr. Bundy is now a visiting pro fessor at Massachusetts Insti tute of Technology and a col umnist for Newsweek magazine.

title: Yarborough's Conservative Rival in Texas Race Mounts a Strong Challenge
description: DALLAS, April 24  A mil lionaire insurance executive has mounted a surprisingly potent challenge to Senator Ralph W. Yarborough in the campaign leading to the Democratic pri mary election in Texas next Saturday.

title: UKRAINIANS OPPOSE GROUP LEADER TODAY
description: The GermanAmerican Soc cer League of New York, close to the end of its 47th season, has slated four Major Division games today.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Will COPPERS Lead The Next Bull Market?

title: Checks Not as Advertised
description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP)The newspaper Jornal do Brazil re ports that a confidence man in remote rural areas is doing a brisk business selling at half price checks he says are so good they can be cashed at Rio banks, Aleencar Pereira Passos, a farmer, was the latest man to find out it was not true, the paper said.

title: Miss Danalee Detroit Victor
description: LIVONIA, Mich., April 25 (AP)Miss Danalee, a 4year old filly, took command at the top of the stretch to win her second straight $15,000 Star lette Handicap at Detroit race course today. Miss Danalee, owned by W. A. Loften and ridden by Larry Snyder, fin ished four lengths in front of Flirtation, returning $4.20, $3.40 and $2.60.

title: Concerto for Violin In Eastern France
description: MIRECOURT, FranceThe people in this little town in the Vosges Mountains continue a craft that has been an occupation here since the 16th century: the making of stringed instruments. The craft was our reason for traveling to Mirecourt, but our journey was made by chance and under duress.

title: Brazil to Get Tranquilizers
description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) The largest laboratory for pro ducing tranquilizers in Latin America will be built in Brazil, the Apec Financial news serv ice reported. The report said the Roche Company would in vest about $24million to build it.

title: It's Ladies' Day on Long Island Sound as the Frostbite Dinghy Regatta Gets Under Way
U.S.I.A.Issues Conservative Book List
description: WASHINGTON, April 25 The United States Information Agency has instructed its over seas libraries to order conserv ativeoriented books from a special list that included works by Governor Ronald Reagan of California, Senator Barry M. Goldwater of Arizona and the late Whittaker Chambers to as sure balance between the liber al and conservative viewpoints.

title: ST. JOSEPH'S RETAINS CREW CUP UPSTATE
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., April 25St. Joseph's College Varsity Eight captured the ninth an nual President's Cup Race to day for the second straight year.

title: JEWISH UNIT FINDS SCHOOL PLEA RISE
description: The American Jewish Con gress charged yesterday that supporters of government aid to parochial schools, were in creasing their demands to the point of seeking the same fi nancing given public schools.

title: Draft Boards Short Of Quotas by 20% In Last 3 Months
description: WASHINGTON, April 25 (UPI)Local draft boards have delivered only 80 per cent of the manpower requested by the military during the last three months.

title: Illinois Report Terms Weathermen Threat to Nation
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., April 25 The Illinois Senate this week received a report calling the Weatherman faction of Stu dents for a Democratic Society an immediate and longrange threat to the nation's internal security.

title: Cyrena S. Gouge Is Bride Of S. Stoney Simons Jr.
description: Wayne, Pa., April 25 Miss Cyrena Scott Gouge and S. Stoney Simons Jr. were married here this after noon in St. David's Episco pal Chapel by the Rev. Richard W. Hess, the rector.

title: Article 19  No Title
description: Manhattan soon after the end of World War II, as poured forth in a magazine of the period:

title: Major Gets 16 Years In Vietnam Drug Case
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, April 26 (AP)A United States Air Force major who was convicted of smuggling opium from Thai land and illegal possession of American dollars was sen tenced today to 16 years at hard labor.

title: Marigolds Fill the Border With Color
description: Success is sure with marigolds. They are among the easiest annuals to grow in a sunny location. Seed can be sown in the open ground or plants can be started on a sunny window sill and transplanted to the border after all danger of frost is passed.

title: Canada Allots Funds to Revive HeavyWater Plant
description: OTTAWA, April 25  An acute shortage of heavy water needed for Canada's nuclear power development has prompt ed the Government to give Nova Scotia $41.5million to re habilitate a plant that has al ready cost $104million but has failed to work.

title: Rhode Island Crew Wins
description: KINGSTON, R. I., Anril 25 The Rhode Island University varsity crew scored a close vie tory over C. W. Post today. The winning time in 1?mile straight race alone the Narrow River was 6 minutes 34 sec onds.

title: Donna Hepler Becomes Bride
description: NEW HAVEN, April 25 The marriage of Miss Donna Louise Hepler to Dr. Arthur Saxton Blank Jr., clinical di rector of the Yale Psychiatric Institute and assistant profes sor of medicine at the Yale School of Medicine, took place at the Unitarian Soci ety of New Haven this after noon. The Rev. Wayne Shut tee performed the ceremony.

title: Article 22  No Title
description: VERMONT

title: Thomas Edwards, 79, Dies; A Leader in Social Health
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., April 25Thomas C. Edwards, who retired in 1956 as field director of the American Social Health Association, died Thurs day at his home, 70 Bayview Avenue. His age was 79.

title: Russian Historian Disavows AntiSoviet Article. Attributed to Him in West
description: A Russian historian has charged that antiSoviet writ ings have been falsely attrib uted to him and published in the West in a campaign to de fame him.

title: Peggy Lee Is Still On TopIs That All There Is?
description: HERE is what there is: Miss Peggy Lee slinks into the living room of her Waldorf Towers suite, wearing a pair of turquoise silk movie star pa jamas. Her blonde hair tumbles down past her shoulders now, and her figure is plumpbut womanly. A youngish Mae West. But then you notice the skin... it is as smooth and pink as an Iowa sorority girl's. How can it be true? This sexy, sensuous, seductive woman will be 50 years old come May 26, and she is a grand mother three times! But throughout it all she has en dured, grown even better with age. And she is still, as Duke Ellington once put it, The Queen.

title: Article 24  No Title
description: VERMONT

title: Article 21  No Title
description: Thirty mile panoramic Pocono Mt.view

title: Antiwar Priest Sought by F.B.I. Says He Will Continue Defiance
description: The Rev. Daniel Berrigan, who is facing a prison term for destroying draft cards, says he will remain a fugitive from the authorities as long as he can to show them they can no longer lock people up on their order, any more than they can induct people into military service on their order.

title: Bogus Money a Spur to Pupils' Efforts
description: ST. LOUISJim Cannady, 11yearold fourth grader et Carr Lane Elementary School, hunched intently over a checker board in the free time corner of his classroom.

title: Annaghkeen
description: Deborah Love came to Ireland for a short holiday with her husband Peter Matthiessen, and two children. They lived in a rented house on a little island on the shores of Lough Corrib not far from the great hotel at Ashford Castle, known to all af fluent tourists. She has now written a book about Ireland, about herself, her thoughts and her family, and about a lot of other things. She takes the title from the name of the place where she lived.

title: Drama, Not Long Out of the Womb
description: ISUPPOSE that drama could be defined four times over in the course of watch ing John Lewin's newand very free adaptation of Aeschylus's The Pers ians, now being offered as A Ceremony for Our Time at St. George's Church in Stuyvesant Square.

title: A Happy Marriage on the Hudson
description: IT is a small museum at a time when large mu seums are vying to get larger. It is an allpur pose, local museum, present ing low pressure shows on almost any aspect of art, sci ence or history, when mu seums are intensifying spe cialization and the pursuit of possessions. It is the Hudson River Museum, a half hour from midManhattan in Yon kers, a city of about 200,000 more generally known for political, economic and mu nicipal management troubles than for culture, and it is a lesson in what a communi ty museum should be.

title: Thant Urges Support For Youth Assembly
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., April 25  Secretary Gen eral Thant has asked govern ments to help pay for the nineday World Youth As sembly, which is scheduled to open July 9.

title: TALKS DEADLOCKED IN LESOTHO CRISIS
description: MASERU, Lesotho, April 25 (Agence FrancePresse)Talks on how to end the constitu tional crisis in Lesotho are re ported to be at a standstill be tween Prime Minister Leabua Jonathan and two opponents he detained when he seized power in a coup tat last January.

title: Top Utah U. Coed Named Don
description: SALT LAKE CITY, April 25 (AP)The Associated Women Students of the University of Utah has a new president a man. Don Brady, 24 years old, of Salt Lake City polled 48 votes as a writein candi date to 43 for the runnerup, Shauna Baynes. I think all presidential posts should be held by men, he said. Last year there was a council of eight women. I'm going to appoint eight men.

title: Sinister Intrigue Surrounds Hellebores
description: THREE plant families supplied the four clas sic poisons: hemlock, nightshade, aconite, and hellebore. The latter, a mem ber of the buttercup family, includes several ornamental herbaceous plants. Yet in spite of their sinister reputa tion, the showy hellebores provide cheerful heralds of spring.

title: Riga: Latvia's Playground in a Citadel of Culture
description: RIGA, Latvia  The Latvians call their country Amberland because of the rich harvest of golden yellow and orangebrown nug gets of amberfossilized conifer resins older than the Alps and the Himalayas which for eons have been washed by the sea onto the Latvian shore. On that shoreline, which curves around a vast gulf like a giant necklace, gleams Riga.

title: MALAWI SEEKING TOURIST BUSINESS
description: BLANTYRE, Malawi, April 18Malawi, a poor, black na tion that is more concerned with economic development than ideology, is making a de termined effort to get the tour ist business of South Africa, the citadel of apartheid, or ra cial separation.

title: Letter to the Editor 1  No Title
NEBRASKA ACCORDS NERUD RACING HONOR
description: NEBRASKA ACCORDS NERUD RACING HONOR

title: Policing of Airport Cargo Here May Be Given Waterfront Unit
description: The Waterfront Commission appears to be on the verge of obtaining additional powers at the city's airports, according to New Jersey legislative sour ces.

title: Lend Nature Helping Hands
description: WE started our wild flower garden in a moment of desperation. Our modern home was built in the midst of an oak wood, near a granite cliff, a spot where the ground was shaded all summer long. In short, ordinary flowers would not thrive except in highly expensive, imported loam, and then only if many trees were cut.

title: Injured Shoulder Could Limit Reed Tomorrow Night
description: The heat is on, for Willis Reed of the Knicks as well as for the Los Angeles Lakers.

title: Captain Sues to Prohibit the Army From Making Generalized Searches
description: WASHINGTON, April 25 An Army captain has filed suit in the United States District Court here in an attempt to stop generalized searches on installations controlled by the Army.

title: Aid to San Clemente Police
description: WASHINGTON, April 25 (UPI)The Justice Department announced a grant of nearly $100,000 this week to help the 34man police department of San Clemente, Calif., deal with special problems created by President Nixon's Western White House. Attorney General John N. Mitchell said the funds were needed because San Cle mente now has special law en forcement responsibilities.

title: Prices Take a Beating On Amex and Counter
description: Prices took another beat ing last week on the Ameri can Stock Exchange and on the overthecounter market in comparatively quiet trad ing.

title: Advertising:
description: Next fall Ebony, the coun try's biggest Negroaudience magazine, will celebrate its 25th anniversary. There will be no fuss. That will come next year when its publish ers, the Johnson Publishing Company, opens its own of fice building in Chicago.

title: LIBERTIES WIDEN FOR HUNGARIANS
description: BUDAPEST, April 14Grad ually and without fanfare, Hun gary appears to be widening the scope of liberty in the country  mostly by state de cree but sometimes through the government's acceptance of in dividual efforts.

title: Brainstorming a barn
description: The best of two design worlds is combined in this Connecticut house owned by Thomas Ingle, a painter. An 1810 barn was con verted into a twostory, chestnut paneled living room that boasts an enormous brick fireplace and a cantilevered staircase that leads to the old loft, now used as a studio. The rest of the house con sists of a modern wing by James McNair, who designed it to accent rather than reflect the lines of the barn. The strong, sloping roof of the new structure is set off by white stucco walls pierced by bold modern doors and windows.

title: Sports of The Times
description: FOR quite obvious reasons, it's impos sible to overlook Wilt Chamberlain. When the man mountain 7footer of the Los Angeles Lakers doesn't dominate the game, he at least dominates the con versation. So there was almost as much talk about Wilt the Stilt in Madison Square Garden the night before last after the opening game of the championship playoff series as there was about the impressive, although somewhat scary, 124112, victory of the Knicks over the Lakers.

title: BRITISH DEBATING FORCES' CAPACITY
description: LONDON, April 25 Britain's fighting services have opened a twomonth training exercise in Malaysia to demonstrate their capacity to intervene ef fectively in the Far East while making their major military ef fort in Europe.

title: John Morgan Callagy Weds Miss Mollie McNeil in South
description: PINEHURST, N. C., April 25Miss Mollie McNeil and John Morgan Callagy were married here today in the Sacred Heart Roman Catho lic Church. Msgr. Leonard R. Toomey performed the cere mony. He concelebrated the mass with the Rev. Robert J. Haskins.

title: Civilisation
description: When Kenneth Clark first appeared on television, many people thought that, like an Afghan hound harnessed to a garbage truck, he would do him self some kind of injury. But he turned out not merely to excel at it but to need it, the way Dr. Schwei tzer needed lambarn as a moral challenge. Television called forth qualities in Clark which needed exercise: a residuary Scottish tough ness, a High Victorian sense of public duty, and an old trouper's delight in an overflowing house. He loved the box, and the box loved him; and when our British Broadcasting Corpo ration took him out to luncheon and suggested that he should survey the whole of Western civilization in 13 hourlong programs he accepted be fore anyone could say, Brandy and cigars?

title: RICHEY, GRAEBNER IN RIVER OAKS FINAL
description: HOUSTON, April 25 (UPI) Topseeded Cliff Richey and Clark Graebner advanced to the final of the $25,000 River Oaks invitation tennis tournament today.

title: Four Saints To Take A New Trip
description: ONE of the historic dates in Amer ican music is Feb. 8, 1934. On that night Four Saints in Three Acts, words by Gertrude Stein, music by Virgil Thomson, had its first stage performance at the Wadsworth Museum in Hartford, Conn. John House man was the director, Frederick Ashton, the choreographer, Florine Stettheimer, the designer (daringly using cellophane for sets and costumes); and Alexander Smallens, the conductor. The production was sensational enough to find its way to New York and the 44th Street Thea ter for 48 performances.

title: HENNING CAPTURES TALLAHASSEE LEAD
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., April 25 (AP)Harold Henning of South Africa covered the 7,008yard Killearn County Club course today with a recordtying 64 to take a onestroke lead after the third round of the $50,000 Tal lahassee open. off the pace and matched course record set by Larry son in the 1969 Tallahassee open. Henning's 54hole was 207.

title: W. Michigan Names Diget
description: KALAMAZOO, Mich., April 25 (AP)  Western Michigan named have Nigel as swimming coach today. Diget succeeds Ed Gabel, who retired.

title: Sandra Nagro Is Wed to Barry H. Lobel
description: MENDHAM, N.J., April 25 Miss Sandra Jean Nagro was married here this after noon to Barry H. Lobel at the Roxiticus Golf Club. Mayor Edward Haskell Hew son of New Vernon performed the ceremony.

title: Anniversaries
description: ABRAMSLoret. Happy 3rd to my dearest wife. 47 more to go. I love you.

title: Judges' Campaign Funds Under Investigation Here
description: An investigation by the Joint Legislative Committee on Crime into apparent links be tween certain judges and mem bers of organized crime has been broadened to inquire into what it costs to become a judge and where the money comes from.

title: NoMail Notice Is Slow
description: OSMOTHERLEY, England (AP)No one knew for several days that the post office had dropped its second daily mail delivery in this Yorkshire com munity, because the letter ex pla5ning the change, addressed to the town clerk, was delivered to the wrong addr5ess.

title: MUTINY IN TRINIDAD APPEARS TO BE OVER
description: PORT OF SPAIN, Trinidad, April 25 (AP)A mutiny at army headquarters appeared to have ended today when rebel troops released about 30 hos tages and began turning in their weapons, police officials reported.

title: Xerox Sets Increases In Executive Staff
description: Joseph B. Flavin, formerly a senior vice president and a director, has been named an executive vice president of the Xerox Corporation, Stam ford, Conn., it was announced last week.

title: COLLEGIAN PRESSES RACE FOR GOVERNOR
description: The EwingforGovernor ma chine rolled into New York City yesterday in a 1961 Chrysler.

title: Television
description: THERE is a screw loose in television's approach to programming for children. The deserved ly successful Sesame Street is a fine enrichment of the morning hours and there's been erratic improvement in the Saturday morning schedules of the commercial networks. But the major need does not exist solely in the mornings, helpful though such morning diversion is, and the emphasis on Satur day morning programing is overstressed; that is the one period of the week when a family actually has a chance to get together. Where the youngsters and their parents generally get shortest shrift is in the late afternoon and early evening hours just be fore supper and bedtime.

title: European Notebook
description: In the last few months the activities of a great many Soviet writers and artists have been directed toward prepara tions for the centenary of Lenin's birth on April 22. Since the early fall of 1969 an in cessant downpour of Leniniana has flooded the U.S.S.R., and publication of other books has been suspended or blocked. The declarations of the Party's Central Committee as well as the instructions given by the Union of Soviet Writers, par ticularly by its celebration commission, indicates plainly what was expected from novel ists, poets and essayists. In spired by the ideas of socialist revolution, says the official document, literature and art are an integral part of the pro letarian cause and of the peo ple's struggle for the victory of Communism. The Literary Gazette urged writers to re ject any ideological com promise and display a passion ate affirmation of communist ideals. The declarations of the Party's Central Committee as well as the instructions given by the Union of Soviet Writers, par ticularly by its celebration commission, indicates plainly what was expected from novel ists, poets and essayists. In spired by the ideas of socialist revolution, says the official document, literature and art are an integral part of the pro letarian cause and of the peo ple's struggle for the victory of Communism. The Literary Gazette urged writers to re ject any ideological com promise and display a passion ate affirmation of communist ideals.

title: Army Recruit Is KingSized
description: BLACKDOWN, England (AP) Michale Venables, a 16year old Army recruit, is 6feet10 inches tall and still growing. The Royal Army Ordnance Corps has had to find him cus tommade uniforms, boots and bed.

title: Knicks Are Drawing Full Houses to Bars Around the Cable TV Circuit, Too
description: Outside, a wellgroomed young man in a brown sports jacket was shaking his head. I'm sorry, he was saying to a couple. There's lust no room inside anywhere.

title: Article 16  No Title
Environmental Study Grant
description: WORCESTER, Mass., April 25 (AP)  Worcester Polytechnic Institute has received a $200,000 grant from the Alfred P. Sloan Fundation of New York. The grant is to establish a program of study in environmental con trol.

title: Education
description: Almost 20 years ago, when a group of Young Turk education reformers sought new ways of giving sagging public education a blood transfusion, they pressed for the use of nonprofessional teacher aides. There was an im mediate outcry by the profes sionadministrators and teach ers alike  against such an intrusion by the uncertified into the teacher's castle. So vehement was the opposition that the Fund for the Advancement of Educa tion, a subsidiary of the Ford Foundation, had to go all the way to Battle Creek, Michigan, to find a superintendent daring enough to take its money to finance a teacher aide pilot pro ject.

title: A. E. Stern Weds Sandra Gardner
description: HARTFORD, April 25Miss Sandra Ann Gardner was married here this afternoon to Andrew Eyston Stern. The Rev. Edward McLean per formed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass in St. Augustine's Roman Cath olic Church.

title: COLUMN OF 40,000 AIDS CUBAN FARMS
description: CIEGO DE AVILA, Cuba, April 25 (Reuters)A volun teer labor force of 40,000 young Cubans organized as a military column is spearhead ing agaricultural development here in Cuba's most under pop ulated province.

title: Ms. Urged in Place Of Mrs. and Miss
description: WASHINGTON, April 25 (AP)A new form of address for women, Ms. to replace Mrs. and Miss has been proposed by a New York Congressman.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: WALLOP CLEARS RIGHTFIELD ROOF
description: PITTSBURGH, April 25 (UPI) William Stargell capped a fourrun seventh inning with a tremendous tworun homer over the rightfield roof today, en abling the Pittsburgh Pirates to defeat the Atlanta Braves, 87.

title: Stamps
description: SCOTT'S Standard Post age Stamp Catalogue and the related stamp collecting accessories produced by Scott Publica tions, Inc., has new owners  Harmer, Rooke & Co. of New York, and Graphics Pub lishing Co. of Omaha, Neb. The latter is headed by Duane Hillmer, a stamp col lector.

title: Canadian Kaleidoscope: The Sound of 100 Tongues
description: OTTAWA  America is a melting pot, but Canada is a mosaic. The dominant pieces in the pat tern are the two charter peoples, the British and the French, but the visitor will miss much of the flavor of Canada if he fails to make contact with the ethnics, as they are known.

title: Bullitt Letter to Roosevelt in 1943 Urged Invasion of Balkans to Deter Soviet Advance
description: A forceful plea for a British United States invasion of the Balkans to forestall Soviet domination of Eastern Europe, made by an American diplomat to President Roosevelt in 1943, has been disclosed in hitherto secret documents at the Frank lin D. Roosevelt Library at Hyde Park. N. Y.

title: ENGLAND, SCOTS TIE IN SOCCER, 00
description: LONDON, April 25 (Reuters) England, champions for the ast two years, had to share the British soccer championship with Scotland and Wales fol lowing today's deciding games in the tournament.

title: Edward Robertson 2d, Banker, Marries Miss Susan Merritt
description: WEST HARTFORD, Conn., April 25Miss Susan Lee Merritt, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Philip Joseph Merritt, was married here this after noon to Edward Livingston Robertson 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Reay Robert son of Boston.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
West Germany Picks Kregel
description: MAINZ, West Germany, April 25 (AP)Wilhelm Kregel was elected president of the West German Sports Federation to day, succeeding Willi Daume. Daume asked to be relieved of his duties in order to concen trate on his job as president of the organizing committee for the 1972 Munich Olympics.

title: UNSER BROTHERS CHIEF OPPONENTS
description: TRENTON, April 25The championship trail of the Unit ed States Auto Club comes east tomorrow afternoon with a 200 mile event at Trenton Speed way.

title: Gerry Ann Schramm Married Here to Dr. Etienne de Harven
description: Miss Gerry Ann Schramm, head of the foreign desk of the American Cancer Society, was married here yesterday morning to Dr. Etienne de Harven, chief of the division of cytology at the Sloan Kettering Institute for Cancer Research and professor of biology at the Graduate School of Medical Sciences at Cornell University. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Walter Kring at the Unitarian Church of All Souls.

title: British Football Results
description: By Reuters

title: Brazil Reports Camp Raid
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, April 25 (AP)Brazilian army and air force men have rounded up more than 20 suspects they de scribed as part of a leftwing guerrilla training camp south west of here. Soldiers have con fiscated weapons, ammunition, medical supplies, guerrilla uni forms and radio equipment at the camp.

title: Al Unser Is Riding the Crest of Success
description: THE Al half of the brothers Unser from Albuquerque, N. M., dropped into town a couple of days ago to per sonalize his campaign for the 1970 driving championship of the United States Auto Club.

title: Coins
description: VARIATIONS in the 1970 cent, discovered among shipments of the earlystruck coins from the San Francisco Mint, have the collecting fraternity agog. Not since 1960, when the cent appeared with dif ferences in the size of the last digit (0), has so much excitement been stirred by a new coin issue. Large and small dates were found among the first cents made for this year by the Coast assay facility. It is possible that a few of the smaller 1970 S coins will turn up in the first proof sets mailed out.

title: California Names Regent
description: BERKELEY, Calif., April 25 (AP)Dr. John H. Lawrence, 66 years old, has resigned as director of the University of California Donner Laboratory of Nuclear Medicine to become a Regent of the university. He is the brother of the late Nobel prize winning physicist Ernest O. Lawrence.

title: A RESEARCH FARM OPENS IN NIGERIA
description: IBADAN. Nigeria, April 20 An international study center has been dedicated here with the goal of helping farmers in tropical lands to produce more and better food.

title: Ryan Signs Redskin Pact
description: WASHINGTON, April 25 (AP)  Frank Ryan, a 34yearold backup quarterback, signed to day to play with the Washing ton Redskins during 1970, his 13th season of professional foot ball.

title: Cairo Describes Attacks
description: CAIRO, April 25Egyptian bombers attacked Israeli mili tary positions in the Sinai Pen insula close to the Israeli bor der last night, Cairo's military spokesman renorted today.

title: U.S. Business:
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., April 18A survey among 1,200 Pennsylvania house wives indicates an increase in the use of synthetic food products.

title: Peerless pairing
description: A pot de crme  which is, precisely as the name implies, a cream dessert served in a small pot  is one of the most elegant dishes in the French repertory. Dazzling enough by itself, when teamed with floren tines, those delicious chocolatecovered cookies, it is something for the gods. Both are easy to prepare.

title: Clergymen, Citing War and Poverty as Issues, Seek State and National Offices
description: An increasing number of clergymen are seeking national or statewide elective office this year in what appears primarily to be their growing impatience with the continued fighting in Vietnam and with the pace of antipoverty efforts.

title: Air Force Copter Pilots Will Be Trained by Army
description: WASHINGTON, April 25 (AP) Air Force helicopter pilots will take their training from the Army starting in October, the Pentagon announced this week.

title: WELFARE AGENCY TO DROP JOB PLAN
description: A ninemonthold demonstra tion project, in which welfare recipients have been trained for post office jobs, will end next Wednesday as a City Depart ment of Social Services activity to become part of the city's Manpower and Career Develop ment Agency.

title: Therapeutic Kos Gets A Touch of Overexposure
description: KOS, GreeceUntil recently, this green and flowery isle was one of the bestkept open secrets in Greece. Except for doctors who come from all over the world to see this birthplace of Hippocratesand the yachting crowd, only a handful of travelers visited Kos.

title: Government to Save $60Million Facility
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., April 25A saving of 600 jobs of workers, and the continua tion of a $60million scienti fic and research facility here have been hailed by business leaders, science spokesmen and politicians.

title: WIDER ROLE ASKED FOR U.N. COUNCIL
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., April 25A proposal to make the Security Council more ef fective for peacekeeping, by holding regular meetings at the foreignminister level, will be taken up formally by the 15 member Councir soon.

title: Mayor's Committee Investigating Police Corruption Here Meets Tomorrow to Determine Procedures
description: Mayor Lindsay's special com mittee to investigate police corruption will hold its first meeting Monday morning, Cor poration Counsel J. Lee Rankin, the committee chairman, said yesterday.

title: A Saint for All Seasons
description: SAINTS may come and saints may go, but Saint Paul is here to stay. The latest person to find inspiration in the life of the brilliant, strongwilled apostle is producer Sandy Howard, whose A Man Called Horse opens here Wednesday. Howard's new movie, Saul of Tarsus, will be written by Jack De Witt, who also did the screenplay for A Man Called Horse.

title: Letter to the Editor 2  No Title
description: ing the expansion of food and nutrition programs in the De partments of Agriculture; Health, Education, and Wel fare; and Defense; in indus try (particularly among snack food manufacturers); and in a majority of the states and territories, following the White House conference. Not only have Federal expenditures for food programs in the various departments been stepped up by approximately $1billion, but state and local appropria tions have gone up, too. We need a good compromise be tween the Senate and House versions of the school lunch bill (closer to the Senate ver sion than to the House), and a good Food Stamp Act. Much more will remain to be done, but we are making consider able progress.

title: NAVY IS WINNER IN LACROSSE, 117
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., April 25 Navy's undefeated lacrosse team took a major step toward the national championship to day by beating Virginia, 117, in NavyMarine Memorial Sta dium.

title: Pittsburgh Halts Shift of Police Pending Arbitration
description: PITTSBURGH, April 25A dispute between the city gov ernment and the Pittsburgh po lice, touched off by the transfer of four white and four black patrolmen, simmered down this week when the city and the po lice union agreed to submit the dispute to binding arbitration.

title: REFUGEE PROBLEM GROWS IN AFRICA
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, April 25 (AP)More than a million people have been up rooted from a dozen African countries, creating a refugee problem that does not appear to have any immediate solu tion.

title: Senate Panel Told Blackmun's Colleagues Back His Nomination
description: WASHINGTON, April 25 (AP) The Senate Judiciary Commit tee has been notified that Judge Harry A. Blackmun's colleagues on the United States Court of Appeals for the Eighth Circuit enthusiastically support his nomination to the Supreme Court.

title: Business Index Falls in Week
description: The New York Times Weekly Index of Business Activity fell to 348.5 from 349.6 a week earlier. A year ago it was 335.8.

title: New Rebel Shelling of Haiti Reported
description: WASHINGTON, April 25In termittent shelling of the Hai tian capital, PortauPrince, from rebel Coast Guard ships was reported to have continued early today. But there were con tradictory reports later on whether the ships were still off the city.

title: The Week in Finance:
description: ?? political and international atmosphere is still quite tense in many areason economic and social issues at home and in the Cambodian, Vietnam and Middle East situations abroad.

title: Rogers Says Soviet Flouts Its Duty on Geneva Parley
description: Secretary of State William P. Rogers accused the Soviet Union yesterday of flouting its international obligations in fail ing to help reconvene the Geneva Conference as a step toward restoring peace in Indo china.

title: NASHVILLE STARS TURN POLITICAL
description: NASHVILLE, April 25The Nashvillebased country music industry is gearing up to put one of its own star performers in the United States Senate.

title: LINCOLN CAPTURES TWO GOLD MEDALS
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 25 Joe Savage got his revenge and Lincoln of Jersey City, got two gold watches today in an excit ing schoolboy program at the Penn Relays.

title: For Young Readers
description: What's going on here? A bird is perched in a crocodile's mouth, and getting away with it. Crazy. What you see are close friends helping each other stay healthy and wellfed in a sort of goldenrule giveandtake. Thus, the crocodile, opens up, letting his pal, a plover, be his dentist. He ends up with clean, sparkling teeth, and the bird, a full tummy.

title: Jennings Dugan Plans Nuptials in September
description: BALTIMORE, April 25  Mr. and Mrs. Daniel Boone Dugan of Roland Park have aanounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Jennings Carroll Dugan, to Ewgeni Ali Oglu of Cambridge, Mass., board chairman of Compono form, Inc., a building con cern. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Nesi AliOglu of of Walpole, Mass.

title: Fake snake
description: This is the year for snakes. Women who think that rep tiles belong either in the zoo or in their natural habitats will be happy to know that fake snake looks better than ever. Minnie Cushing Beard, who divides her lime be tween New York and Kenya and is greatly concerned about preserving wild life, handles the real and wears the fake with equal aplomb. Th serpentine markings on the designs shown here are so true to nature they could (almost) fool the herpetologists.

title: A GAIN FOR CONSERVATIONISTS
description: CHEROKEE, N. C.Conser vation forces have won an impor tant round in their battle to prevent the construction of a second highway across Great Smoky Mountains National Park, and in the process they have res cued from the bulldozer some of the best terrain for family hiking in the United States.

title: The High School Revolutionaries
description: Kurt Vonnegut Jr., in his intro duction to Our Time is Now, quotes a friend who went to high school with him in Indianapolis: When you get to be our age, you all of a sudden realize that you are be ing ruled by people you went to high school with. You all of a sudden catch on that life is nothing but high school...class officers, cheerlead ers, and all. Vonnegut agrees, add ing, High school is closer to the core of American experience than anything else I can think of...Rich ard Nixon is a familiar type from high school. So is Melvin Laird... So is everybody.

title: Wiltwyck School Supporters to See Royal Ballet Performance Friday
description: Supporters of the Wilt wyck School for Boys will attend Friday's performance of the Royal Ballet at the Metropolitan Opera House before going to a champagne supper dance at El Morocco.

title: HUNT CUP TAKEN BY MORNING MAC
description: GLYNDON, Md., April 25 (AP) Morning Mac, competing in the Maryland Hunt Cup for the first time and guided by a rookie rider, won the 74th run ning today by 2 lengths.

title: The Divine Mistress
description: Not Byzantium, nor ancient Sparta would appear to be periods more remote from ours than the court of Louis XV in France. Yet in this en grossing biography, Samuel Edwards has accomplished the feat of making the time and the persons understand able, engagingly human and fascinat ing to watch in their achievements and failures. Of none of his char acters is this truer than of his heroine, Emilie du Chatelet, a woman of amazing talents and profound emo tions who, as she would today, na turally evoked the hostility and envy of her sex. Such a woman, because she attracts men, never has women friends.

title: The Boy Friend
description: THE BOY FRIEND, a re vival of Sandy Wilson's musical, entertained six out of ten reviewers, al although one had reserva tions. Clive Barnes: With a gentility so strained that it is all but ruptured, this Sandy Wilson imitation of a 1920's musical comedy takes demureness to new depths and cuteness to fresh camps. Vododeoh do!! The music neatly embraces most of the disadvantages of overfamiliar ity with few of its charms and the book is of a kind that makes people return to libraries. Vododeoh do!! Judy Carne sings and acts as if at a school con cert given by Cheltenham Ladies College, which is precisely right. Vodode ohdo!!The Boy Friend is harmless enough and some people may like it a lot. Vododeohdo!! De ohdo! Oh....

title: Letters
description: FACULTY... ADVISERS?

title: Laughing Bill Cracks Mark At Chicago and Pays $3.60
description: CHICAGO, April 25 (AP)  Laughing Bill, owned by John L. Smallman of London, Ontario, smashed Washington Park's track record for six furlongs today while winning the $10,000 Marshall Field Purse by one length.

title: Salt Lake Abolishes Spring
description: SALT LAKE CITY, April 25 (AP)The City Commission, disgruntled by recent unseason ably cold weather and an out ofseason snowstorm Wednes day, unanimously passed a reso lution officially abolishing spring. The resolution pro claimed that henceforth the winter season here shall offi cially begin on March 22 and shall extend into June and we hereby completely and officially do away with spring altogether, since mother nature has seen fit to do away with spring in our area many years ago.

title: The Week in Finance:
description: THE PERVASIVE gloom in Wall Street deepened last week as financial marketsand investor psychology took a decisive turn for the worse for no particular reason.

title: ExSheriff Convicted
description: OPELIKA, Ala., April 25 (AP)A Federal Court jury has convicted the former Lee Coun ty sheriff, Paul Ragsdale, of beating a male prisoner and has sentenced the exofficer to a oneyear prison term. The panel of 10 men and two wom en returned the verdict Thurs day following a threeday trial that ended Wednesday.

title: City Life
description: When two publishers in 1962 brought out overlapping collections of the work of the Argentine writer Jorge Luis Borges it was an impor tant event for American readers, but few could have anticipated the im pact it would have on our fiction. His work hardly fit into any tradi tional niche. The short story, even

title: The Urban Explosion Resounds in Hempstead's OnceQuiet Corners
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., April 25 A recently published history of the Town of Hempstead to commemorate its 325th anni versary contains the following introductory line:

title: Dance
description: THE dance season is gathering its spring speed, spurting toward summer with Britain's Royal Ballet making Lincoln Center into some kind of terp sichorean shrine. At times such as these even the waiters in the Lincoln Center restau rants move with a different grace.

title: ONASSIS IS URGED TO AID PRISONERS
description: PARIS, April 25Aristotle S. Onassis, the Greek shipping magnate, and other important businessmen have agreed to help in applying pressure on the Greek military Government to halt its political persecutions and release political prisoners, according to JeanJacques Ser vanSchreiber, the French writer and political leader.

title: Penelope Wick Plans a July Bridal
description: GREENWICH, Conn., April 25Mr. and Mrs. Myron Arms Wick Jr. have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Penelope Wick, to James Winston De Young, son of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Cornell De Young of Kenilworth, Ill. The wedding is planned for July.

title: F.D.A. BARS DEVICE USED IN EXERCISING
description: WASHINGTON, April 25 (UPI)The Food and Drug Ad ministration, listing a catalogue of alleged medical hazards as sociated with an exercising de vice, warned the owners of 400,000 Relaxacizors today not to use them.

title: PICTURE CREDITS
description: 1KEN HEYMAN

title: Article 15  No Title
description: The Tartan Farm president, John Nerud, and a veteran breeder, Omer (Pete) Hall, have been chosen for induction into the Nebraska Racing Hall of Fame, it was announced by the AkSarBen track's general manager, Tom Brock, chairman of the selections committee.

title: The truth about lying
description: WHEN adults speak of lying, they always give the im pression that only chil dren are guilty of it. Parents readily agree that the duty to truth is different for adults and children, but they are convinced that in practice only children fail in this duty. Adults pass judg ment without for a moment think ing that they too lie and, more frequently, create the climate in which it is impossible not to lie.

title: Barn Converted to College Quarters
description: BARNS are in vogue this year and real estate brokers say that few country residences have as much appeal as a converted hayloft. But it takes a super barn to provide proper cover for a 1,300student college.

title: Meredith Maher Is Bride on L. I.
description: ROSLYN, L. I., April 25 Miss Meredith Walsh Maher, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward I. Maher of Plan dome, was married here this afternoon to Dennis Patrick Brosnan. The Rev, Mario Costa performed the cere mony in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church.

title: Washington College Eight Is Victor Over Manhattan
description: CHESTERTON, Md., April 25 The Manhattan College eight oared crew trailed Wash ington College by two lengths today on the Chesterton River.

title: Mrs. Stephanie Johnson Is Wed To Edward C. Hall, Yachtsman
description: PALOS VERDES ES TATES, Calif., April 25The marriage of Mrs. Stephanie Johnson to Edward C. Hall, a member of the group de velopment staff of industrial operations of TRW Inc., in Los Angeles, took place here this afternoon. The cere mony was performed in the Neighborhood Community Church by the Rev. Douglas H. Gregg.

title: YALE IS DEFEATED AT 2,000 METERS
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 25 Pennsylvania, the Intercollegi ate Regatta Association's cham pion, breezed to victory over Yale today in the 44th edition of the Blackwell Cup Regatta.

title: BestInShow Prize At Wilmington Goes To a Gordon Setter
description: STANTON, Del., April 25 A 5yearold Gordon setter, Ch. Legend of Gael, C.D., owned by Mrs. Cheever Porter of New York, took the bestinshow award today among 1,742 dogs at the 29th annual Wilmington Kennel Club event.

title: Man Killed for Train Seat
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, April 25 (AP)Ubirajara de Oliveira, a 21yearold carpenter, was shot to death on a commuter train outside Rio de Janeiro today after he refused to give up his seat to a woman, the police reported. They said a man be lieved to be the woman's hus band had fired two revolver shots into the young man.

title: Trenton's Fixture Next Sunday Draws a Record Entry of 3,614
description: THE Trenton Kennel Club's fixture next Sunday has become the second of the year to exceed 3,600 entries to make this the spring of the mammoth dog shows. Chica go's International early this month had 3,657 dogs. Tren ton's list closed with 3,614, a gain of 382 over last year.

title: Pop
description: WHEN you are ticking off the major com posers who con tributed to the mu sical theater in the Twenties, Thirties and Fortiesa period which is often glibly thought of as golden but which, looking around us now, seems brilliant beyond all be liefyou quickly hit Gersh win, Rodgers and Hart, Cole Porter, Kern And then there was Vincent Youmans. And, oh, of course, Vernon Duke.

title: YOUTHFUL LEADERS RULE WEST SAMOA
description: APIA, Western Samoa, April 23The first Polynesian state to become independent in this century has replaced a tradi tionbound Government of old er men with a Cabinet of younger leaders professing ideas for the reform of a feu dalistic society.

title: Heyday of Railroading In Florida Is Recalled
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla.  The long freight train rum bled through the city, the horn of its leading diesel unit sounding a dis cordant warning at every crossing. Two blocks from the tracks, in a neat two story house where he lives in retirement, Floyd B. May listened to the sound wist fully, like a warrior sniffing battle smoke from afar.

title: In the Bluegrass Country, a Genteel Way of Life Revolves Around Horse Raising
description: LEXINGTON, Ky.  The grass is blue. Make no mistake about that. That it looks emerald green is beside the point. Let the native aristocrats have what they all call that tinge of blue this time of year. Maybe it actually was blue once.

title: Henry Sutphen Jr. Dies at 67; ExHead of American Savings
description: Henry Randolph Sutphen Jr., who retired as chairman of the board of the American Sav ings Bank a year ago, died yes terday of cancer in St. Luke's Hospital. He was 67 years old and lived at 200 East 66th Street and in East Hampton, L.I.

title: Stiff Regulation Is Proposed To Curb Sale of Unsafe Tires
description: WASHINGTON, April 25 The government is moving to break up a nationwide black market in unsafe automobile tires by promulgating a stiff new labeling and reporting reg ulation under the National Traf fic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act.

title: Offtrack Betting: A World Study
description: April 18, 1970

title: Bottles to Save Old Pierce Home
description: CONCORD, N. H., April 25 The New Hampshire Legisla ture spared the home of the nation's 14th President this week by voting to provide the final $20,000 of a $53,000 proj ect to renovate the Franklin Pierce Manse on a new site.

title: Elmira Nuptials For Mrs. Riggs
description: ELMIRA, N.Y., April 25 Mrs. Elizabeth Falck Riggs, daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Alexander D. Falck of Elmira, was married today to Roswell Roberts Hart, son of Adm. Thomas C. Hart., U.S.N., retired, and Mrs. Hart of Sharon, Conn. chairman of Corning Glass

title: Spotlight:
description: Seen any good movies late ly? That's a question many investors in the tumbling mo tion picture stocks are ask ing these days as they pon der the imponderables of the industry.

title: Barbara S. Sanderson Is Married
description: LA JOLLA, Calif., April 25  Miss Barbara Stewart Sanderson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John William San derson 2d, was married in St. JamesbytheSea Episco pal Church here today to Martin Alexander Knuning, a reporter for The Associated Press In Los Angeles.

title: Ludwig van Beethoven
description: Beethoven has become a prayer wheel for us. Spin. The Eroica. Spin. The Ninth Symphony. Spin. The Appassionata. Even the transcen dental last worksthe piano sonatas and string quartets of the final dec ade, the Missa Solemnis'no long er are the preserve of a few musical metaphysicists, as they were a cou ple of decades ago. Thanks to the implacably turning phonograph and its voracious ally, the radio, Beetho ven is flung at our ears night and day. And so, creepingly but certainly, music that we once regarded as in exhaustible is being worn out, like an ancient lucky charm, and rubbed smooth of emotional meanings. Re corded and live, the expert perform ances wash over us, eliciting what ever Pavlovian response we have been taught is proper by generations of program annotators and record jacket philosophers. And all the while, Beethoven spins in his grave, at 33 revolutions per minute. music that we once regarded as in exhaustible is being worn out, like an ancient lucky charm, and rubbed smooth of emotional meanings. Re corded and live, the expert perform ances wash over us, eliciting what ever Pavlovian response we have been taught is proper by generations of program annotators and record jacket philosophers. And all the while, Beethoven spins in his grave, at 33 revolutions per minute.

title: Great Leap Upward
description: The Chinese People's Republic and its scientists have successfully orbited their first satellite, making China the fifth member of the international space club. The Chinese feat is in the tradition of that country's brilliant history of contributions to astron omy, a science in which observations made by China's astronomers more than a thousand years ago still provide important data.

title: Many Youths Are Abandoning Psychedelic Drugs
description: SAN FRANCISCOI got bored with acid, said Bill Esson as he lounged in a back room of the Haight Ashbury Free Clinie. Like anything else, it was an ex perience, but you can only experience so much on acid. As time went on it wasn't as good for me, and like, I had other things to do.

title: Jonathan Logan And Robin Gans Marry in Jersey
description: LOCUST, N. J., April 25 Miss Robin Adair Gans, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James Howard Gans, was married in All Saints Me morial Episcopal Church here this afternoon to Jonathan Michael Logan. The cere mony was performed by the Rev. Harry Sorenson.

title: 2,200YearOld Inscription Suggests Jewish Monastics Drew Inspiration From the Ideas of Buddhism
description: PARIS, April 25  A 2,200 yearold inscription found be side what was once a great highway through Afghanistan is being viewed as support for an exotic theory that pre Christian Jewish monastics were inspired by Buddhist ideas.

title: Marriages
description: COHANWISHBOWDr. Samuel R. Cohan and Rochelle Wishbow (formerly Mrs. Gabriel Wishbow) announce their marriage on March 22, 1970.

title: Film Preview Curb Signed
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., April 25 (UPI)Gov. Raymond P. Shafer signed legislation yesterday making it illegal for theater operators to show previews of adultrated films when the theater's main program is a movie for general audiences. A $1,000 fine was established for the first offense; a twoyear prison term and a $2,000 fine are the maximum penalties for subsequent offenses. The meas ure takes effect in 60 days.

title: Ritchey Captures Long Island Y. R. A. Frostbite Crown
description: SOUTHPORT, Conn., April 25  John B. Ritchey of the Norwalk Yacht Club won the annual frostbite championship of the Long Island Sound Yacht Racing Association today. He built a commanding lead early in the 10race regatta.

title: Students Hear Space Music
description: KETTERING, England, April 25 (Reuters)School children said today that they had picked up signals from China's first satellite. The signals were com puterstyle puuretone music and lasted for 10 minutes, ac cording to the students. The ??sinhua press agency said the satellite music was entitled The East Is Red.

title: SPENCER QUALIFIES FOR VIRGINIA RACE
description: MARTINSVILLE, Va., April 25 (AP)G.C. Spencer of Jones boro, Tenn., won a 20lap quali fying race today that com pleted the 40car field for the Virginia 500 stock car race scheduled tomorrow.

title: To Describe Aruba One No Longer Says Very Quiet
description: ORANJESTAD, Aruba, N.W.I.We first found Aruba years ago, and loved the native Dutch ambi ance and the lineup of canopied Venezuelan boats on which cargoes of mangoes, papayas and bananas were sold. Day after day, cloudless and hot, spent on miles of soft beaches.

title: CORNELL SHELL WINS GOES TROPHY RACE
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., April 25 Cornell left its stake boat at a slower beat than Navy and Syracuse, but finished with the fastest time today and won the Goes Trophy regatta.

title: Trade Battle to Break Out Anew
description: A battle over trade policies, one of the oldest recurrent issues in the Congress, is about to break out in a new form.

title: QUEBEC TURMOIL MIRRORED BY CITY
description: HULL, Quebec, April 25All the contradictions and confu sions of a political campaign in which Quebec separation has become the dominant issue are present in Hull, a small city usually thought of as the civil service dormitory for the fed eral capital across the Ottawa river.

title: Point of View:
description: The following article was written by Leonard M. Savoie, executive vice president of the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants.

title: Wedding Planned By Diane Stanley
description: Miss Diane Stanley, a mas ter's degree candidate at Johns Hopkins University, plans to be married in May to Peter John Zuromskis, who is completing his medi cal studies there.

title: Fear Grows in Seattle as Police Urge F.B.I. Help on Bombings
description: SEATTLE, April 25At night the fear that hangs over this city is hidden somewhere in the gloom of the cold and the rain.

title: Priest Is Named to Agency
description: BOSTON, April 25 (AP) Gov. Francis W. Sargent has named a Roman Catholic priest to the sevenmember board of the Massachusetts Port Au thority. After his appointment Tuesday, the Rev. Albert J. Sallese of East Boston said, I will be the voice of thousands of small people affected by the Port Authority.

title: Sweet Medicine
description: The level of scholarship has been rising for some time in the field of Indian studies. Par ticularly important in this happy development has been the Civilization of the Ameri can Indian Series published by the University of Oklahoma Press. To celebrate their first 100 volumes they have chosen Sweet Medicine by Peter J. Powell. It was a significant choice, for this twovolume set is certainly one of the most important works they have published in their series.

title: Policeman Is Accused Of Falsifying Records
description: LONG BRANCH, N. J., April 25 (AP)A policeman whose testimony helped convict a re puted Mafioso, Anthony (Little Pussy) Russo, of perjury has been suspended for allegedly falsifying Civil Service records.

title: Sturgeon Is Valuable
description: MOSCOW (AP)  Three hundred pounds of caviar was the yield from a 1,760pound sturgeon netted by Volga River boatmen.

title: Clocks Set Ahead For Daylight Time
description: Daylight saving timewith clocks set ahead one hour went into effect at 2 A.M. today in 47 of the 50 states.

title: Valhalla Captures Two Events In Boulder Brook Horse Show
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., April 25 Valhalla returned to the ring today at the Boulder Brook Horse Show after an absence of 17 months and the start of his long road back was a trium phant one.

title: Benefits
description: Tickets for the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless other wise indicated:

title: The Threat to Liberty
description: Each morning in schools throughout this land, mil lions of children pledge their allegiance to a nation indivisible with liberty and justice for all. This daily ritual is beginning to lose all meaning as America's fundamental principles of freedom are being under mined. Civil liberties, though indispensable to the goal of the open American society, have suffered periodic setbacks in the past, both under Democratic and Republican Administrations. But there is cause for the gravest concern over the currently evolving pattern of overt and subtle policies which tear at the fabric of a free, pluralistic society.

title: Tower of Texas Is Small in the Saddle, But...
description: WASHINGTON.THE closest friends and advisers of Senator John Tower cannot talk about him without at some point in the conversation using expressions like a strange man and a real enigma. A tough guy but a some, they sayjust like on The Late, Late Show; he wouldn't have minded wiping out Russia with some preventive extermination back in the good old days when only the U.S. had the Abomb, but he also has been said to weep over a constituent's hardluck story.

title: Citizens Asked to Call With Police Information
description: Mayor Lindsay has asked citizens with information about police corruption here to call 2676000, the main number for the city's Depart ment of Investigation. The phones will be manned from 8 A.M. to midnight.

title: Reader's Report
description: Be Not Content

title: Bradenton Cabs to Shun Black Area After Dark
description: BRADENTON, Fla., April 25 (AP)Whiteowned taxis will not enter black neigh borhoods after dark in this Gulf Coast city, a new policy that cab companies say is an attempt to stop robberies and attacks on drivers.

title: Professionals in Crime
description: Next Friday evening, the most in genious criminal minds in the country will foregather in the Grand Ball room of the Hotel Biltmore to honor each other's inventiveness and to par take of such respectable dubious pleasures as too much Scotch and banquet chicken. The occasion is the annual Edgar Awards Dinner of the Mystery Writers of America (motto: Crime Does Not Pay Enough), an organization of 650 members scat tered around the world.

title: QUILCHE SETS MARK IN COAST TURF RACE
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., April 25 (UPI)Chileanbred Quilche led every step of the way and then had enough left at the finish to hold off Fort Marcy by a nose as he captured the third run ning of the $80,500 Century Handicap today over Hollywood Park's turf course.

title: PORSCHE IS FIRST IN RACE AT MONZA
description: MONZA, Italy, April 25The Mexican Finnish team of Pedro Rodriguez and Lee Kinnunen kept a GulfPorsche in front of three Ferraris for the final 298 miles today and won the 1,000 kilometer Monza auto race.

title: Pollution Fight ByProduct: A New Recreational Area
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla.Early visitors to northern Florida, so the story goes, used to ask, How far south does the St. Johns River go? and the natives answered, All the way to hell and blazes. There's a Lake Helen Blazes close to the river's source.

title: U.S. Textile Makers See Profits Shrink; Japanese Worried
description: The textile industry is hurt ingproduction in the first quarter declined substantial ly compared with volume for the 1969 quarter and pros pects for improvement in the immediate future are not too good.

title: Article 20  No Title
description: Questions of literary interest should be addressed: Queries Editor, The New York Times Book Review, Times Square, New York, N. Y. 10036, and accompanied by a stamped, selfaddressed envelope. The editor will publish those of greatest interest. Others are answered by letter.

title: Rules for Raspberries
description: RASPBERRIES are the home garden fruit for July. Autumn  fruiting varieties fruit in July, and again from late August until frost. Since the com mercial raspberry industry has gone in the East, those who would have this delicious fruit must grow their own.

title: A Cautionary Tale: Next Time We'll Have Reservations
description: SEVILLE, SpainThat dream of an impromptu little side trip can be the highlight of an entire European tour, if all goes right. On the other hand, take the little sortie that my wife and I made to Seville recently. And if you do, you'll wish you had never left home.

title: Spring Gardens
Hunt for Presidents Chief Topic of College Officials
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 25 The small, pink card that was fastened onto his lapel iden tified him as William E. Turn age, a trustee of William Jewell College in Liberty, Mo.

title: GROUP IN VILLAGE TO FUND TINY PARK
description: A group of Greenwich Village residents have joined in a proj ect to create a 2,500square foot vestpocket park in Village Square, at the intersection of Christopher Street, the Avenue of the Americas and Greenwich Avenue.

title: Architecture
description: Architecture

title: Gamblers' Links to Police Lead to Virtual Licensing
description: New York gamblers maintain an intimate and financially re warding relationship with many policemen that at times perverts law enforcement into a system of licensing the city's vast gambling industry, according to some police sources.

title: Klein Charges News Media Underreport Silent People
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, April 25 (AP)Herbert G. Klein, com munications director for Presi dent Nixon, said today that a major shortcoming of the news media was underreporting of the silent majority.

title: Article 12  No Title
Justice Aid to Two States
description: WASHINGTON, April 25 (AP) The Law Enforcement Assist ance Administration approved grants this week to help Geor gia and Iowa finance improve ments in their criminal justice systems.

title: N.B.C. Employes in 6 Cities Reject New Wage Increase
description: WASHINGTON, April 25A union representing 1,400 em ployes of the National Broad casting Company in New York and five other cities has voted to reject a wage increase offered in a new threeyear con tract.

title: Conservation Funds Aiding Owners
description: RURAL landowners who want to plant some extra pine trees or carve ponds out of backyard streams can make such im provements with the helping hand of several Federal and state agencies.

title: Chess
description: THERE is always turmoil on the chess scene. Tricks and traps and ceiling wax and cabbages and kings, paraphrase the action. In novations, forays and combinations lead to fascinating denouements and some times to plain and effective checkmates.

title: Maureen Miller Plans Nuptials To Michael S. Grace on July 25
description: SOUTH LAGUNA, Calif., April 25  Mr. and Mrs. Bruce H. Sage have an nounced the engagement of Mrs. Sage's daughter, Miss Maureen Miller, to Michael Stephen Grace. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. J. Peter Grace of Manhasset, L. I., and a greatgrandson of Wil liam Russell Grace, founder of W. R. Grace & Co., and twice Mayor of New York. His father is president of the international industrial con cern with chemical, consum er products and petroleum interests.

title: Peter Ten Eyck Of NASA Weds Arlene B. Rome
description: EAST PROVIDENCE, R. I., April 25 Miss Arlene B. Rome and Dr. Peter Hoyos Ten Eyck were married here this morning. Chaplain Frank Hall of the Veterans Admin istration Hospital performed the interdenominational cere mony at the home of the bride's father, David Rome.

title: New and Recommended
description: THE BAY OF NOON, by Shirley Hazzard. Very simply, a story of two men and two women whose mixed cultural backgrounds dissolve in the retort of Naplesto recombine in new dualities.

title: LIBERAL MONTHLY IS STARTED HERE
description: The New Democrat, a month ly magazine dedicated to unit ing the left and radical wings of the Democratic party, has been started here by a small group of former supporters of Robert F. Kennedy and Eugene J. McCarthy.

title: EVANS CAPTURES 2 COAST EVENTS
description: WALNUT, Calif., April 25 (AP)  Lee Evans, the world recordholder and Olympic champion at 400 meters scored an unusual double today at the 12th annual Mount San An tonio Relays. He shared the honors with CM Cheng of For mosa and Los Angeles, who bettered two American records.

title: Niagara Rehires Layden
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N. Y., April 25 (AP)  Frank Layden, who coached Niagara University's, basketball team to a 227 won lost record last season, signed a new fiveyear contract today.

title: DRUGUSE THEORY CONTESTED ON L.I.
description: BALDWIN, L. I., April 25 The director of the mental health clinic of the Nassau County Family Court spoke out this week against the myth that suburban children were experimenting with drugs and that youngsters from good, middle class homes were going wrong.

title: FOE FIRES ROCKETS AT HIGHLAND CAMP
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 25 (UPI)  Enemy troops fired rockets into a Government artil lery base near the besieged Spe cial Forces outpost at Dakseang in one of 41 shelling attacks yesterday and today.

title: GRANTS AID STUDY OF ENVIRONMENT
description: The implementation of teach ing programs aimed at making use of the immediate surround ing environment of public schools as a source of materials for learning was announced yesterday by the Ford Founda tion.

title: Miss Whiting Plans Nuptials
description: DEDHAM, Mass., April 25 Mr. and Mrs. Frederick Klemm Whiting have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Pamela Regis Whiting, to Mayo Ca bell Jr., son of Mr. Cabell of Staunton, Va., and the late Mrs. Cabell.

title: Omaha Power Equipment Is on 1,300Mile Trip
description: A bargeload bearing the main elements of nuclear muscle for a 460megawatt steam power plant for Omaha, Neb., is in the final stage of a 1,300mile river journey from Chattanooga. It is scheduled to arrive Wednesday.

title: STIFF DRUG TERMS BACKED IN A POLL
description: PRINCETON, N. J., April 25 A large majority of Ameri cans think that persons con victed of selling heroin should be given stiff sentences, ac cording to the Gallup Poll.

title: CAPS TOP ROCKETS TO TIE SERIES, 33
description: WASHINGTON, April 25 (AP) Rick Barry scored 40 points tonight as the Washington Caps edged the Denver Rockets, 116 111, and evened their Western Division playoff series in the American Basketball Associa tion.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Aaron Marc Stein's 80 mys tery novels have appeared un der his own name and that of the pseudonymous George Bag by since the 1930'sand as by Hampton Stone since the 1940's. As Bagby, he has been chron icling the cases of New York's Inspector Schmidt since 1935's Murder at the Piano. As Stein, he provided a long series, terminating in the 1950's, about American archeologists Tim Mul ligan and Elsie Mae Hunt. Hav ing apparently decided that the MulliganHunt possibilities were exhausted, he turned to the globetrotting adventures of an other American technical ex pert, engineer Matt Erridge. It's been a while since Erridge did any engineering, however, and in ALP MURDER (Doubleday, $4.50) stumbling into other peo ple's violence seems more his bag.

title: An Addict in the Family
description: What do you do when the doorbell rings at 3 A.M. and you answer to find your 16 yearold daughter brought home from a neighborhood party, cry ing, sobbing and screaming, high on a trip from LSD? What do you do when you happen upon a package of marijuana cigarettes hidden in your 12 yearold's bureau drawer? What do you do when you find the medicine dropper, hypodermic needle and heating spoon hid den behind your adolescent's fishing gear?

title: YANKS BOW, 3 TO 0, AND DROP TO LAST
PRINCETON DEFEATS PENN LIGHTWEIGHTS
description: PRINCETON, N. J., April 25 Princeton's lightweight crew defeated the University of Penn sylvania lightweights today by two lengths to capture the WoodHammond Cup and re main unbeaten in five races this season.

title: Scientific American Resource Library
description: This is a time of mounting discontent and bitterness among American scientists. Yesterday's fertilizing flood of Government research grants has receded sharply. Left behind is such debris as projects halted in midinvestigation, laborator ies that cannot afford to op erate all their expensive equip ment, and Ph.D.'s in physics and other fields dazed to find they are unemployed after hav ing heard all their lives that the United States had an ur gent demand for the skills they had spent so, many years and so much painful effort to ac quire.

title: Napoleon Diadem Sold At Auction in Geneva
description: GENEVA, April 25A dia dem that Napoleon is said to have given to his sister, Prin cess Pauline, was among the jewels auctioned here this week by Christies of London.

title: Sarah W. Cook Plans Nuptials
description: OLD GREENWICH, Conn., April 25  Miss Sarah Wis ner Cook and Michael Kent Longacre, who met at the Skowhegan School of Paint ing and Sculpture in Maine, will be married here on May 23.

title: Marriage Announcement 1  No Title
description: Anniversaries Births Engagements Marriages

title: 40% of Lawrence, Kan., Police Threaten to Resign by Friday
description: LAWRENCE, Kan., April 25 (UPI)More than 40 per cent of the Lawrence police force threatened today to resign after is week of violence in the col lege town.

title: Gustave I. Jahr, a Lawyer Active in German Groups
description: Gustave I. Jahr, a Vienna born lawyer who was active in GermanAmerican organiza tions, died Wednesday, appar ently of a heart attack, while trying a case in Surrogate Court in New York County. He was 71 years old and lived at 500 East 77th Street. His office was at 770 Lexington Avenue.

title: Gig Finally Made It, Didn't He?
description: HOLLYWOOD It was Gig Young's intention to spend most of Wednesday, April 8, in the dentist's chair, dredging root canals. At 10 A.M. Wednesday morning he canceled his appointment, took two sleeping pills supplied by a friend, and fell asleepthe Oscar he had won 14 hours before by the side of his bed.

title: McCarthy Says He Will Win Primary
description: Representative Richard D. McCarthy said in a recent in terview that he firmly believed he could fight the system and win the Democratic nom ination for the United States Senate in the June 23 primary.

title: Hofstra 93 Lacrosse Victor
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., April 25  Steve Dauses, with five goals, paced the Hofstra la crosse team to a 93 victory over Air Force tonight. Air Force led, 21, after one quar ter, but goals by Rusty Hoehn and Dauses put Hofstra ahead to stay in the second period.

title: New For the Home
description: TO help store items neat ly inside a closet where they can be easily seen, yet kept free of dust and soil, the plastic stor age units shown at right can be stacked up on floors or shelves. Available in pink, blue, gold and sandalwood, each boxlike unit has a trans parent liftup door as shown. It measures 18 by 12 by 6 inches. Closet Organ izer, $8. (Amoco Chemicals Corporation, 214 Third Ave nue, Waltham, Mass. 02154)

title: Seoul Hints It Might Give Aid to Pnompenh If Asked
description: SEOUL, South Korea April 25 South Korea expressed deep concern about the Cambodian situation today and hinted that it would consider extending military or nonmilitary assist ance to Cambodia if reauested.

title: The Studhorse Man
description: Horny books abound, but few of them are about horses. This one is, being principally an ac count of how Hazard Lepage, the last of the studhorse men, takes a perfect, blue, virgin stallion called Poseidon across Alberta in search of a perfect mare. Hazard's fiance, Martha Proudfoot, waits at home, a wo man of blatant mammary pro portions and just too full of the life force to take easily, or at all, to the role of homebody. Refusing to marry Hazard until he sheds his obsession with the perfect foal, she's no more use to him than the Arab mares she keeps are to his stallion. Such are Robert Kroetsch's per verse premises in this, his first novel published in the United States.

title: Rep. Biaggi Urges Inquiry Into Deaths of 3 Soldiers
description: A' fullscale investigation of the deaths of three soldiers whose bodies were found in waters near Fort Eustis, Va., last spring, was urged yester day by Representative Mario Biaggi.

title: FOUL CLAIM FAILS
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., April 25 My Dad George and Terlago waged a stirring stretch duel in the sevenfurlong Stepping Stone Purse today, with My Dad George, racing in the silks of Raymond Curtis, beating his rival, owned by Sam Agnew, by a neck.

title: DOBSON IS VICTOR
description: If the Yankees go on to win the Eastern Division title in the American League, they can al ways say that they were in last place on the morning of April 26.

title: Art Can Go On Spawning New Art Ad Infinitum
description: NEW exhibitions can of fer a neater, more ef fective contrast of es thetic ends and means than the current shows of Mary Bauermeister at the Galeria Bonino, 7 West 57th Street, and the doubleexhibi tion of Don Judd's work now on view at both the Castelli Gallery, 4 East 77th St., and the Castelli Warehouse at 103 West 108th Street. Both artists are objectmakers rather than sculptors in the conventional sense: Miss Bauermeister for lack of any better term one might apply to her constructions of wood, metal, glass, glass lenses, found  objects, made  ob jects and occasional pieces of furniture; Mr. Juddwith his nononsense, cleansided, fac toryproduced boxlike forms in the minimalist vein  by ideological preference.

title: 3 Diplomats and Attache to Join U. S. Mission Staff in Cambodia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, April 25The 12man United States Embassy here will soon be aug mented by a second military attach and at least three other diplomats, the charg d'affaires, Lloyd M. Rives said today.

title: Russians Mark Easter
description: MOSCOW, April 25 (UPI) Thousands of Russians thronged the capital's 40odd churches today to celebrate the Russian Orthodox Easter.

title: SOVIET LIFTERS SET FIVE WORLD MARKS
description: MOSCOW, April 25 (AP) World records were broken in wholesale bunches today at the Soviet weightlifting champion ships at Vilnius, according to Tess, the Soviet press agency.

title: A DISMISSAL SPURS EPISCOPAL DISCORD
description: A decision by the Episcopal Church to dismiss its director of LatinAmerican missions be cause of a budgetary crisis has been denounced as politi cally inspired by a number of Puerto Rican groups, clergy men and denominational exec utives.

title: Who's Going to Save the Mermaid?
description: TWO weeks ago I con cluded a favorable re view of Francois Truf faut's The Mississip pi Mermaid with the zom ment that although I liked the film, I suspected that United Artists, the diztribu tor, did not, since they had opened the film with all of the care and fanfare that might be accorded the closing of a supermarket. Among other things, they had opened the film on a Friday, with the result that the reviews ran in the Saturday papers, which are generally thought to be read only by invalids, eccentrics and men waiting their turns at barber shops. The theater chosen for this American premiere engage ment was the 72d Street Playhouse, a perfectly decent theater but one whose loca tion on the Upper East Side makes it a kind of Siberia for any firstrun film.

title: Failure of Key Housing Bill Hinders City Reforms
description: The failure of a key housing bill to pass the State Assembly last week has presented the Lindsay administration with a political problem as attempts are made to revise the city's 27yearold rentcontrol law.

title: RIGHTS CHIEF PLANS PARLEY IN CAROLINA
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., April 25 Jerris Leonard, Assistant Attor ney General for Civil Rights, and two other Federal officials will meet here Tuesday to dis cuss school desegregation prob lems with South Carolina state and local officials.

title: Miss Cynthia Russell Affianced To Herbert Shultz Jr., a Banker
description: RUMSON, N. J., April 25 Mr. and Mrs. John Burnett Russell Jr. of Rumson and Oliverea, N.Y., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Cynthia Russell, to Herbert Lloyd Shultz Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Shultz of Kingston, N. Y., and Oliverea. A wed ding in August is planned.

title: LAND PROJECT SET IN PITTSBURGH AREA
description: PITTSBURGH, April 25  A land development project de scribed by its backers as the largest of its kind in this city's history was announced today.

title: Thant Returns From Europe
description: Secretary General Thant re turned yesterday from a trip to Vienna and a stop in Brus sels, where he conferred with the Belgian Foreign Minister, Pierre flannel.

title: Explosion Breaks Windows At El Al Office in Istanbul
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, April 25 (Reuters)The office of El Al Israel Airlines was struck by an explosion early this morning, and one of two policemen on, guard outside was slightly in jured.

title: N.Y.A.C. OARSMEN WIN 3D STRAIGHT
description: PELHAM, N. Y., April 25 The New York Athletic Club's senior eightoared shell scored its third straight triumph of the season, beating Atlantic Community College of May's Landing, N. J., today on the Orchard Beach Lagoon.

title: Article 10  No Title
description: MARKET RESEARCHERS with

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Return Book After 48 Years
description: ATLANTA, April 15 (AP)A book checked out in 1922 was among more than 5,000 overdue books returned to the Atlanta public library during a fourday moratorium on fines, The book, Three Soldiers, by John Dos Passos, was last checked out of the library on March 3, 1922, to a person whose name was long ago stricken from the rec ords.

title: High Court Will Decide Capital Punishment Case
description: WASHINGTON, April 23 (UPI)The Supreme Court will hear arguments May 4 in a capital punishment case that could affect the sentences of some 500 inmates now awaiting execution on death rows in the United States.

title: Annual Earth Day Urged
description: WASHINGTON, April 25 (AP) Legislation to make Earth Day an annual day of observ ance was introduced Thursday by Representative Danta Fascell, Democrat of Florida. His meas ure, in the form of a joint reso lution, would authorize the President to proclaim the third Wednesday of each April as Earth Day.

title: China Lobby, Once Powerful Factor in U. S. Politics, Appears Victim of Lack of Interest
