description: BEFORE the game, in a small Italian restaurant on Hempstead Turnpike, Lou Carnesecca, the general manager and future coach, watched his small hands chase each other over the table top and said We're the Young Rascals. The team of the Seventies. He was very nervous and did not eat. He had prospects coming, he said, some of them rather tall, and it was not going to be that easy to convince them that the New York Nets of the American Basketball Association should be compared with the Mets and the Jets of a few years ago, ripe groves opportunity for the young of America.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: April 30, 1970

title: JEROME KAHN
description: Jerome Kahn, vice president and a director of B. Altman & Co., died yesterday at Flower and Fifth Avenue Hospitals. He was 64 years old and lived at 220 Madison Avenue and at Pound Ridee. N. Y.

title: DISPUTE IS LOOMING AT MILWAUKEE ROAD
description: The Chicago, Milwaukee, St. Paul & Pacific Railroad dis closed yesterday that Joseph D. Shane, a Los Angeles busi nessman and investor, had no tified the railroad that he in tends to seek representation on the carrier's board at the May 12 annual meeting. Mr. Shane is the owner of a block of Milwaukee Road preferred shares.

title: TWO ARRESTED HERE IN PLANE INCIDENTS
description: Two men were arrested yes terday after one allegedly struck a stewardess and the other had walked about naked during an Eastern Airlines flight from San Juan, P. R., to Kennedy Inter national Airport.

title: For Actresses, It's Everyday Makeup That's Difficult
description: WHY would an actress who can put on a complicated stage makeup in 10 minutes flat want to attend a class in using rouge or eyeshadow?

title: WCBS and WNBC EachWin2Emmys For Local Shows
description: WNBCTV, Channel 4, and WCBSTV, Channel 2, won two Emmys each last evening from the National Academy of Tele vision Arts and Sciences for llocal programs broadcast last year. WABCTV, Channel 7, re ceived one Emmy. The awards were made at Sardi's Restau rant on West 44th Street.

title: 3 SEASONED GOLFERS GAIN AT PINEHURST
AUSSIE GIRL BEATS ROSEMARY CASAIS
description: Bournemoutn, htlglarici, April 29 (UPI)Evonrie Goolagong, the 18yearold Australian aborigine girl, scored her big gest etnnis triumph today by beating Rosemary Casals of San Francisco 62, 63, in the third round of the $36,000 British hardcourt open championship.

title: Escalation in Indochina
description: President Nixon, who was elected on a pledge to bring peace in Vietnam,. has instead escalated the war into Cambodia in a rash move that has the gravest implications for the United States.

title: MAINE PROJECTS A POLLUTION PLAN
description: AUGUSTA, Me., April 18 Gay. Kenneth M. Curtis has announced a twoyear water pollution abatement program that will cost $60million and take care of more than a third of the municipal water pollu tinn in Maine

title: Joseph S. Parker, Director In Broadcasting and Films
description: TEMPE, Ariz., April 29  Joseph S. Parker, a writer and a director in the fields of ra dio, motion pictures and tele kion until his retirement five years ago, died yesterday of heart, attack in his home here. was 57 years old.

title: Treasury Offers 3 Issues In Refinancing Operation
description: WASHINGTON, April 29  The Treasury announced today a threepart financing operation to refund $16.6billion of ma turing securities  $4.9billion of them held by the public and $11.7billion by Governmentl agencies  and to raise some cash besides.

title: From Astronaut, a Call For Joint Step in Space
description: Col. Frank Borman, the astronaut, suggested here yesterday that the United States and the Soviet Union agree to an exchange of space engineers as a first step to cooperation in space exploration.

title: Youths Hold Swingathon
description: HAVANT. England (UPI)  Twentyfive teenagers swung on swings for 72 hours non sotp to raise 100 ($240) for charity.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: No Title

title: Kosygin Endorses Parley Of Lefists in Indochina
description: MOSCOW, April 29 (Reuters) Premier Aleksein Kosygin today endorsed the conference last weekend in which the North Vietnamese, the Viet cong, the Pathet Lao and the deposed Cambodian Chief of State, Prince Norodom Sihan ouk closed ranks.

title: Music Violin Virtuoso
description: CURLING hair down to shoulders, looking like a romantic refugee from the 19th century, Aaron Rosand played the way he looked last night in Carnegie Hall. He is one of the romantic violinists supreme, a tremendous virtu oso with extraordinary con trol over bow and finger; and, with the very competent as sistance of Eileen Flissler at the piano, he gave a recital that was perfect within its framework.

title: Mayor Says He Opposes Intervention in Cambodia
description: Mayor John V. Lindsay ex pressed concern yesterday that the Nixon Administration would expand the Vietnam war into Cambodia

title: Gateway to New York
description: The proposed Gateway National Recreation Area would make available to fifteen million people a series of magnificent beaches and oceanfront parks. While we do not necessarily endorse all details of the pro posal, it is a noble concept; but,. as a recent story this newspaper indicated, it has made disappointingly little progress since it was first announced almost year ago.

title: DEMOCRATS ASSAIL NIXON'S PRIORITIES
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 (AP) Democrats accused the Nix on Administration today of distorted priorities that they said had shortchanged educa tion, health care, the fight against crime and other pro grams.

title: Old Days in West Revive in Memoirs Of Texas Trapper
description: LUBBOCK, Tex. (UPI)One oof the last of a hardy breed, a professional trapper, has re lated and recorded many of his memories for the Southwest Collection at Texas Tech Uni versity.

title: Kennedy Statement Rejects Findings as Not Justified
description: WASHINGTON, April 29  Senator Edward M. Kennedy rejected as not justified today a Massachusetts judge's report that the Senator may have driv en negligently and contributed to the death of Mary Jo Ko pechne at Chappaquiddick Is land last July.

title: Nixon Welfare Plan Attacked in Senate by Both Liberals and Conservatives
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 President Nixon's welfare re form bill was caught in a cross fire of criticism from liberals and conservatives today as the Senate began consideration of the controversial income main tenance plan.

title: 14 Suspended at Hofstra
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., April 29  Fourteen students at Hofstra University were suspended to day when they refused to leave the University Club, a dining place for faculty members and administrative personnel.

title: Roundup Siebert Victor But Bout Is Called Draw
description: They had another fight in Boston last night, and Derek Sanderson wasn't even in volved.

title: WHITE JURY CHOSEN IN JERSEY RIOT CASE
Same Fall, Same Break
description: JANESVILLE, Wis. (UPI)  Bonnie Hill, 8 years old, and Claudia Wurtz, 12, riding a horse, fell off and fractured identical bones M their left arms.

title: Boy Playing With Dynamite Brings Police on the Walk
description: MIAMI (AP)A 12yearnld boy fished a box of dynamite out of a canal behind his par ents apartment here.

title: Indonesia Asks Nations To Parley on Cambodia
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, April 29 (Reuters)Indonesia has invited North Vietnam and 19 other Asian and Pacific coun tries to a conference on Cam bodia to be held next month.

title: CATHOLIC CHURCH WARNS RHODESIA
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, April 29A rebellion by Christian churches in Rhodesia against the country's new Land Tenure Act was taken a step further today when the Roman Catho lic Bishops presented an ulti matum to the Government.

title: B. A. Huberman to Wed Caryn Yacowitz
description: PISCATAWAY, N. J., April 29  Dr. Harold Yacowitz, head of heart disease re search Institute at Fairleigh Dickinson University, and Mrs. Yacowitz have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Caryn Renee Yacowitz, to Bernardo Abel Huberman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leon Huberman of Buenos Aires. A September wedding is planned.

title: MARRIAGE SHIFTS ASSESSED IN ROME
description: ROME, April 29  Experts on canon law and ecumenists of various faiths said today that the Roman Catholic regulations on mixed marriage made pub lic in Washington yesterday were conciliatory in form but rather conservative in sub stance.

title: SAXON INDUSTRIES PLANS TO MERGE
description: The managements or Saxon Industries, Inc., and the Stand ard Packaging Corporation an nounced yesterday they had reached an agreement in prin ciple for Saxon to acquire Standard Packaging.

title: Hrs. Edward Carter, 87 Dies; Directed Relief in World War.
description: Mrs. Alice Draper Carter, who gave four decades to pub lic service, died Wednesday at her home here. She was 87 years old.

title: Ruling Barring Penalties In Air Dispute Appealed
description: The Justice Department filed an appeal in Denver yesterday to reverse one of several Fed eral court decisions that have blocked Government efforts to discipline air traffic controllers who participated in the recent sickcall slowdown.

title: CAPITAL PARLEY
description: WASHINGTON, April 29  Leaders of major organizations in the securities industry met today with the top economic policymakers of the Nixon Ad ministration and each side re assured the other that things were under control.

title: Vietcong Official in Paris Assails Step on Cambodia
description: PARIS, April 29 (Reuters) A Vietcong spokesman tonight dem.unced the military opera tions on Cambodian territory by South Vietnamese troops and American advisers.

title: A. S. P. C. A. Plans Gala for May
description: The 20th annual Animal Kingdom Ball has been ar ranged for May 7 at the St. RegisSheraton Roof. The event, being held during Be Kind to Animals Week, will benefit the adoption care pro gram of the American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals.

title: Bridge:
description: THE American Contract Bridge League announced yesterday that its next exec utive secretary would be Richard Goldberg of Stam ford, Conn. He has been as sistant to the last two hold ers of the league's chief ad ministrative positionAlvin Landy, who died in 1968, and Easley Blackwood, who is to retire early next year.

title: By VINCENT CAISIBY
description: By VINCENT CAISIBY

title: Cambodians Report Loss of a Key Plantation Town
description: KOMPONG CHAM, Cambo dia, April 29Authoritative official sources here reported today that the important rub ber plantation town of Memot, least of this provincial and mili tary region capital, fell to the North Vietnamese and Vietcong invaders yesterday after three days of encirclement.

title: Officer's Condition Serious
description: A 33yearold patrolman mugged early Monday outside a Brooklyn service station was reported yesterday to be in serious condition at Kings County Hospital, but he was said to be alert, taking nour ishment and no longer in need of fourther transfusions. The policeman, Howard Glassman, received a compound skull fracture and multiple lacera tions when he was attacked while off duty by three men armed with a carving knife, machete and a hunting knife. Patrolman Glassman managed to shoot two of his alleged assailants and all three were captured by the police.

title: SAIGON COURT BARS MILITARY TRIBUNAL
description: Saigon, South Vietnam, April 29  In a surprising victory for more than 32,000 striking students in the city, the South Vietnamese Supreme Court ruled tonight that t 1962 Government decree that established a special military tribunal was unconstitutional.

title: 7 Shot, Guard Called In Ohio State U. Riot
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Thursday, April 30Seven persons were injured, one of them seriously, by shotgun pellets, as student rioting disrupted the Ohio State University campus yesterday. Gov. James A. Rhodes ordered 1,500 National Guardsmen onto the campus.

title: Venture Capital Fund Set By New Court Securities
description: mile New court Securities Corporation, an investment concern here sponsored by the Rothschild and Pierson banking interests of Europe, announced yesterday the formation of a venture capital fund to which institutional investors have subscribed $51.5million.

title: Excerpts From the Testimony of Senator Kennedy at Inquest Into Kopechne Death
description: BOSTON, April 29Follow lowing are excerpts from the testimony of Senator Edward M. Kennedy at the inquest into the death of Mary Jo Kopechne on the night of July 1819, 1969, at Chap paquiddick Island, Martha's Vineyard. Mass.

title: Research Emergency
description: The critical decline of Federal support for research disastrous on two levels it undermines the fiscal health of the nation's universities at a time of spiral ing costs and dangerous deficits; and it threatens to retard American intellectual, scientific and technolog cal progress for decades to come. When so seasoned expert as Dr. James R. Killian Jr. can say flatly bat the universities financial outlook has not been to bleak in thirty years, there is urgent need to review basic police.

title: Federal Ban Now Is Urged On Controversial Herbicide
description: WASHINGTON, April 29  The Secretary of Agriculture, Clifford M. Hardin, was peti tioned today to act immediate ly in banning all forms of the controversial herbicde

title: Jude Gets Jury Notice
description: MADISON, Wis. (AP)Rich ard W. Bardwell, Dane County Circuit Court Judge, received a notice to report for jury duty in Federal court. A check of the law books showed that lawyers were exempt, but the status of judges as jurors appeared un clear.

title: Administration Split on Alaska Bid to Build Link to Pipeline
description: WASHINGTON, April 29  A split has developed within the Administration over whe ther Alaska should be encour aged to take the rightofway for a 390mile road front the Yukon River to the Arctic North Slope and proceed with its constieution.

title: Harlem Gateway Plan Passed by Commission
description: Redevelopment or an area described as the gateway to Harlem was speeded to ap proval yesterday in the City Planning Commission after two hours of testimony by several speakers in favor.

title: President Will Appear On Television Tonight
description: President Nixon's talk on Southeast Asia will be car ried live at 9 o'clock tonight by the three network tele vision stations here and by WPIXTV, Channel 11, and WNEWTV, Channel 5. WOR TV, Channel 9, will run a videotape of the talk at 1 A. M.

title: Cost of Beef Dinner Higher
description: The average cost of preparing a full course roast beef dinner for four in the New York area reached $5.91 in March, an in crease of 6 cents above Feb ruary and 56 cents more than March, 1969. Herbert Bienstock, regional director of the United States Department of Labor's Bureau of Labor Statistics, said this is the most a roast beef dinner had ever cost in the New Jersey area.

title: TransBeacon Files Petition Under the Bankruptcy Act
description: The TransBeacon Corpora tion has filed a petition for re organization under Chapter XI of the Federal Bankruptcy Act. In papers filed with the Federal District Court here on Monday, the motion picture theater op erator said it had current as sets of $837,385 and current liabilities of $1,576,196.

title: Kennedy Veracity Questioned By Judge in Kopechne Inquest
description: BOSTON, April 29The judge at the inquest into the death of Mary Jo Kopechne reported that he could not accept as the truth key elements of Sen ator Edward M. Kennedy's sworn testimony at the hearing.

title: and Escalation in Mideast
description: The reports that Soviet pilots are flying operational missions in defense of Egypt signify an ominous esca lation toward the Big Power confrontation that is in evitable if the drift toward another Middle Eastern war is not soon reversed.

title: Couple Married 69 Years
description: CANASTOTA, N. Y. (AP)  Some 300 relatives and friends were present when Mr. and Mrs. Howard Keville celebrated their 69th wedding anniversary. The couple has six children, all living in this area, and 24 grandchildren.

title: Senators, Friendly to Blackmun, Complete Hearing in Single Day
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 The Senate Judiciary Commit tee completed its hearings to day on the Supreme Court nom ination of Judge Harry A. Blackmun in a friendly, oneday session that produced no oppo sition to his confirmation.

title: SOUTH LAOS TOWN INVADED BY REDS
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, April 29 (Agence FrancePresse)North Vietnamese and Pathet Lao troops, in a sudden attack have captured most of Attopeu, a town 30 miles from the Cam bodian border in the southern tip of Laos, a military spokes man said today.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given In Daylight Saving Time

title: SILVER FUTURES WEAKEN IN PRICE
description: In active trading, silver fu tures weakened yesterday on the New York Commodity Ex change and continued the sharp downward trend established the day before.

title: Stock Exchange to ResumE Full Schedules on Monday
description: Stock exchange received ap proval from the securities and Exchange Commission yester day to go back on normal trad ing hours next Monday.

title: City U. Boycotted by Students Protesting Proposed Fee Rise
description: A student boycott began yes terday on most of the 17 cam puses of the City University of New York to protest the pro posed increase in fees at the university.

title: Hemophilia Fund Plans Ball With Fashion Show
description: A fashion show, including the work of such designers as Beene, Blass, Brooks, Cardin, de la Renta, Galanos, Halley, Lanvin and Norell, will be the feature of next Wednes day's Crystal Ball at the Plaza.

title: Garbage Theft Jails Two
description: PUEBLO, Colo. (AP)Two men were hooked in the city jail here on a charge of stel int garhbage. The two told the police they had planned to feed the loot to hogs.

title: Library Has Moratorium
description: ATLANTA (UPI)The At anta Public Library held a fiveday moratorium on overdue books, during which they could be returned without fines.

title: Advertising Life Salesmen Get a Pep Talk
description: Faced by a circulation and advertising rate cut by his archrival Look, Lee Heffner, Life's ad director, has dis patched a pep talk to his team that is worthy of Notre Dame's late Knute RocIme.

title: EDMOND W. TIPPING, AUSTRALIAN WRITER
description: SYDNEY, Australia, April 29Edmond William Tipping, one of Australia's bestknown journalists, died in Melbourne today after a long illness. His age was 54.

title: Welfare Workers on Strike
description: Bub ION, April 29 (AP) About 350 striking welfare workers and supporters pick eted the Massachusetts State House today to dramatize their demands for meaninful con tract negotiations. Local 509 of the Massachusetts Social Workers Guild, representing about 1,300 social workers across the state, voted last night to strike.

title: N.H.L. Playoffs
description: Pittsburgh vs. St. Louis

title: KNICKS SET BACK LAKERS, 111108
Technical Recovery Lifts Stock Prices
description: Prices on the New York Stock Exchange staged a sharp technical rally yesterday after the market had declined be cause of the news about Cam bodia. The DowJones indus trial average rose 13.06 points to 737.39, with most of its gain coming in the final hour.

title: BUTCHERS GATHER RELICS IN BRITAIN
description: LONDON.  Behind a tiny butcher shop in Driffield, York shire, stands an archeological museum known by few people, but which draws scholars from as far away as the Soviet Un ion, China and the United States.

title: Manchester City Wins Cup
description: VIENNA, Austria, April 29 (Reuters)  Manchester City of England won the European Cup Winners Cup when it beat Gornik Zabrze of Poland, 21, tonight.

title: Sitin at Stanford
description: STANFORD, Calif., April 29 (UPI)  Seventyfive students and about eight faculty mem bers staged a peaceful anti ROTC sitin today in Stanford University's Old Union building instead of starting an an nounced disruption of the of fice of the president, Kenneth Pitzer.

title: Thousands Hail Hirohito, 69
description: TOKYO, April 29 (UPI) Thousands of Japanese crowded ithe Imperial Palace grounds today to shout greetings to Emperor Hirohito on his 69th birthday.

title: Ballet Benefit Canceled
description: Tho New York City Ballet announced yesterday that, its annual gala benefit perform ance on May 7 would be can celed because of the current strike by the company's or chestra. A spokesman said new productions would not be ready in time even if the 10dayold strike were settled before the performance. The gala bene fits the company's production fund.

title: N.Y. Savings Banks Group Elects Officers for Year
description: The Savings Banks Associa tion of New York State yester day elected Walter R. Williams Jr., chairman of the Union Dime Savings Bank, as its pres ident for the coming year. Wil liam G. Morton, president of the Onondaga Savings Bank in Syracuse, was elected first vice president of the associa tion, and under its normal pro cedures will succeed Mr. Wil liams next year.

title: Observer That Sort of Thing
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 All right, all right, gentlemen! Enough of this futile weighing of alternatives. I need hard an swers. If we go in with nothing more than military equipment, what explanation can I give the American ueoule?

title: Test of Reason at Yale
description: As the letters we publish on this page today make clear, responsible voices among the students, faculty and administration at Yale University are trying hard, and for the moment effectively, to turn what at least one element on campus hoped would be a coercive strike into an expression of the college community's concern for justice to blacks. Even so, the strike seems to us a totally misdirected form of student activism, especially at an institution that can point to so creditable a record of responsiveness as Yale.

title: Homemade Bomb Is Found Near Harlem Police Station
description: A homemade pipe bomb was found early yesterday in front of the West 123d Street police station in Harlem.

title: RIJINSKY SCORES IN 2,000 GUINEAS
description: NEWMARKET, England, April 29 (UPI)  Favored Ni jinksy, owned by the American millionaire Charles Engelhard scored an easy victory today in the 2,000 Guineas, the first classic of the English racing season.

title: Novel Financing Deal
description: LONDON, April 29Floating rates, often debated as a pana cea for troubles in the foreign exchange markets, came to the international bond market to day in a hefty and unusual $425million financial deal for the Italian state electricity au thority.

title: SENATORS ANGRY
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 The Administration's decision to support a South Vietnamese military operation in Cambodia set off moves by leading Sen ators in both parties today to cut off funds for American military operation in Cambodia

title: Article 3  No Title
description: No Title

title: RUSKIN CHARGES KICKBACKS HERE
description: Robert K. Ruskin, the city's Commissioner of Investigation, said yesterday that his office was investigating the alleged misappropriation of city funds used in training and edu cating the hardcore unem ployed.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
description: The New York and American Stock Exchanges yesterday is isued their latest report or changes in share ownership by directors, officers and majoi stockholders. The lists includ ing the following:

title: DONALD C. NELSON
description: DUNELLEN, N. J., April 29 Donald C. Nelson, vice presi dent of the Ziegler Chemical & Mineral Company, Piscataway, died yesterday at the Somerset Valley Nursing home, Bridge water. He was 59 years old and lived at 523 Fourth Street.

title: Exit Permits Unlikely
description: ATHENS, April 29  The chances that the family of Theodorakis will get exit permits looked extremely slim tonight after his attack on the government.
